ark:/13030/qt00c9w848.title: Aurora Catastrophe
ark:/13030/qt00c9w848.description: A game about figuring out how to rebuild your space empire's fleet after a catastrophically bad engagement with an unknown enemy.

ark:/13030/qt00s1t3bq.title: A College Student's Saturday
ark:/13030/qt00s1t3bq.description: A College Student's Saturday is a game that simulates a college student's Saturday life. In this game, the protagonist is a college student, player will make decisions for him about what he is going to do on a Saturday. More imporantly, in order to win, player needs to make sure the protagonist completes his homework on time, so the purpose of this game is to learn how to have a proper balance between work and relax.

ark:/13030/qt00t0s285.title: Bird and Seek
ark:/13030/qt00t0s285.description: A bird was taken away by people when it was young without knowing its bird family and bird home. Then, it gets sold to a family with a kid who is a fan of birds and hears about a land of birds in the outside which can be its home. The bird starts to try to escape by hiding in different places. The kid in the family thinks it is hide and seek and starts playing hide and seek with the bird, and the bird has an option to find the kid too in hide and seek. Eventually, the bird finds an opportunity to escape. However, maybe the bird has actually found what it was looking for all along through playing hide and seek, a home and a family.

ark:/13030/qt018498sx.title: Gets to the exits
ark:/13030/qt018498sx.description:
Gets to the exits by Ziyang Li
Gets to the exits is an interactive fiction game where you act as an employee who work in a building of company A. Unfortunately, a fire takes place in the basement of the building while all the staff are working as usual. The fire is going up fast, what are you going to do? Are you going to escape from the building or to save all the staff? Are you going to save someoneâs life in the fire with the risk of being dead? What is the underlying cause of the whole fire event? As a player, every possibility is depended on your choices! There are three ends waiting for you to discover!

ark:/13030/qt01m2r5b7.title: Code:Sirius
ark:/13030/qt01m2r5b7.description:
Your are a secret agent whose mission is to assassinate another nation's commander-in-chief. During the mission, you may encounter a girl who could be in a relationship with the main character if the player choose so.
The players will have to make lots of decisions which could lead to death or success, so they have to choose carefully.

ark:/13030/qt02q2g3z4.title: Checkmate
ark:/13030/qt02q2g3z4.description:
Checkmate by Jordan Wong
Checkmate is a short, medieval themed, Telltale-style CYOA story. In true Telltale fashion, there's practically only one story, and your choices only affect small bits of the story, if any parts at all! There's also a small twist at the end of the story.

ark:/13030/qt03q625cw.title: Purpose of the Warrior
ark:/13030/qt03q625cw.description: See through the eyes of either Toshiro, Wanako, or Minoto as you traverse the aftermath of a battlefield in feudal Japan. These three friends come across many difficult decisions and dangerous situations. You will choose what these characters do in these instances. Will they all be able to make it out of the violence?

ark:/13030/qt03t1k1r6.title: EndALL-Virus
ark:/13030/qt03t1k1r6.description:
EndALL-Virus by Suriya Sundaram
In the midst of the real-life coronavirus ordeal, you are in a world where a virus has put humanity on the brink of extinction. The virus has taken everything you love from you. You have nothing left to lose. You are humanity's last hope... will you make the right decisions to save man-kind?

ark:/13030/qt03v5808v.title: Lost Kitty
ark:/13030/qt03v5808v.description:
Lost Kitty
You play as a lost cat. You wake up and do not know where you are.
You spend the game deciding how and when you want to make your way back home.
There are three endings.

ark:/13030/qt0410q252.title: Snowfall
ark:/13030/qt0410q252.description:
Snowfall was designed as a simple variation on the platformer genre, wherein you play a snowflake falling through the air trying to avoid dangers such as icicles and fiery snowflakes. In the game, snow-covered wooden platforms are generated at uneven time intervals and travel across the screen. These platforms can hinder or help the player, depending on how the player jumps or slides to stay within the screen.

Â 

The thematic material is light and fun, which is reflected in the up-beat, slightly-stressful music we selected. Although you play cute snowflake, there is still some element of stress in trying to avoid enemies and achieve as high a score as possible. Visually, we leaned into the lightheartedness of the game to present a very soft, bright looking game. The snowflake changes color depending on which power-ups are attained, and the cheery feel is amplified through soft sounds such as snow softly crunching when you land on a platform, or fire cracking softly when a fiery snowflake falls.

Â 

Though Snowfall follows the mechanical conventions of many other simple games such as Doodle Jump, it differs in that the player must gain skill in using the controls to dodge falling obstacles in addition to falling onto new platforms. Risk is rewarded because power-ups are randomly generated, and intentionally do not always pop up in places where they are easy to get. In this way, Snowfall differs from traditional platformers because it often must be played riskily to achieve high scores, and it can take quite a few games to get good enough at dodging to embrace such risks.

Â 

In creating this game, teamwork was key and is the first class concept that I would like to discuss. From the beginning, my partner and I took to a procedure where we worked a lot together, divided up the remaining tasks fairly, and then worked independently. This process led us to be successful as a team because both of us were equally skilled in creating mechanics and assets in Construct, so we were able to work cohesively at debugging and overall tuning very nicely. Though the lectures emphasized having distinct roles, we found that our emphasis on communicationâboth in person and via Google Docsâallowed us to have flexible roles without the misunderstandings. This was truly one of the best team experiences I have ever had, and I feel that getting to experience it while also learning a bit about effective team strategies really solidified the content for me.

Â 

As for the game itself, Snowfall engages the concept of behavioral conditioning because it is a bit addictive. By making having quick transitions between gameplay and the final score screen, we used operant conditioning to improve the likelihood that the player will play multiple times in a row. It is very likely that the player will die relatively quickly the first time they play the game because it takes time to learn controls well. Subsequently after losing, the player sees large letters suggesting that they play again. It makes sense that the player would choose to play again, because there is an appeal to their inner achieverâthrough displaying their scoreâto improve and get a higher score! The controls are intuitive enough that it only takes a couple of tries before the player can get significantly higher scores. Thus, we have eased them into a cycle wherein they play the game repeatedly. In all honesty, we were not thinking about this cycle at all when my partner and I came up with the game. However, the course material has revealed how the simple suggestions (having a score and replay button) have an effect on what people tend to do, and how game designers must be mindful of using these suggestions for good and to create a good experience for players.

Â 

As a last thought, playtesting was an exceptionally valuable part of this game making-process. Playtesters helped to show us that we needed a more challenging, dynamic gameâfrom the perspective of controlsâbut they also taught us a ton about clearly conveying cause and effect situations. When we created our power-ups, we thought that it would be clear what each one did, but players only saw a snowflake changing color. This forced us to try a wide variety of different animations, effects, and eventually sounds to communicate what was going on. Player feedback was the only way that we could find out if we were communicating clearly or not, and this ultimately improved our game.

ark:/13030/qt04v818v0.title: Desert Survival
ark:/13030/qt04v818v0.description: Desert survival is about finding the 3 keys in the dessert that unlock the treasures of the desert. Will you claim the treasure or die trying?

ark:/13030/qt0551b2pj.title: Interview
ark:/13030/qt0551b2pj.description: In the game Interview, protagonist is attending an interview, and trying to get the job by making choices to answering questions by the interviewer and succeed by these conversation. The player will experience a nervous and difficult interview and get a final result in the end. The player is going to experience the complicated story of interviewing.

ark:/13030/qt057138hx.title: Tokyo Bar 1960
ark:/13030/qt057138hx.description: A middle aged American in his vacation wondered into a small bar in Tokyo. He met a young college student at there who works as a part-time bartender. In June of 1960, the Anpo protests was at its peak. After hours of violence confrontations with police, students stormed into Japanâs national diet building (the top legislature building). A female student was killed at that day. The game follows a dialogue between two person. Via their lenses, a turmoil time where different political ideologies clashes gradually unveiled itself.

ark:/13030/qt0656107r.title: Artificial Anxiety
ark:/13030/qt0656107r.description:
Artificial Anxiety by Dominic Fanaris
It is the 31st century. You are an artificial intelligence within a manufactured body capable of perceiving every function, feeling, and emotion of human life. Even love. And your love is very special. It diverges from your normal programming. As such, no one knows about it, except for you and one other. At least, not yet.

ark:/13030/qt0694z0p2.title: Hermit
ark:/13030/qt0694z0p2.description: You are a hermit you lives in the woods, try to survive by Abraham Halim

ark:/13030/qt06b3331s.title: Ramen Restaurant Murder Case
ark:/13030/qt06b3331s.description: âRamen Restaurant Murder Caseâ is about a murder case that happened in a Japanese ramen restaurant. One of the customers is murdered by poison, the owner and his daughter are suspected as murderers but they insist they didnât kill him. Players should uncover the truth under the surface.

ark:/13030/qt06q7c4gh.title: The Island Escape
ark:/13030/qt06q7c4gh.description: You are trapped on an Island. You must navigate and the survive the island by making the right decisions.

ark:/13030/qt06w7h66f.title: Frog quest
ark:/13030/qt06w7h66f.description: You are a simple farmer on your way to town when you encounter a frog in your path. It seems like a simple scenario but what you choose to do when you encounter the frog, if you show it kindness or not, determines your fate.

ark:/13030/qt075410kp.title: People Like Inez
ark:/13030/qt075410kp.description:
People Like Inez by Lucas Rain Bryant
People Like Inez is a short piece of interactive fiction where the player is a mage in a world that does not much like his kind. They are tasked with observing a senate hearing in the fictional nation of Arcadia for the Equality of Mages Amendment, and they play through the couple of days surrounding that event. It's meant to be a sort of fantasy/film noir fusion kind of thing, and is supposed to help demonstrate the frustration one may feel about understanding their own position within a minority group.

ark:/13030/qt07d738fg.title: Alien Abduction
ark:/13030/qt07d738fg.description: You wake up in a barn, and you must find your way home, a very simple concept with multiple endings. Later you discover that you are in fact in a spaceship, and are given the choice of returning home or doing something more exciting.

ark:/13030/qt07j1n3ms.title: Project Exodus.
ark:/13030/qt07j1n3ms.description: You have just died and have a second chance at life. Make choices and find your way to the Evil King. Defeat the Evil King and face off against your arch-nemesis.

ark:/13030/qt09p749m2.title: Dancing Queen
ark:/13030/qt09p749m2.description:
Unexpected circumstances have lead Princess Erika to inheriting her late Mother's throne. Now, with the help of her little sister Kass, she must commit herself to becoming a responsible Queen, but her heart tells her to pursue her passion - dance. 

Dancing Queen is a time-management daily life sim about the stress and sacrifice that comes with balancing passion and responsibility. Explore the Castle and its Ballroom to rank up your regalness or rhythm, leading to secret events that inevitably affect Erika's perspective on where her priorities lie. At the end of the week, Erika will determine her future in one of five unique endings.

ark:/13030/qt09r139wf.title: Sleep
ark:/13030/qt09r139wf.description: Sleep is an interactive story where you live a day in the life of someone with depression who has just experienced a traumatic night. You are constantly faced with the choice of life and death, allowing the player to understand what it is like for someone with depression. The more you explore, the more you understand the thoughts of someone with depression. How will you handle your emotions? What fate will you choose?

ark:/13030/qt0b5285dz.title: Frank the Forager
ark:/13030/qt0b5285dz.description: Frank the Forager is a life dating sim about Frank and his obsession with foraging mushrooms. But, will foraging them be his final goal? Or will a new passion arise?

ark:/13030/qt0b9999k7.title: Chef's Special
ark:/13030/qt0b9999k7.description: You are the head chef in a disaster of a situation, can you save the restaurant?

ark:/13030/qt0bb278nd.title: This is the real life
ark:/13030/qt0bb278nd.description:
This is the real life by Longyu Li
You are going to fishing with your friends, but something bad happened.
A Suspense game with two ending. It's a puzzle game.

ark:/13030/qt0bq435mb.title: void
ark:/13030/qt0bq435mb.description: It is about the physical embodiment of the void, and its interaction with the physical embodiment of love. It is a very short game that doesn't have many endings because I had the idea that there is a specific person for you, so no matter what you choose you will either get together or just not be together for now.

ark:/13030/qt0c75k3ft.title: la forret
ark:/13030/qt0c75k3ft.description: You rented a cabin in the woods, and the lights went out. Try to survive and solve the problem.

ark:/13030/qt0c89k2m6.title: Woods
ark:/13030/qt0c89k2m6.description: Zard wakes up in a woods. There is a sign on his forearm. He has to escape from the woods. But what about the sign?

ark:/13030/qt0c94g9xf.title: Knights
ark:/13030/qt0c94g9xf.description: A small RPG story game with a unique battle and party system

ark:/13030/qt0cb3w034.title: Bi Thomas
ark:/13030/qt0cb3w034.description:
Bi Thomas by Patrick Queiroz
You play as Thomas, a college student dealing with an identity crisis and anxiety.
In this game the player lives a month or so in the shoes of this boy, and will be able to experience life in the eyes of someone in his situation.

ark:/13030/qt0cs862nm.title: Fly Simulator
ark:/13030/qt0cs862nm.description: You play as a fly trapped in a house! Escape as fast as you can before running out of time! Pick up apples to regain lost time. Be careful, if you bump into obstacles, you lose time! Try and find all the secrets and beat your best score!

ark:/13030/qt0cz706h0.title: The Little Things
ark:/13030/qt0cz706h0.description: In this text-based choice game, you experience daily life under lockdown through the eyes of a highly sensitive person. Complete tasks and learn real life coping tools for managing stress and anxiety.

ark:/13030/qt0d54k6k6.title: Murder Mysteries Case
ark:/13030/qt0d54k6k6.description: You are a detective that trying to solve a murder case where Jenifer Lopez has murder at a hotel and your mission is to find evidence, integrate the suspect, and piece together all your finding to find the real culprit behind the murder.

ark:/13030/qt0dg7082z.title: The Void In Our Sky
ark:/13030/qt0dg7082z.description:
The Void In Our Sky by Andres Benitez
The Void In Our sky is an interactive game in which you play as an astronaut on your first big launch to the moon but it goes bad and now you have to manage to save yourself from being stranded in space.

ark:/13030/qt0dm2164x.title: Christmas Catastrophe
ark:/13030/qt0dm2164x.description: You are a parent of a young boy and girl. It is Christmas Eve and all the presents have disappeared! It is your task to find them before the kids wake up and Christmas is ruined!

ark:/13030/qt0fk0p5b7.title: THE CHIMP
ark:/13030/qt0fk0p5b7.description:
THE CHIMP by Daniel Wild
THE CHIMP Tells the story of an alternate universe, in which the player is a scientist defending the USA from a Military Grade Russian Attack Chimp launched by Cuba.
You must do your duty and stop the chimp at your house before it tears through the rest of the country. 
A comedic game with a large amount of endings.

ark:/13030/qt0fq254zs.title: Pauline Is Kong
ark:/13030/qt0fq254zs.description: Pauline Is Kong is a reimplement and reskin version of the game Donkey Kong. In Pauline Is Kong, Pauline is the one throwing the barrels while Donkey Kong is the one trying to capture something, all while trying to avoid getting hit by the barrels. The player plays as Donkey Kong and must capture the bananas on each level before losing all their lives to win, otherwise, they lose.

ark:/13030/qt0gq4v0cg.title: Human as Livestock
tags: I want to write a story that metaphors the history of human exploitation. I hope to achieve a cult-movie-like experience in the game. At the same time

I also hope players can explore every option in each room since the hidden information of some options in the room will be triggered under certain conditions. I made some attempts to make the links richer.

ark:/13030/qt0gq7s8wr.title: Find your soulmate
ark:/13030/qt0gq7s8wr.description:
I used the theme 'Soulmate' for my game.
Based on the TA feedback, I added a quiz about the soul mate. I added a story to hell if the quiz was wrong, a story to heaven if it was right, and put the ending that the user was curious about.

I also received the following feedback from users in the alpha version of the test.
- There is no image in the game.
- I want you to visually show the animals.
- I want to have an image of the animal when the results for the soulmate come out.
- I wish there was an ending to Good Place or Bad Place.
I have satisfied all of the above in the beta version.

My game allows younger children to study animals.
In fact, I also looked at a lot of wikis while creating the game and tried to include as many of the features of the animal classifications as possible in the game.
The educational use of games is my goal.

ark:/13030/qt0hc1d7dh.title: ASCOMYCOTA
ark:/13030/qt0hc1d7dh.description:
Ascomycota is an interactive fiction game that aims to emulate the experience of having an eating disorder and how that can make one feel as though they're trapped on one path, with one set outcome and no exit in sight. You begin in a hospital, being told you're dying, and throughout the majority of the game slip in and out of memories from the past that give insight into your downward spiral. However, all is not so bad, as if you make the choices that open up discussion and the opportunity to accept love, as well as really explore the world, you may just find your way out of the destructive cycle and into the true, happy ending.
Two Endings.

ark:/13030/qt0hd13519.title: Gazing of the deer
ark:/13030/qt0hd13519.description:
Theme word: Deer

----------------------------------------

Through this game, I want to see whether players can decide not to hunt deer even though the game emphasized that the purpose of the game is to hunt deer.

I don't want players to be under the control of the game, instead, I wanted them to decide with their own feeling, and think carefully whether they should follow the wrong and weird description.

In this game, deers are depicted as a mysterious, sacred and kind animal; they even help players when players are about to be attacked by wolves at the lot in late night. This makes players feel uncomfortable when they decides to hunt deers.

ark:/13030/qt0hp860sc.title: Ooze Party
ark:/13030/qt0hp860sc.description: Ooze party is a fun reskin of the popular game Wii Tanks.  It aims to recreate the experience and challenge that Wii Tanks offered.  Added to the game are new mechanics, different enemy types, and powerups to spice up the gameplay.  Overall, it is a fun game with more and more challenging levels.  Give it a try!

ark:/13030/qt0hr2s8z9.title: The Cavern
ark:/13030/qt0hr2s8z9.description: In the game, you play as a teenager who has just been in a bus crash. The bus crashed into a cavern, but luckily, or unluckily, they were the only person on the bus besides the bus driver. The game deals with mental health issues, and also has horror aspects.

ark:/13030/qt0hw2v6bh.description:
I choose the theme Traffic in this Twine game beta version. I'm actually not sure if this is the final version because I've revised too many times that I couldn't exact remember which one is which. I wanted the player to feel lost and the end of future world. The ending for this game is kind sad because people over-used the earth so there is nothing left. Hope you like this one. 

Kaisen

ark:/13030/qt0j2757f6.title: One Love, One Life
ark:/13030/qt0j2757f6.description:
One Love, One Life by Ryca Zhang
One Love, One Life is an interactive story game where you play as a traveler who is traveling around the world. One day, you meet a strange girl at a village. The girl asks you to help her look for her master. 
Be prepared to cry if you play until the end.

ark:/13030/qt0j34n2cv.title: SpyStory
ark:/13030/qt0j34n2cv.description: A link-based game where the player is a spy attempting to infiltrate an enemy base. Players will solve puzzles in order to progress.

ark:/13030/qt0kf8h4ph.title: Murder Mystery
ark:/13030/qt0kf8h4ph.description: The protagonist is of a wealthy lineage he and some family members are at a get together at a mansion far off in the beautiful country side. Yet during this get together a family member was found dead. Itâs up to the protagonist to find out what happened and who is responsible.

ark:/13030/qt0m629856.title: Surreal
ark:/13030/qt0m629856.description:
Surreal by Diana C. Rivera
Surreal tells a story about a regular person enjoying a road trip with their partner. Sleep is necessary when on a road trip and this story tells the many dreams or reality that the person is dreaming or actually seeing. The goal of the game is for the player to depict the differences if they can.

ark:/13030/qt0mc7k9kq.title: Saving Love for Valentine's Day
ark:/13030/qt0mc7k9kq.description: Saving Love for Valentine's day presents a quest of a college student attempting to rescue his significant other by his first Valentine. In his journey, the main character is in a time constraint and has various mental/physical obstacles that may affect the outcome of the game.

ark:/13030/qt0mn5k22k.title: Pain down Memory Lane
ark:/13030/qt0mn5k22k.description:
The protagonist goes to therapy, and he inadvertently uncovers some secrets when he arrives.
Try to get all the endings!

ark:/13030/qt0mp3n4tt.title: Social Anxiety University
ark:/13030/qt0mp3n4tt.description: You play as a college student with Social Anxiety and you can make choices that involve making friends.

ark:/13030/qt0mx1x3n4.title: Just Let Me Adore You
ark:/13030/qt0mx1x3n4.description: In Just Let Me Adore You, the protagonist is a broke, teenage girl whose main objective is to get into the pit of a Harry Styles concert. There are multiple outcomes. It may even be better than ending up in the pit. The player faces three "plans" that shape the way the rest of the story is going to go.

ark:/13030/qt0mx645fq.title: Remember
ark:/13030/qt0mx645fq.description: Remember is about a ghost trying to figure out what happened to them and why they were brought back as a ghost. The setting for the game is in the present, but the discovery of memories takes the player to the past for brief moments in order to remember what happened and who they are.

ark:/13030/qt0n0806nj.title: Trafficking
ark:/13030/qt0n0806nj.description: I chose the theme traffic. I use this word in the most obvious sense of like car traffic in some of the memory flashbacks but I mostly use the other definition of traffic as in trafficking illegal goods, in this case endangered species. I wanted my game to have lots of possible paths that are somewhat determined by the player and somewhat determined by chance, just like life. So I used random functions here and there as well as choices. I also wanted to provide more background for players who like to go more in depth while offering the option to skip past the background/detail-y stuff so I set up stretch-text type descriptions which, in addition to providing more description of objects and surroundings in the game world, internally set up the opportunity to randomly get a flashback in a later passage. I hoped that players who wanted more information would get a more vivid image of the world and get a back story about the character's past as a normal kid wanting adventure and magic, a background unavailable to players who didn't look closely at things. In the background/flashback material I wanted to show a character longing for this fantasy adventure that they've read about and then in the present-trafficking world they are in a world of adventure and fantastical creatures. Are they dreaming? Are they dead? Are they really in the fantasy world? What, if anything, is real here? I hoped these questions might come up for some players.

ark:/13030/qt0nc0z0k6.title: Dream State
ark:/13030/qt0nc0z0k6.description:
Dream State by Palash Raval
An intruder has broken into your house while you were asleep. Now you find yourself in a strange land filled with unrealistic situations and must find a way to escape before the intruder completes whatever it set out to do.

ark:/13030/qt0nr505tx.title: ROAD RAGE: DEER!!!
ark:/13030/qt0nr505tx.description:
Our game, ROAD RAGE: DEER!!!, is a simple game in which the player can control a deer running on a highway. Your only goal is to dodge the vehicles coming to you from the top of the screen. The further you go along the road, the higher the score will be. The goal for this game, as of the goal for any games, is to make the player feel fun. In doing that, we made the game simple in its form and control but challenging. The player experience is a core to make a good game, as we talked in class. Thus this game is designed in such a way that one can play during oneâs short spared time, for example, when having a noon break at work. For gameplay, we made the game to have a third-person fixed camera view from above. In such a way you can pay attention to the vehicles from above while controlling the deer, and make early decisions to doge in certain directions before the vehicles got near to the deer. The game control is very simple, you can just move the deer left or right in a fixed speed, yet to make itâs simple but challenging and fun, we made a bunch of different types of vehicles with different speed depending on their type, some of them also have accelerations, which means they can get faster and faster over time, making the game more challenging over time. For example, the race car in the game has a big acceleration, but it also appears on the screen less frequently than other vehicles. To make itâs challenging and at the same time playable, we added a sound effect for the race car. So every time it comes out you can hear a warning and the sound of speed up can make the player more excited. For the art style, we choose 2D pixel style. This art style not just because it keeps the game simple and intuitive, but also makes the game less realistic. In such a way when the deer explodes when hit a car, people would feel less uncomfortable compared to seeing an actual deer die.

Another class concepts we engaged in our game is about choosing art style: the level of abstract. In the class, we talked about how the level of abstract of the characters can affect the feeling of the player. The more abstract the expression is in art style, the more strong the emotion and be demonstrated, and make the player substitute more into the game. When we are deciding what art style to use, as I talked in the first part of this essay, we are thinking about what itâs level of abstract should be. One crucial reason we choose 2D pixel is that its an abstract style, and this style can greatly reduce the realistic of the characters: deer, cars, and explosions, while demonstrating the part we want. If we make the deer very like a real one, then it might be very violent when it hit a car and explode. But by making it pixel-like, we emphasized the explosion and running of the deer, and decreased the violence level.Â 

This game was originally inspired by the chrome dinosaur game, in which you can control a dinosaur and jump to dodge the obstacles, the scoring system for our game is similar to that of the chrome game. Yet the innovation of our game is found in making the player view from above, make the obstacles coming to you instead of moving to obstacles, and instead of jumping to dodge using moving to dodge. A funny video found online about a lost deer running in a city in Japan and jumped over the fence and fall into a river also inspired us. The topic of the game is about deer and traffic, which perfectly combined two of the keywords for this project. We innovatively made the different types of vehicles in this game to have different features in speed, making such a looping game less repeating. Also, our game has an explosion effect for the deer when it hits a car instead of the flicker effect for most similar games like Floppy Bird; and the present of pixel art style with simple animations makes the game cute and energetic(Just like its name!).Â  Those are the futures you canât find in other games.

I asked three of my friends playtest this game. Two of them, without much game-playing experience, found itâs too hard to play at the beginning. I found out it probably because the starting position of the deer is facing the starting position of the race car, the fastest car in this game. So we changed the starting position of the deer and cars a little bit to make it easier to start with. After this change two of the playtesters feel its a funny and challenging game, but one of them still feels it's too hard. One of the reason might be he was playing with a phone and the control by touching the screen is not very good, due to the size of the game viewport. But all of them do like the music and sound effect of the game and told me its very suitable for such a highway-dodging game.

ark:/13030/qt0p20q7mx.title: You are a sword.
ark:/13030/qt0p20q7mx.description: You are a sword. You are a weapon, a tool. An extension of the hand that wields you, with no will of your own. In this game, though the player does have control over the narrative, exactly HOW they are supposed to exert that control is unclear...what kind of sword will you be?

ark:/13030/qt0ph4j9m5.title: Sawney Piano
ark:/13030/qt0ph4j9m5.description:
An explosion at a concert
But you're back in the past
You will need to find notes for entering the lucid dream state in order to back to 1920
You will also use the power of lucid dreams to change history and save everything
11 endings

ark:/13030/qt0ps5m0tc.title: Space Hockey
ark:/13030/qt0ps5m0tc.description: It's basically air hockey with space ships. Knock the meteor into your opponent's goal and destroy their side of space. It's meant to be played on a touch screen with two players.

ark:/13030/qt0r5032g5.title: All the light We Cannot See
ark:/13030/qt0r5032g5.description:
All the Light We Cannot See by Nathanael Fonken
All the Light We Cannot See is a story where the player has to choose between taking pride in their blindness or trying to get rid of it at the cost of others.

ark:/13030/qt0r9726qk.title: Lab Day
ark:/13030/qt0r9726qk.description: This game follows a lab intern on their first day of work. They have the ability to explore the lab and discover multiple endings depending on the actions they take. The game has a focus on puzzle solving as the main story line.

ark:/13030/qt0rp524s7.title: Inviatation From the Void Planet Concert
ark:/13030/qt0rp524s7.description: One day, you get a inviatation from Void planet. When you get to there, you were involved in a murder case. Do you want to help the police solve the case or leave alone?

ark:/13030/qt0rp5x7kt.title: touchdown
ark:/13030/qt0rp5x7kt.description: Touchdown tells the story of a famous detective Albert Spade. Throughout the story, he will be decrypting puzzles in order to capture a criminal.

ark:/13030/qt0s15t1xj.title: Love's Choice
ark:/13030/qt0s15t1xj.description: A boy is trying to find his significant other, depending on his choices, it will decide how is love life will turn out.

ark:/13030/qt0s73k0d0.title: The Collector
ark:/13030/qt0s73k0d0.description: The Collector is a 2D movement-based platformer with only 1 level. The player starts off with little information of their movement controls other than the basic up/down left/right. As the player progresses, they begin to learn more skills which can now be used upon when the player resets. Chimes are a core mechanic in the game as it can be used as a powerup or as health. The game ends once the player runs out of chimes so management of resources is also a core aspect of the game.

ark:/13030/qt0sp3d15t.title: Space Mechanic
ark:/13030/qt0sp3d15t.description:
You are an mechanic on a spaceship, it is your job to keep everything running.

You are nearing the end of a year-long journey and are running dangerously low on supplies, but if you can keep everything running for a few more days you'll make it to your destination and be able to restock.

ark:/13030/qt0th4j66c.title: Slimekiller
ark:/13030/qt0th4j66c.description: A reskin version game of stealth ninja with clear winning concept and smooth art style. Player has to control the protagonist to navigate the level to find the key for opening the door for next level. Key will be guarded by monsters and player could kill them through fire bullets. There are four levels in total, the last level has a boss in it. The player has to beat the boss in order to win the game.

ark:/13030/qt0v252881.title: Time in Memorial
ark:/13030/qt0v252881.description: Time in Memorial is an interactive fiction media where you are someone with amnesia who is stuck in time. You must attempt to get time to flow again in a city where everything is almost, but is never going to if you don't get time going, collapse.

ark:/13030/qt0v64k6pz.title: Masculine Simulator
ark:/13030/qt0v64k6pz.description: A game that exposes masculinity from the perspective of a prospective student who plays sports and is trying to maintain his relationship with his dad at home.
tags: masculine father identity expose perspective high-school

ark:/13030/qt0v94v32j.title: Spaceship Mishap
ark:/13030/qt0v94v32j.description:
Spaceship Mishap by Holden Spencer
Spaceship Mishap brings you along the path of someone lost in space, you are accompanied by a close friend and run into many problems along the way. Many difficult decisions arise along the way forcing you to decide in life and death situations.

ark:/13030/qt0vp85105.title: The Road
ark:/13030/qt0vp85105.description: My topic words is traffic, and I put that topic in my game by using the main item, car, in my game

ark:/13030/qt0w96s3wp.title: A Test
ark:/13030/qt0w96s3wp.description: You wake up in a dark room and find out yourself is in a weird situation. You need to search the surroundings and find out the way out and defeat the enemies so that you can pass the test.

ark:/13030/qt0wh4r1dp.title: Juice to the Beat!
ark:/13030/qt0wh4r1dp.description: Juice to the Beat! is a game about a ninja who must avoid interacting with bombs at all costs. You can go for a high score, just make sure that you don't get hit or else the game will end. Having a sense of rhythm is not required, but it sure will help.

ark:/13030/qt0x2357c0.title: Lying to your boss simulator
ark:/13030/qt0x2357c0.description:
Keywords: traffic, deer
Story lines included to incorporate these themes. Player can get stuck in traffic / haunted by a ghost deer depending on their decisions. I wanted to emphasize that the obvious answer isn't alway the right one. In the end, being lazy and becoming a pirate are the most effective answers.  I also wanted there to be multiple ways to win / lose depending on how you proceed through the game. You can make a bunch of correct decisions then go back to your old life, causing the story to restart. Some decisions are forced, some will cause you to win/ lose immediately, some will simply allow the game to proceed. I tried to further emphasize these different linking ideologies by reworking the text. Additionally, the difficulty selector can transport you to a winning scenario, a neutral scenario, or a losing scenario depending on the player's selection, an additional form of story linking that provides a more complete overview of the story for the user.

ark:/13030/qt0x35836m.title: Undo
ark:/13030/qt0x35836m.description: Undo is an interactive game where the player seems to be trapped in a vicious time cycle of reliving the same traumatic event. They begin by finding themself stuck in a hospital and each time they reenter the loop, the player must determine the right path to go back and save their loved one.

ark:/13030/qt0x55s491.title: Dungeon Quest
ark:/13030/qt0x55s491.description: Dungeon Quest is a choose your adventure game where you play as a talented adventurer braving the darkness of a forgotten dungeon in search of a powerful artifact.

ark:/13030/qt0x7845kf.title: Birthday Yacht Murder Case
ark:/13030/qt0x7845kf.description:
Birthday Yacht Murder Case by Neo Zhang
You play as a New York Crime Investigator who was invited to a luxurious birthday party by a classmate you met back in college. You are enjoying the party when suddenly the birthday girl was murdered in what appeared to be a locked room murder. You have to gather evidences and find out the truth behind this unfortunate birthday evening.

ark:/13030/qt0x9663d1.title: Stranded and Lost
ark:/13030/qt0x9663d1.description: You wake up in a desert not knowing who you are and where you're from. You make decisive decisions throughout your journey. Your goal is to survive

ark:/13030/qt0z28d5hq.title: Broken Feathers
ark:/13030/qt0z28d5hq.description: Delivery man meets a strange individual with a strange fascination with pineapples????

ark:/13030/qt0z345443.title: School Day
ark:/13030/qt0z345443.description:
School Day by Miguel Cedillo
You are a 4th grade boy waking up for school.
You can pick what you want to do from a couple varied options.
Your days seem repetitive in a way, like the choices you make ultimately... don't matter.
This game is a simulation of school for young children who have very small amounts of control over their lives.

ark:/13030/qt0zf3q99g.title: The Trial
ark:/13030/qt0zf3q99g.description: The Trial is an interactive fiction game based on the popular party game Mafia. As the player, you can choose to play the role of a civilian or a Mafia member. Both of these roles lead two different unique stories. On the way, your character will have to make crucial decisions to determine who lives and dies in the story. Can you make it out alive?

ark:/13030/qt0zp2730q.title: Abraham
ark:/13030/qt0zp2730q.description: An officer in the Red Army is put in terrible situation after terrible situation.

ark:/13030/qt1006t3f0.title: The Big Koi
ark:/13030/qt1006t3f0.description: The Big Koi follows the day a woman named Hana resolves to make a name for herself in the little fishing town she calls home. You help her make decisions and do things that will determine whether or not she is able to do this.

ark:/13030/qt1050f55t.title: Human Takeover
ark:/13030/qt1050f55t.description:
The commander of a squadron that has landed on an alien planet
You make a series of choices that alternate between befriending aliens and going against them
This game makes the player paranoid of whether they can choose to trust the aliens or go against them
It's a twist on the alien takeover on a human planet
There are three endings to this game.

ark:/13030/qt1058r2zq.title: Jungle Adventure
ark:/13030/qt1058r2zq.description: Jungle Adventures immerses the player into the crazy world of our protagonist, who is prepared for a normal wedding in the jungle. However, things quickly fall out of plans and the player is thrust into a survival adventure.

ark:/13030/qt10963086.title: Unfinished Homework
ark:/13030/qt10963086.description: Unfinished Homework  tells the story about a teenager who stuck on his homework and needs to ask his dad for help. Little does he know that getting help on his homework will not be as easy as it seems. This game puts the player into the role of the character in order to create a more personal connection between the game character and the player.

ark:/13030/qt10b1t0tr.title: What Do You See
ark:/13030/qt10b1t0tr.description: My game is set on a road that passes through a dense forest(basically the middle of nowhere). The game is about a person who sees a long streak of blood on the road and decides to investigate.

ark:/13030/qt10z9c6v7.title: Scandalous in the Sky
ark:/13030/qt10z9c6v7.description: A reality dating game sim loosely based on the show love island. Your job is to find the love of your life and win the grand prize

ark:/13030/qt112345v7.description:
I chose the theme "soulmate", and made a game describing going trip to Rome with  soulmate.
I wanted to make the player to have choice as they're really on the trip. But on the first game, it was quite boring because there wasn't any surprising events. So I added some random events to make player more fun.

ark:/13030/qt1184n64j.title: Sleepless Dream
ark:/13030/qt1184n64j.description:
Sleepless Dream by Lucinda Shen
You wake up noticing something unusual in your situation. However, mostly everything seems to be fine inside your house. Care to figure out what is bothering you?

ark:/13030/qt11g3m2bz.title: Mortality
ark:/13030/qt11g3m2bz.description:
Mortality by Brandon McDonald
You're an adventurer, and you want to eat and sleep tight this month.
Idols sell for a lot. Unfortunately they're usually cursed.
Don't get eaten.
An exploration/narrative/horror game. 8 endings.

ark:/13030/qt11w5b36k.title: Schizonesia
ark:/13030/qt11w5b36k.description:
Schizonesia by Angela Wang
The protagonist is hit by a car and rushed to the hospital where they can make decisions which affect how their recovery goes. Some endings are good while most are eventful and take a turn for the worst.

ark:/13030/qt1296v2fk.title: robots with love
ark:/13030/qt1296v2fk.description: Robots with love is a link-based game that sets player in a story about robots. In future, robots are able to have feelings. When they are upset, their system send out signals, and these signals can be detected by the Utopian, then the Utopian send out signals to tell them that they can choose to leave their work and go to the Utopian. Player will be in John, a investigator's role to finish his or her mission.

ark:/13030/qt12h09421.title: In the Wrong Place at the Wrong Time
ark:/13030/qt12h09421.description: CYOA game about a women with memory loss who is accused of a crime

ark:/13030/qt12w4140x.title: (Haven't come up with a name yet)
ark:/13030/qt12w4140x.description: The protagonist is an AI programmer who works with scientists. One day for fun, they create an AI that calculates how long it takes till the world becomes uninhabitable due to climate change. Surprisingly, it pops out an answer. What do they do?

ark:/13030/qt1301b7h8.title: Plane Crash
ark:/13030/qt1301b7h8.description: Plane Crash is a choose-your-own adventure interactive story game. After you and your wife, Rebecca, end up surviving a plane crash among a group of others, you must decipher who you can and can't trust, and use your survival instincts to help get as many people off the island.

ark:/13030/qt1328t3fk.title: Book
ark:/13030/qt1328t3fk.description: Book allows the player to play as a book in search of a bookshelf who is being guided by a passive aggressive narrator. The story is fairly linear but offers a fun and interesting narrative of a book on a quest.

ark:/13030/qt1558d2g3.title: Penguin
ark:/13030/qt1558d2g3.description:
Penguin by Grant Sherman 
Penguin tells its story from a first person perspective of the player unexpectedly waking up as a penguin and figuring out how they arrived at this situation. Will the player live out their lives as a penguin, or will they finally get out.

ark:/13030/qt15m8q7fj.title: Rokon Station
ark:/13030/qt15m8q7fj.description: Rokon Station by Jared Law: Rokon station tells the story of a person who wakes up alone on a damaged space station. The player is tasked with navigating different rooms and collecting items to help them navigate the game's story as they search for a way to escape.

ark:/13030/qt15s162xj.title: What's That Sound?
ark:/13030/qt15s162xj.description: An ominous mystery narrative where you are a spiritual entity unaware that you have become one. Not knowing what exactly happened to you, you visit a friend to try and put the pieces of this mystery together.

ark:/13030/qt15z7w0jq.title: Maze Pusher
ark:/13030/qt15z7w0jq.description: A lone adventurer is stuck in a rock maze, and must find a way out! Push rocks, cut bushes, as you make your way through the this complex rock maze!

ark:/13030/qt163124p0.title: Slab City
ark:/13030/qt163124p0.description: A game about your experiences in Slab City

ark:/13030/qt16s0v167.title: Witch_vs_Deer (Ver4.5)
ark:/13030/qt16s0v167.description:
Jun Hee Heo: Our gameâs title is âWitch vs. Deerâ. It is a 2 player PvP game, using mouse and keyboard. We wanted to make a simple and easy game that takes only few minutes. The background story of our game is: âOnce upon a time, there were deers living in a forest. One day, pandemic hit the deer group and the only cure is the magic apple. The deer who brings the apple would be the leader of the group. A deer decided to go to get the magic apple. However, to get the apple, he should fight the witch. The witch, who lived peacefully inside the forest, was suffering because of the noise made by deer groups. And what? A deer is going to steal my magic apple? That could not be happen!â

Our game is a 2D game. There is a title page written âWitch vs. Deerâ and if you click âplayâ button below the title, there will be a short introduction about the gameâs story. After few seconds, the screen will move to the âgame playâ screen. One person will be the defender and other will be the attacker. Attacker is at the top and defender is located at the bottom. The players only move horizontally and the items only move vertically. The attacker (witch), throw magics down in a certain frequency. The attacker can control the witch with mouse. The witch will follow the mouse only moving right and left. Also, witch has a skill which has a cool time of 9 seconds. If the witch is prepared to use the skill, witch will turn into pink and attacker can shoot pink laser by clicking left mouse. Witch will win when she success attacking the deer. The defender (deer) need to dodge from the magic and laser, and get enough number of magic apples. The deer can move using left and right arrow keys. The magic apples will fall down once in 5 seconds randomly. Also, there is a shield item that falls down randomly. If deer gets shield, he will be invincible for few seconds. Deer will gain victory if he earns 5 apples.

The class concepts used for this game is âdeerâ and âfallingâ. As described at the background story of the game, one of the players will be a deer. We chose this concept because the idea came right into our brain when we knew one of the concepts was deer. Also, I wanted to draw a deer for our game too. Magic apple falls down from the top. Falling is an important component because it is one of the rules in the gameplay. Falling objects work as vertical movements and players make horizontal movements. The control innovates our game. Our game is a PvP game which one player control with mouse and other player control with keyboard. Other PvP games usually use only keyboard or mouse or have turns if they use both. However, our game uses both mouse and keyboards. Also, the players do not compete with same rules, but each character has different rules of winning, skill, and items. That is, most of the players of our games will try to play the game at least twice. Also, we have a fairytale like background story too. The images from the game is all made by us too. The idea was from âGallagâ and âPongâ. At âGallagâ, the player shoots missiles constantly and âPongâ is a 2 player game which the players can move only horizontally. The game is not so innovative technically compared with other games because we had lack of time.After feedbacks from TA and friendâs playtesting, we fixed some parts of the game and added new things. There was a feedback that witch wins almost every time because the witch had way more faster speed. We adjusted the speed of the witch and deer. Also the acceleration of deer changed because the witch had fast speed and the deer became too slow when he changed the direction. The collision was strange when the deer collided with the apple. It changed direction strangely. We solved that problem also. There were some feedbacks which the game was too much simple, so we added new skill for the witch and items for the deer.

Changwan ParK: First, the game story. You are a happy dear living with other happy dears. Dears live together and made a dear village. However, the witch does not like the dear because they are so happy. The witch crafted some pandemic, and made it hit the dear party. Now almost every deer is dying, and you became a dear scientist and work on finding the cure. You found out that the only cure is the apple, which can be looted at the witchâs house. If you get the cure, you will be the leader of the group, and deer will thrive. If not, there will be deer left on earth. You attack the witchâs house to collect the apples for rescuing the deer village.Next, the gameplay. There are two players in the game, and the game has two rounds. At each round, two players are assigned to attacker and defender. Defender's character is deer, and can move the character left and right by pressing left and right keys on keyboard. There are two items for the defender. First item is the shield. It will fall vertically towards the defender. This will make the defender invincible for 4.5 seconds. The second item is apple. The defender's goal is to collect 5 apples. After collecting those, defender wins and becomes a deer leader. If defender overlaps with enemies (green asterisk shaped thing), the attacker wins unless the defender has the shield activated. Attacker's character is witch. Attacker can move the character left and right by moving mouse curser left and right way. There are no items for witch, but enemies will automatically spawn at the attacker's position, having constant horizontal velocity, falling towards defender. The attacker's goal is to control its position, make the enemies hit the defender. Attacker has a special ability to shoot purple laser, which has bigger collision box and high speed, likely to hit the defender. Attacker's special ability has a 9 second of cool time, and it can be activated by pressing left click. The attacker's win condition is to kill defender before defender collects five apples.Third, the aesthetic goals of our game. Actually the plot is pretty weak. Why the which hates the happy deer? But still, I can argue that there are some awkward people who does not like other people happy in real life. They spread inappropriate ideas to nearby people and contaminate the gloomy feeling. These are the witches. In contrast, all the happy people, who runs the society, can be referred to the deer. Deerâs goal is not just steal an apple and cure the world, but first to get near to damaged soul of witches. Apples are set to represent all the bad ideas that witches have, and neutralize it by using happiness of dear.The game is designed as 2D. I will claim that the game has the third person view, since the attacker and the defender can view themselves and the opponent. If the game was designed in the first person view, All the views will be in one dimensional shape, since the total game is in 2D. Therefore, players would not be able to distinguish apples from enemies and shield, and even the game character. By using third person view for designing our game, the players can learn the opponentâs movement and will try to enhance the winning rate, by becoming more successful in dodging the enemies, or getting better in triggering collisions between the defender and the enemy.Frankly, I do not think the game is super innovative compared with other games. We had a lack of time, and rushed to make the game playable. However, we can polish our project goals, which was heavily discussed in the third paragraph. Redesign of the images or even reconstructing the game in 3D might be helpful for being innovative compared to other games. I meant that the game is distinguishable by the intention of the game.The playtesting part was quite interesting. TA gave us some strong feedbacks, which gave us lots of insight. Actually, we have never playtested our game when we submitted the alpha version. In consequence, as the TA said, the witch won every time. Therefore, we have adjusted the values of the speed of the defender and the attacker. The actual speed values were decided by multiple playtesting. Also, the collision was really weird, so we tweaked the collision box in order to make the gameplay not wanky but smooth. Without the constructive feedback, our game may have led to super boring, trivial game.

ark:/13030/qt16v092vz.title: Lost Through Hell
ark:/13030/qt16v092vz.description:
You end up in hell on accident and you have to find way out.
A link-based game. Eleven endings. Can you manage to escape or end up dying in hell?

ark:/13030/qt16v1g50x.title: Dream Link
ark:/13030/qt16v1g50x.description:
Dream Link by Noctis Wang
Dream Link is an interactive fiction where the you experience stories and different choices you can take while in your dream world.

ark:/13030/qt1747s8g5.title: Unknown
ark:/13030/qt1747s8g5.description: Folklore horror, about taking care of a baby doll. If you are rude, you are brave, but it will be angry; if you are respectful, it will not.

ark:/13030/qt17b4471b.title: Spacesruise
ark:/13030/qt17b4471b.description:
Space, the final frontier. You are aboard the Starship, something. You can't seem to remember. And hey, where is everybody? Everything looks broken and destroyed... Where am I? Who am I?
What's out there?

ark:/13030/qt18k5w8pz.title: Space Trader
ark:/13030/qt18k5w8pz.description:
Space Trader by Oscar Reksoatmodjo
Space Trader is a very serious space game where you are a space trader captain trying to repair your ship. As you wander around the port, you'll explore the various dangerous locales and hopefully find a way to repair your ship. You might dance, you might drink, you might get lost in the void along the way.

ark:/13030/qt18x2p8bd.title: Ultra Alien Escape
ark:/13030/qt18x2p8bd.description: Ultra Alien Escape is a reskin of the original Super Mario Bros. game. It follows a little alien who pilots a UFO while trying to flee from planet Earth and make it back to outer space. Players use the arrow keys to move, jump, and avoid obstacles. Various power-ups are scattered throughout the levels and aid the UFO in making it closer to the final portal that takes them home. The player must also keep an eye on the UFO's fuel levels and collect fuel cans and fuel boosts in order to stay afloat and navigate the dangers of Earth.

ark:/13030/qt1989m81v.title: Peach Girl
ark:/13030/qt1989m81v.description:
Speaking of the aesthetic goals, we wanted the player to have a fantasy and challenging experience overall. In ancient Japan, a girl named the Peach Girl, who was born in a peach, began her adventure because the evil boss Oni took away her soulmate the Peach Boy. In the game, as the Peach Girl, the player goes on a journey to save Peach Boy. Along her adventure, the Peach girl will encounter a huge number of monsters with different kinds: red-faced Oni attacks you with a wooden club, whereas the blue-faced monster throws stones to damage her. The game loop is perhaps that the player fights the monsters, to get stronger, and stay alive to fight more monsters. In this way, the player would be well-prepared to defeat the final boss. The boss Oni has binary attacking model throw a fireball when the player is far from it or hits the Peach Girl with the mace when being near her. However, the player will find it more difficult to kill the boss Oni than normal monsters, as that is our goal to bring the challenging experience for the player. Therefore, when you kill the boss Oni, you can save the Peach Boy.

Our gameplay goal that makes the players interacting with game mechanics is by clear visual representation on the game. As a result, when creating this game, we focused not only on game logics but also on our artwork. We drew all the characters, animations, and assets except for the boss in the game. Also, we gave each character several animations, such as walking, jumping, attacking, all of which we drew. The other reason why we drew all of these is that characters online could not match our initial intention. In the end, we choose pix art as our drawing style since, based on the lecture, the less detail gives the player more space for imagination. Also, by referring to the class, we used what we learned from the lecture to balance the âstoryâ and âmechanicsâ. We wanted to make the Peach Girl and the Peach Boy and monster with an ancient oriental feel to make the storyline interesting. Therefore, we chose an ancient Asian style background and there. Also, we made the boss other monsters have similar shapes but different sizes to distinguish them and made normal monsters to have the same shapes but different colors. In doing so, we pursued unity and diversity at the same time for the game.

Â Like the mechanics that many other games shared, the Peach Girl can walk (left arrow, right arrow buttons), run (up arrow button), attack (z-button), and dodge (x-button). The Peach Girl can reduce her damage according to her defense power and cause damage to the monsters based on her attack power. Based on what we talked about in the class, we could not affect the player experience directly but by manipulating the mechanics, so that is the reason we added fun mechanics to make the game experience better. Also, from the feedback from playtesting by other peers, we modified our game in several ways. First of all, we allowed the Peach Girl to dodge can avoid incoming attacks by pressing x-button and made the player action (walking, attacking, and jumping) much smoother. Besides, by adding multiple rooms, we have âhyperlinksâ that discussed in lecture. Moreover, we originally had only one type of monster, but we made two types of monsters with the action of hitting with the club and throwing the stone, respectively to make the game better. Also, we added a wall to prevent the player from falling off the edge. In the past, when the user makes the decision, the monster didnât stop the attack. We heard peers said that this prevented users from making a choice, so we updated the monsters to let the users pause for a while until they made a choice. The most important mechanics we added is the feedback for the player to notice the damage. By implementing these mechanics, the player would know when they are being hurt by the other monsters.

Â 

Unlike other Action games that use playerâs EXP for levelling up, what makes our game innovative is the sacrificing/saving mechanics: the player can have a chance to make a moral decision whether to sacrifice or save the monster after killing it, to make the Peach Girl stronger. This decision affects the playerâs attack or defense power. Also, this score determines how much the player will be attacked and attacked. In ordinary games, these scores change. Therefore, it might take quite a while for players to feel the change on their stats.

ark:/13030/qt19s3j02t.title: College Gnomes
ark:/13030/qt19s3j02t.description: It is a group of college students messing around with a garden gnome, only to know later on that the gnome is possessed and is out to turn the others into gnomes. Mostly humor/comedy but a bit of suspense and horror.

ark:/13030/qt1bn132x4.title: White Carnation
ark:/13030/qt1bn132x4.description: You lost all of your memory and trapped in a loop of rooms. To be able to escape from this loop of rooms, you need to collect your memory and find a way out.

ark:/13030/qt1bv4r11c.title: Escape the Building
ark:/13030/qt1bv4r11c.description:
Escape the Building by Sooin Jung

Escape the Building is about how the protagonist escapes the burning building from the top of the building. The experience goal for players is to make players feel like they are progressing the game by going downstairs by choosing the appropriate choice.

ark:/13030/qt1bw5v4x3.title: Mars
ark:/13030/qt1bw5v4x3.description: Sent to set up the first Martian settlement, the crew ceases responding shortly after landing. You are sent to investigate.

ark:/13030/qt1c8639bw.title: Soulbind
ark:/13030/qt1c8639bw.description:
Soulbind is an action puzzle platformer in which you must control both the body and the spirit to work together to kill demons and collect souls. The end product met the goals of the project, but have evolved overtime. Soulbind was first thought of through controls. It started with the idea of controlling two characters, one with WASD and one with the mouse, that need to be simultaneously used. Eventually, both top-down and bottom-up design processes were used to inform mechanics and aesthetics. From the controls a series of branching questions arose. The movement mechanics we chose were ones that made the most intuitive sense which, in turn informed us on what the camera and characters would be like. The WASD character would be a familiar platformer while the mouse character would become the cursor. The camera became the boundaries of where the spirit could go. In turn, the bodyâs movement was limited in that it could only jump through the spiritâs pulse. To further force the character to work together, their abilities were made interdependent. The body has the unique ability of being able to kill the monster and collect the souls while the spirit has the unique ability of getting the body to those goals or vice versa. Both characters are meant to be symbiotic.Â 

An entitiesâ body and soul along with the soulmate the word inspired the top-down design of the game. Such goulish characters should exist in a dark environment such as a cursed cave full of demons. Collecting souls became the focus of the game since it fit the needs of progression and aesthetic cohesiveness. In addition, it gave meaning behind the characters actions on multiple levels. The souls were going to be used as goals for both body and spirit through story and gameplay. To create more emotional investment, souls are needed for the reunification of the body and spirit. Killing enemies became part of the conversation loop. Enemies would drop souls upon death that would allow the player to progress in the game so that players can gather more souls. The dark, mysterious, unholy aesthetic branched from the idea of controlling a spiritless body and lost spirit. A dark cavern was made and classic vile enemies were used. Mysterious, purple tips fade in and eerily blue particles aimlessly float and dissipate. The contrast between the blue soul energy of the characters and the maroon of the environment and enemies is meant to highlight the characters and the connection between them.Â 

The game idea was inspired by several other games in which players control two characters, namely, Super Mario Galaxy, The Last Guardian, a few of the Super Smash Brothers characters, and Brothers: A Tale of Two Sons. The main inspiration, Brothers, was a game in which players would control two brothers individually through the two thumbsticks on a controller to solve puzzles. The older brother is stronger and can move objects while the younger brother is smaller and can fit through narrow passages. Soulbind was inspired by the idea of controlling two characters who have different strengths and must work together. Our game is different in the fact it uses the 2D side scrolling action genre to build the characters. Many of the games I listed and others that involve controlling more than one character often donât allow individual control of both, one of them is more powerful than the other, or they donât have simultaneously work together. Our goal was to create a game where you cannot simply switch between two characters for certain circumstances just as body and spirit should work together in tandem. Unfortunately, this goal already inherently makes the game difficult, and we found it implement it without handicapping each character and making the other characters fill in the gap. Each character, in turn, feel worse to play as individually which put off me and playtesters who repeated controlled one character at a time.Â 

During playtesting, I had the chance to employ some of the game design skills Iâve learned. To encourage using both characters the game has parts where only one character can complete a task and others where using both would be it must easier. It was our hope that mainly the difficulty would force players to use both characters at the same time, but I saw that playtesters would only pay attention to one character at a time. As a result, they wouldnât know how they took damage and got overwhelmed by rooms I thought werenât as hard as they made them seem. Since we didnât have much time left, we added more visual feedback for taking damage and reduced some enemy variables. Particles spew out of the recently hurt character and the screen becomes darker based on the playerâs missing health. It seemed to be the simplest solution, but it didnât solve the crux of the problem. A player could in fact using one character at a time to beat the game although it would be very difficult. From the playtesting, we realized the game could fit a midpoint as a goal: to have two characters players must switch between quickly to accomplish tasks. On the other hand, perhaps the game could be played, and perhaps developed, more as a strategic game.Â

ark:/13030/qt1ct8r184.title: A Night In The Chernobyl Exclusion Zone
ark:/13030/qt1ct8r184.description: A Night In The Chernobyl Exclusion Zone is an atmospheric survival game. Your character wanders into the restricted, abandoned, apocalyptic city Pripyat, the site of the 1984 Chernobyl disaster. Your objectives are to explore and discover the infamous sights of the city, but you must avoid being seen by the security, other travelers, and running out of your valuable resources. The lands are treacherous, but there are many things that your traveler wishes to see... your adventure awaits.

ark:/13030/qt1d64p178.title: The Deer
ark:/13030/qt1d64p178.description: This game is about the friendship between the baby deer and his friends. Itâs also about the his brave in finding his mom. I want the player have a interesting when discovering the branches of the game. I also want the game have a good ending which is the deer union with his mom. This game come from some story I read and the deer I saw on the campus.

ark:/13030/qt1dc0j42w.title: The Hosts
ark:/13030/qt1dc0j42w.description:
The Hosts by Stephanie Win
You and your group of friends are traveling to Japan and stay with a host family.
The host family seems so perfect and sweet.
Your trip seems like it's going to be exactly what you all have been dreaming about.
But why do you feel uneasy?
A narrative escape thriller game. Four endings.

ark:/13030/qt1dc186n4.title: The Ed G. Suitor
ark:/13030/qt1dc186n4.description: The Ed G. Suitor is about a protagonist getting ready to go on a date. The game takes you through all the steps the protagonist does in order to get ready for their special date. The playerâs role in the game is the main character who is doing various tasks in order to get ready for their date. As the story progresses the protagonist's true colors start to show.

ark:/13030/qt1dx7d99c.title: Requiem for a soul
ark:/13030/qt1dx7d99c.description: You wake up in a dreamscape like world. Your memories are gone, and a mysterious voice speaks to you...

ark:/13030/qt1f22308n.title: Unexpected Love
ark:/13030/qt1f22308n.description: You are an ordinary girl who is living alone and living everyday the same, one day, you discovered a kitten in a box that is next to a tree of your apartment door...

ark:/13030/qt1f2753p9.title: Gella's Chance
ark:/13030/qt1f2753p9.description: Gella's Chance by Juan, Kylien, and Bill Wong, is about you taking control of a slime wanting to be a human once more by going in platforming challenges and solving puzzles to get to your goal. Through your adventure you will be encourage and sometimes help by the anonymous Goddess that wants to help you out, but only in messages she leaves. The game is a more laidback and doesn't really have a serious story it just wants you to have fun and explore the levels you are place in to solve and move around using the three elements of Fire, Ice, Earth, and of course your normal gelatinous form.

ark:/13030/qt1f87v91d.title: Large Villa Escape
ark:/13030/qt1f87v91d.description:
Allen's "Large Villa Escape"
Large Villa Quest is an escape novel game that you can play like the kidnapped. You will get a series of tools and clues to escape this villa, and you must try to explore different rooms to find a faster or safer escape method. The purpose of this game is to show some people who often do not know how to make choices and those who often regret making choices.
Narrative escape game.

ark:/13030/qt1fj7k0f4.title: The Mystery of Wraith's home for the Mentally Impaired
ark:/13030/qt1fj7k0f4.description: You are a private investigator hired to investigate the murder at Wraith's Home for the Mentally impaired. Find the murder before they find you.

ark:/13030/qt1fq9f8c4.title: The Ultimate Space Concert
ark:/13030/qt1fq9f8c4.description:
The Ultimate Space Concert by Roan Woolley
You lost your memory. You are helped by a man who turns out to be an alien. He is an Intergalactic Band Manager. You start a band and travel though space to make the ultimate band to win the ultimate space concert. You can gain stats throughout the game by making certain choices, stats will help you when recruiting different aliens.

ark:/13030/qt1fr322hs.title: A Date to Remember
ark:/13030/qt1fr322hs.description: "Why did the chicken cross the road?"... to get to Ms. Chicken! A Date to Remember is a short and sweet adventure-RPG game where the main character, a chicken, must wander through meadows and forests to collect flowers and berries to bring to a picnic with his date. However, there are dangerous creatures that the chicken may encounter -- the player must avoid them and take them down!

ark:/13030/qt1fw0w91f.title: The Secret In Castle
ark:/13030/qt1fw0w91f.description: The Secret In Castle is interactive fiction game that the player as someone who is having an adventure in an old castle at Halloween night. And the player need to make different choices when meeting different situation. Different choices will lead to different hints about the story.

ark:/13030/qt1g21t0hg.title: Prison Escape
ark:/13030/qt1g21t0hg.description: You and an NPC work together to escape a prison.

ark:/13030/qt1g65d9nx.description:
Theme: Falling

Before I start to create the game, I wrote down an outline with some ideas, the process somehow push me to make games differently than I expected. It's so hard to make the game with understandable logic and reasons. Also, I want to make players find the clues and think the answer coherently.  It's really a fun experience for me, which I start to know how to create a game with ideas.

ark:/13030/qt1gc5j2p5.title: Prison Break
ark:/13030/qt1gc5j2p5.description: Prison break takes place in a high security prison. The main character was in the wrong place at the wrong time, and has been falsely convicted of some unstated crime. Life in the prison consists of the same few activities repeated every day, along with a lot of time spent waiting around, doing nothing. The only way to break this endless cycle is to escape the prison.

ark:/13030/qt1gd277qh.description: I used to play monster hunter, I created this game trying to rebuild the experience with monster hunter. You get to choose your weapons and where to go, and different weapon has different characteristics. The many choices are intended to make this game seems interesting, and under certain circumstances player can run into a circle and start over, it's like a routine life of a hunter, you get nothing then you have to hunt the next day. It more like a choices you have to make in everyday life.

ark:/13030/qt1gj7p7jp.title: Zombie Breach
ark:/13030/qt1gj7p7jp.description: Zombie Breach is a fast paced puzzle platformer set in a zombie apocalypse. Everything was fine deep underground in the bunker until zombies got released and starting attacking people! Now as the sole survivor, you must escape through the older part of the bunker, but watch out, because it's been booby trapped for zombies.

ark:/13030/qt1gp9j966.title: The Psycho Cervae
ark:/13030/qt1gp9j966.description:
Notes on the project: The theme I chose was "deer," hence the names "John Doe," and the "Hart" family. Also, from wikipedia, "deer (singular and plural) are the hoofed ruminant mammals forming the family Cervidae."
With this story, I wanted the reader to experience the bland town of Torpington, as well as feel as though something is out of place  from the get-go.

ark:/13030/qt1h42224p.title: Forbidden Love
ark:/13030/qt1h42224p.description: Sneak to your girlfriend's house without getting caught.

ark:/13030/qt1h6350s7.title: Locked Phone
ark:/13030/qt1h6350s7.description:
Locked Phone by Omar Alkharji

One day you wake up in a place, supposedly something like a storage room. Try as you might, you cannot escape. You find a phone near you and you want to call for help.
But the phone is tied to twitter and you cannot exit. You need to use your phone wisely to get information, seek for help, and survive until they can find you. 

Inspired off of a Japanese comic strip I read and my own experience with trust and mental health, this game makes it a key to have the player believe peoples words, and taking a look back at who they really are.

ark:/13030/qt1h66z6mt.title: College Alienation
ark:/13030/qt1h66z6mt.description: College Alienation is about an alien agent who is sent to a community college on Earth and is tasked with collecting up to three items crucial to better understanding human society. On campus, you must explore and investigate the quest items without attracting suspicion. After you successfully gather as many items as you can, you will be evaluated on your total collection as well as how well you blended in.

ark:/13030/qt1hf9127k.title: Lorem
ark:/13030/qt1hf9127k.description:
Lorem by Graydon Simons
You find your self, inexplicably, in a large house during a blizzard. Traversing the house leads to surreal, dreamlike visions which point you toward a final goal. Ending partially unfinished, but the rest of the game is fairly well polished.

ark:/13030/qt1hq717d0.title: About Last Night
ark:/13030/qt1hq717d0.description:
About Last Night by Inocencio Izaiah Lozano
About Last Night is a murder mystery where you play a well-renowned detective trying to solve the case of Mr. Johnson. You have the choice of how you'll go about your investigation, but you must pay attention to clues within the lines to solve the case. You have three main suspects and three different endings. How you question them and what you notice that sticks out, leads you to your final decision.

ark:/13030/qt1hs2z8tk.title: Rainy Deer
ark:/13030/qt1hs2z8tk.description:
This is Mt. Vesuvius in Italy. One day, Mount Vesuvius, who thought it was a dormant volcano, suddenly began to explode. The mountain was accompanied by a huge earthquake and volcanic ash. Many of the animals and plants in the mountain were blown away by the explosion. In particular, there were many deer on Mount Vesuvius, many of which fell from the sky. Among the drops were a mix of leaves and shoes as well as deer. At the time of the eruption, a woodcutter remained unable to escape the eruption at Vesuvius. He had to avoid the rain of deer falling from the sky..

When the game starts, you can see the setting of moon night. In here, press the 'r' key on the initial page. The background music of the early pages begins after a brief rainstorm. The sound of the rain was put in because our game name is Rainy Deer. When the game starts, the time of survival and the number of lives remaining are marked on the left end. If you get hit by a deer, the number of lives decreases. Deer drops more and more quickly over time goes by. The goal of the game is to survive the falling deer.There are three items that help you survive. Heart increases the number of lives. Shoes increases the speed of the player. Leaves makes slow down the deer. Three items fall at once at the start of the game. You have to carefully choose what to eat as an initial item. After that, each item falls into a random position on a different time basis. Player should be careful not to incur the deer while eating the item. When the game is over, you can see the time you recorded. If you press the 'r' key once more on the ending page, you can play it again.

When designing the game, I was inspired by the "Dung-Boo Game," which I often played as a child. Games like this are a form of game that you can often see when web games developed in the past. Nevertheless, what's unique about our games is that they can create dynamic cases, not just fall.

The deer's speed is getting faster. Deer grows gradually every second. The amount falling also increases. Deer can control the amount of drop as an item. Games like this used to be one life, but we provide players with many lives. They can also fill their lives through items. The speed of the player can also be adjusted as an item.
