By adding multiple items to the existing game format, people often die trying to eat items. This situation increases the fear of avoiding deer falling from the top.

This type of game usually uses a lot of cute images, where deer fall and bleed. This effect has increased the tension of the game. It also caused the blood to remain so, requiring more concentration to avoid the deer that continued to fall.

When people played an alpha version of the game, the feedback we received most was that players didn't know whether they were hit by a deer or not. To solve this problem, we added a sound that matches an object that fits when the player is hit by a deer. TA got feedback asking us to add background music. I picked two pieces of music that fit our situation from my usual favorite game, Maple Story background music, and added music that my team mate liked to set up as starting music, game-going music and ending music. TA also advised that the deer's blood should not be removed quickly, but left to remain, giving it a grotteptic look. We deeply sympathized with this feedback and adjusted the options so that the deer remained in the dead position.

I made a game for the first time in my life. By making this game, I realized how complicated the game I play is to make. Thinking that every move of the player was coded, I realized why the game company needed so many developers. As I thought that the game company made all the resources necessary for the game, designers and musicians belonging to the game production company respected me. Especially, for music, it is not easy to be inspired and you have to create different music from map to map. The music also has to go well with the artistic part of the game. Therefore, game companies should make efforts outside of game production, such as having to adjust each department's schedule well. Recognizing this process, I thought that all the resources that I could see in the game were made for this game, and I thought it was not a game I used to play. Through this project, I can enjoy games more.

deer : https://www.istockphoto.com/illustrations/clip-art-of-christmas-pixel-art?assettype=image&sort=mostpopular&mediatype=illustration&family=creative&phrase=clip%20art%20of%20christmas%20pixel%20art

ark:/13030/qt1jw8k90c.title: Breaking Vault
ark:/13030/qt1jw8k90c.description: I and my friend, Luck, are rubbers. And 10 billions worthy gold was transferred into the vault in their city. And they want to rub this gold by breaking the vault.

ark:/13030/qt1k0038qx.title: Gupocalypse
ark:/13030/qt1k0038qx.description: Gupocalypse is a shooter game based in an apocalyptic world. The player is tasked with escaping the city while fighting the zombies and enemy soldiers that block the path. As the player shoots their way to the right, they must survive the wave of enemies and escape.

ark:/13030/qt1k7287jp.title: Lost In Earth
ark:/13030/qt1k7287jp.description: This is a short game developed for CMPM 80K. The premise is that you play as an alien exploring the plains of Earth in search for fuel for your spaceship. Your goal is to start the ship and get off of this planet.

ark:/13030/qt1k87b05k.title: Narrative of a Plain Character
ark:/13030/qt1k87b05k.description: An NPC in an MMORPG trying to love a peaceful lives but are troubled by in game events.

ark:/13030/qt1kc618k4.title: Ghost of the Past
ark:/13030/qt1kc618k4.description:
I chose soulmate as my theme word. In my game, you may learn that you used to have one but they are no longer with you. 

My game sets place in an abstract post-apocalyptic world within a simulation. I want the player to go through the story a little confused about what is happening but figure it out in the end. I also want the player to also make smart choices to stay alive and have a feeling of curiosity to discover what is happening

ark:/13030/qt1kg482hn.title: Love is Undead
ark:/13030/qt1kg482hn.description: You are a knight about to propose to the princess. When you meet her for your date, she is kidnapped. You will take the path you deem fit to save her. Multiple deaths along the way and 4 main endings.

ark:/13030/qt1kh53139.title: Escapist
ark:/13030/qt1kh53139.description:
Escapist by Kevin Wang
You wake up in a locked room.
You try to escape from the building and at the same time you are being chased by an unknown creature.
You will be exploring the building, try to find tools that helps and try to find a way out. 
A narrative horror game.

ark:/13030/qt1ks5m226.title: Coin Flip
ark:/13030/qt1ks5m226.description:
Coin Flip by Ethan Nguyen
Taking place in an urban fantasy, the player takes control of two characters: the detective Dreck and the murderer, Vea. The player will be able to influence the deductive reasoning of the detective or the actions taken by the murderer to change how the story progresses.

ark:/13030/qt1m59w4nn.title: A Marvelous Adventure
ark:/13030/qt1m59w4nn.description: A Marvelous Adventure is a short, choose-your-own-adventure (literally) set in the fantasy city of Senea. Make choices and, through multiple playthroughs, unravel a conspiracy.

ark:/13030/qt1m96r5hq.title: Love Simulator
ark:/13030/qt1m96r5hq.description: Love Simulator is a game that player can make decisions that will lead to different ending. Some decision you make will affect how the story ended. So the player have to be careful of what the main character have said. This game aims to all male players who wants to have a virtual girlfriend.

ark:/13030/qt1ng2x49z.title: Dating Time
ark:/13030/qt1ng2x49z.description:
Dating Time by Claudia McMillin
You finally ask your crush on a date. How will you spend your time with them? Multiple endings; your date decisions impact your relationship.

ark:/13030/qt1nw2s0zs.title: Zombie Invaders
ark:/13030/qt1nw2s0zs.description: Our game is a reskin of Space Invaders with custom art in which we alter the environment into one with a shooter and zombies. The goal is to kill them all or be killed!

ark:/13030/qt1p563312.title: Deer Finding a Job
ark:/13030/qt1p563312.description:
Selected theme: Deer
Design/experience/fantasy goal: Make the players emphasize to main character and want to players to think hard to make choices.

ark:/13030/qt1pm7t2x2.title: Chatlile
ark:/13030/qt1pm7t2x2.description:
Chatlile by Alysha Galotta
In Chatlile you, the protagonist awake in a room with no memory. A strange man is trying to get you to leave immediately. You explorer a series of tunnels, trying to escape. Through events based on  your own choices as well as several random chance elements, will you get out alive?

ark:/13030/qt1qc8s57n.title: Dark Forest
ark:/13030/qt1qc8s57n.description:
Dark Forest by Tai Wen Lee
Dark Forest is an interactive game where you play as someone that woke up in an unfamiliar location. You are presented with choices to traverse the environment you're in as you figure out what is going on.

ark:/13030/qt1qm4q0jp.title: Space Subterfuge
ark:/13030/qt1qm4q0jp.description:
Space Subterfuge by Ricky Ho
You are a Spy for the Federation with a mission to sabotage
a space pirate's spaceship.
Will you succeed, or die trying?

ark:/13030/qt1qv719sd.title: solider soulmate
ark:/13030/qt1qv719sd.description:
The game I designed use the character and 2D view of map from the Overwatch, which Iâm a big fan of Blizzard since I start to play Hearthstone at high school. Almost three months ago, the Blizzard uploaded the workshop to the Over watch,Â  so players can make their game mode in their way with some logical setup. Firstly, I want to use create a 2-D shoot game in the horizontal view of Overwatchâs map, so I go to the Chinese Overwatch community to ask whether we can use workshop option to view Overwatch gameplay in 2 dimensions. Then, several players talk to me and we decide to make it possible, which it finally works and very cool. Therefore, based on the workshop I create, I get the picture of ground and characters. The goal of my game is protection. The player as soldier-76 need to protect his âsoul mateâ Hanzo from the doomfistsâ, enemy, attack in one mintue.

Actually, Overwatch is a first-person-shooter game in 3 dimensions, but how about we view it in different perceptive? Like 2 dimension horizontally.Â

ark:/13030/qt1r81t5mh.title: Brokeness
ark:/13030/qt1r81t5mh.description: A story of an adult trying to support their family after becoming unemployed.

ark:/13030/qt1rb5x2v7.title: A Rocky Journey
ark:/13030/qt1rb5x2v7.description:
A Rocky Journey by Joshua Jung
A Rocky Journey has the player explore several areas in a fantasy setting. Each area has multiple options that the player can take, and each will lead to a different ending.

ark:/13030/qt1rc4z8g9.title: Stages
ark:/13030/qt1rc4z8g9.description: Stages is an exploratory puzzle game. You take on the role of Olive after the lose of someone very close to them. Falling into despair, the player must solve different puzzles and traverse through the different stages of grief to reach the point of acceptance. From mazes to trading items, the player must calm down and meditate to destroy their mental barriers.

ark:/13030/qt1rf1z4fj.title: Stop the apocalypse!
ark:/13030/qt1rf1z4fj.description: This game is about an abandoned ship where investigators are trying to find out what happened to the 200 men that went missing

ark:/13030/qt1rf6w3g5.title: Chase
ark:/13030/qt1rf6w3g5.description: Our game is about chase which player need to avoid obstacles and eat heartily.

ark:/13030/qt1s15x071.title: Who is the Main Character, Really?
ark:/13030/qt1s15x071.description:
Who is The Main Character, Really? by Aditya Tyagi
Who is The Main Character, Really? is a text-based game in which you play as a voice whispering in someone's ear, directing them through their daily life. Essentially, the player fights for their own agency against the whims of an NPC.

ark:/13030/qt1tv30099.title: Welcome to Korea
ark:/13030/qt1tv30099.description:
My theme is 'Falling'. I wanted players to feel their whole world is falling down because of the stress from unfamiliar characters like Korean, and that was my design goal. 

P.S. This game is fiction. Korea is kind of friendly place, so do not hesitate to go to Korea.

ark:/13030/qt1vx0x2vq.title: FinalFall
ark:/13030/qt1vx0x2vq.description: My story is based on the theme of falling. I wanted to create an experience with serious consequences depending on the choices taken. There are many ways to have a "bad" ending, but just as many to have a "good" ending. I wanted my story to have multiple endings. There is also a part in my story where the player has to make a decision to either let a creature live or die. This decision will ultimately have the same outcome, but may leave the player wonder "what if". I hope my story isn't too confusing because there is some backtracking required, depending on the choices made.

ark:/13030/qt1w3220wn.title: Hungry Hungry Sluggos
ark:/13030/qt1w3220wn.description: Hungry Hungry Sluggos is a game where you play as a college student trying to get from your dorm to the dining hall without interacting with anyone.

ark:/13030/qt1w33s9ts.title: Chronicles of Athens
ark:/13030/qt1w33s9ts.description: Judas returns home after years away. His home? The Ancient Greece-Cyberpunk metropolis that is Athens. Athens, home to the highest population of Demi-gods, Angels, and other Mythics, has become corrupt, and Judah is tasked with a dangerous mission to help prevent any further political instability.

ark:/13030/qt1w41q27j.title: Growing Up
ark:/13030/qt1w41q27j.description: The process of growing up as a minor who is facing emigration to another country.

ark:/13030/qt1w59m0nb.title: OverCommitted
ark:/13030/qt1w59m0nb.description:
OverCommitted by Zac Nakamura
Have you ever had one of those days where you seem to have so many commitments all happening around the same time? If not, OverCommitted puts you in the role of a person having the manage a variety of commitments that pop up throughout their day. Which commitment will you chose is entirely your decision. But think twice before you decide, you wouldn't want to get fired from your job because you would rather go out and eat food right ...

ark:/13030/qt1w9202bb.title: Escape.Z
ark:/13030/qt1w9202bb.description:
Escape.Z By Abudula Aisikaer
It is end of the world like Resident Evil! And you need to protect yourself! Make your decision and find a way out to the safe location! You may encounter survivore or some unknown dangers. Make your decision wisely or you may become another walking dead...

ark:/13030/qt1wq1v5dt.title: Unbeknownst Necromantic Bunny
ark:/13030/qt1wq1v5dt.description: This game is about a pet bunny tasked with fending off the paranormal in order to maintain peace and order in its place of dwelling. Playing from the bunny's perspective, players learn that life can hit you with pressing issues that might appear beyond your control. However, through strong determination and perseverance, defeating the incomprehensible can become a reality.

ark:/13030/qt1wr431n6.title: Marathon
ark:/13030/qt1wr431n6.description: Marathon is a game based on running a marathon. The main character makes choices about strategy before the course and while running the race. There are both positive and negative outcomes for the runnerâs choices. Good decisions are rewarded and bad decisions lead to bad outcomes. There is action, competition, drama, cheating, and even romance.

ark:/13030/qt1wt2514g.title: Bond of Bards
ark:/13030/qt1wt2514g.description: Bond of Bards is a short, musical, friendship-building game about forming a crew of singing pirates to serenade a vengeful kraken.

ark:/13030/qt1xf0p6pj.title: An Easy Game
ark:/13030/qt1xf0p6pj.description:
An Easy Game by Theophanis Fox
A game that is very easy to win.

ark:/13030/qt1xg3m94x.title: First Date
ark:/13030/qt1xg3m94x.description: First Date: a genuinely sweet date with your beautiful crush. You get food together, visit the arcade, play mini games, and possibly spend the night at her place! But there's a secret that your crush is hiding from you... and you might lose your life finding out what it is.

ark:/13030/qt1xs4957b.title: Shattered Magician
ark:/13030/qt1xs4957b.description: A Twine game in which the protagonist needs to recover fragments of a great wizard who crystallized and exploded due to a mana overload.

ark:/13030/qt1xw2r5v6.title: Stranded
ark:/13030/qt1xw2r5v6.description: Can you survive the elements on a deserted Island? Or will you perish...

ark:/13030/qt1xx818rm.title: home
ark:/13030/qt1xx818rm.description: home is a game about being alone. You explore your apartment and interact with the things and people around you. This game aims to show people a peek into my life in isolation and illustrate what can only happen once.

ark:/13030/qt1z83w2rf.title: Banditos and Sheriffs
ark:/13030/qt1z83w2rf.description: Banditos and Sheriffs is about a Lonesome individual, who enters a train and is later caught in the middle of train heist which he can stop or join.

ark:/13030/qt1zb8g5n3.title: Assassination Party
ark:/13030/qt1zb8g5n3.description:
Assassination Party by Brandon Shien
You are at a high-class party sent to prevent an assassination on the CEO of a big company. Your job is to find clues around the party to try to stop the killer.

ark:/13030/qt1zc3c7r9.title: Super TV Repairperson Adventure 64
ark:/13030/qt1zc3c7r9.description:
Super TV Repairperson Adventure 64 by Umberto De Paolis-Kaluza
You are a TV repairperson who is called to fix a client's TV. This mysterious man lives in an equally mysterious mansion. Find out the dark secrets of the manor... or don't I'm not a cop; play how you want.

ark:/13030/qt1zd694k5.title: The Lich's Illusion
ark:/13030/qt1zd694k5.description: 4 heroes wake up with no memories and must navigate their own adversities to get back their memories and defeat The Lich!

ark:/13030/qt1zg7221x.title: Bank Robbery
ark:/13030/qt1zg7221x.description:
Bank Robbery by Wilson Chiu
Bank Robbery is an interactive game where you play as someone who's part of a bank heist. You are with a group of people that you don't know very well but you need to trust them enough to finish the heist. Multiple endings.

ark:/13030/qt1zm8g8xb.title: The Void
ark:/13030/qt1zm8g8xb.description: You are a space pilot that is sent on a boring survey mission. You want to be able to explore the galaxy but have never gotten the chance, until now?

ark:/13030/qt2035m85s.title: Dungeon Descent
ark:/13030/qt2035m85s.description:
Dungeon Descent by William Schlough
Dungeon Descent is a game in which the player is an unnamed, anonymous character that must escape the dungeon that they find themselves in.

ark:/13030/qt2056x20n.title: Deadly Traffic
ark:/13030/qt2056x20n.description:
I selected the word "traffic". So in the game, you have to decide how to deal with huge traffic on the highway to avoid being attacked by the monsters. 

For my game, I want to play to make hard choices. In the game, you might need to sacrifice some people to survive. Also, you might  need to save people to be alive.

ark:/13030/qt20b4p584.title: Past Bedtime
ark:/13030/qt20b4p584.description: You play as a young girl who seeks to find her lost dog. Avoid being spotted by the men with flashlights as you traverse a dangerous forest in search of your pet.

ark:/13030/qt20t890v5.title: Iced Mint Mojito Sweet and Creamy
ark:/13030/qt20t890v5.description:
Iced Mint Mojito Sweet and Creamy by Nikolas Sanchez
Iced Mint Mojito Sweet and Creamy is a game where you can hop between three different stories as they cross and intersect each other. Experience loss, romance, and a mystery that has to be solved. Really the only thing everyone wants in this story is a cup of coffee. It is recommended to play through it multiple times!

ark:/13030/qt2199x82w.title: Deal of The Damned
ark:/13030/qt2199x82w.description:
Deal of The Damned by Maison Johnson.
You and your friends were out drinking away your pain. After leaving the bar, you wandered the quiet and desolate streets until you come across a figure with an offer. 
Without warning, you all have been drawn into a mysterious place with no clear exits.
 With little choices to make, you must find an exit.
Before what lurks in the shadows takes notice.
A narrative horror game. 3 direct endings.

ark:/13030/qt21p6f8t4.title: Blackpink Album beta
ark:/13030/qt21p6f8t4.description: This game is based on a kpop girls group: blackpink. And I want to make player to become an agent of the member they choosed and try to become a soulmate of their idol. Accually blackpink has four members but due to the limit of time, I only choose my bias member rosie to become the female leading role. The rest of blackpink members will be non-player character to provide some choices to players. The name of this game: blackpink album is from a famous Japanese galgame white album. So in this game, I wanted to player not only help rosie to acchieve her dream to become an artist but also try to enjoy the love story with her.

ark:/13030/qt21x3n9j0.title: Bad Student
ark:/13030/qt21x3n9j0.description: You play as a 'bad student' trying to skim by in Highschool. You must use every excuse and every trick in the book to keep afloat in your CHEM 1 class because paying attention and actually doing the work is not in this student's repertoire.

ark:/13030/qt228679dn.title: Escape
ark:/13030/qt228679dn.description: Escape tells a story where you wake up trapped in a box, stuck in a room. Your goal is simply to escape, and although at the start it will be handed to you, you'll have to be intuitive to escape the second room. This game aims to enable the player to think outside the box of a simple linear choice-based game, and creates a new level of agency through utilizing the medium as a game element.

ark:/13030/qt22f713wq.title: All About Slug
ark:/13030/qt22f713wq.description:
All About Slug
A Twine game about life of a UCSC alumni. It follows the various events that the alumni vaguely remembers as the plot unfolds. Follows a lot of culture around UCSC and along with the common experiences and struggles. The game aims to bring a laugh or two among UCSC students.

ark:/13030/qt22r356fv.title: Zoo Escape
ark:/13030/qt22r356fv.description: Animals in zoo enclosures grow restless as spring arrives. Follow them escaping.

ark:/13030/qt23d4q9sh.title: Lost or Found
ark:/13030/qt23d4q9sh.description: You are a child arriving to the supermarket with your mother.

ark:/13030/qt23f8c1vq.title: Dreams and Future
ark:/13030/qt23f8c1vq.description:
Dreams and Future by Carey Wang
This game is about a transfer student returning to his hometown and the people he meets along the way. This game is about the player realizing his dreams for the future as well as finding love in a city that he once grew up in.

ark:/13030/qt24315729.title: New Londo
ark:/13030/qt24315729.description:
New Londo by Max Gasser
New Londo is a short story in which a knight travels to a castle and must make choices to reach the proper outcome of the story. One ending requiring more than one play through.

ark:/13030/qt2495f8j3.title: Urgent
ark:/13030/qt2495f8j3.description: Urgent is an incomplete adventure game where the player must deliver a letter to a mysterious scientist. The narrative is unfinished - it would have to go on much longer than was doable in order to get to the actual delivery. As of right now it only begins to set up a horrifying scene in which the player becomes trapped. It was originally intended to continue much further but as it stands still contains the start of something very unsettling.

ark:/13030/qt24f4h453.title: Don't Overthink It
ark:/13030/qt24f4h453.description:
Don't Overthink It by Juan Alvarado
Don't Overthink It is a text base adventure following a "nameless" character stuck inside a a prison trying to find a way out without wasting its time overthinking his options. Yet when he gets out and finds himself living his life he gets loop back to the prison once more. The goal is to find a way out of the loop which can be done from the start or later on the story. As for the aim of the game, it was to base the story to the gameplay, which some parts do it others sadly not.

ark:/13030/qt24g4k4q8.title: Escape from UC Santa Cruz
ark:/13030/qt24g4k4q8.description: The player must escape UCSC after it has become the center of a reality-shattering apocalypse.

ark:/13030/qt24n9v3p1.title: Project Exodus.
ark:/13030/qt24n9v3p1.description: You have just died and have a second chance at life. Make choices and find your way to the Evil King. Defeat the Evil King and face off against your arch-nemesis.

ark:/13030/qt25j558g6.title: The Device
ark:/13030/qt25j558g6.description: A lighthearted adventure of pranking your fellow space pirate crew.

ark:/13030/qt25j5w17k.title: Dungeon Defense
ark:/13030/qt25j5w17k.description: You are a sentient dungeon who has to defend yourself from an invading party of adventurers. To help you, you can summon magical traps and creatures, but doing so depletes your energy, and if it reaches 0 you'll die.

ark:/13030/qt25n8f5zd.title: Life is Meaningless
ark:/13030/qt25n8f5zd.description: In this game you live a day in the life of a high school student with a fairly bland take on life. You wake up one day with the power to reverse time! ... but only for a few seconds. With this power who KNOWS what you can change in this world!!

ark:/13030/qt26p9m35k.title: Stan the Dragon
ark:/13030/qt26p9m35k.description: You are a lonely dragon: Stan the troglodyte you call yourself. No one understands you and life sucks. Even Bill from accounting found a hot date, but you're stuck home alone doing the dishes on a Friday night... again. How will you find someone and make them understand the existential plight of being stereotyped as a monster?

ark:/13030/qt27g7n5zr.title: Contact Trace (Trace)
ark:/13030/qt27g7n5zr.description: "You go through your day and start to develop symptoms of disease. I want the player slowly come to the conclusion before you test positive. Then you decide that you should contact people you've come into contact with in the past 2 weeks to figure out who gave you Covid. There are no names, because it could happen to anybody."

ark:/13030/qt27t5s42h.title: Medieval Knight Final
ark:/13030/qt27t5s42h.description: You are a Medieval Knight who is put ona  quest to save a princess. You must armor up and venture onwards to the castle, defeat whomever guards it and save the King's daughter for your kingdom.

ark:/13030/qt27v1k2qh.title: beta-1
ark:/13030/qt27v1k2qh.description:
When I was young in elementary school and middle school, I did not have an iPhone or Android phone to play some well-developed games. I can only play games on Nokia phones ported over from IOS or Android. Also, I did have an FC to play some old pixel games. Among all of those games, I spend most of my time on Doodle Jump and Super Mario, which is the thesis of my graphical game. With an extended game time, I could reach the score which most people were not able to get. Therefore, in my game, I intended to make it more complicated than the original Doodle Jump with monsters from Super Mario.

Since it is the first graphic game I developed, I tried to make it an advanced version of Doodle Jump. In this case, This game still based on low-pixel icons and graphs. However, I added some monsters to make it more difficult. Like the original version of Doodle Jump, I have three types of jumping pads: the black one which you can jump on it for countless times, green one which will disappear one second after you jump on it, and the red one which will move left and right on the screen. Also, I tried to apply the monster in Mario to my game: the turtle with thorn on its back. If the player collides with the turtle when he or she is falling, the game will end. However, the player can shoot the bullet horizontally to eliminate the monster and thus jump on the pads safely.

In class, we discussed the concepts, including falling. I think falling is the central concept I applied in this game because it is one of the failure conditions. Since I have previous programming experience until CMPS 101, I decided to let my character jump to negative Y-axis. As the screen scrolls, it will spawn more pads for the player to jump. Likewise, the pads below the screen will be destroyed. Therefore, once the player falls below the screen, he or she will fail the game.

Comparing to the original Doodle Jump which I played before, I added bullets and monsters to it. The Doodle Jump which I played years ago was the oldest one. It had only three kinds of jumping pads and springs only. So I decided to add more things to it. I have not found out that there were lots of version of Doodle Jump in recent years until I was developing the beta version of this game. Some of them had skyrockets; some of them allowed you to kill the monsters above by shooting bullets to them vertically. Those game are not my goals since I have never played them. I only built my own jumping game on the oldest Doodle Jump.

My design of Doodle Jump was to make it painful. In the past four months, I was deeply addicted to an ultimately hard game called Sekiro. It was a game which required the player to concentrate on the attacking movements of monsters. Moreover, for different monsters, their attacking actions were totally different, which means the players have to spend time to get familiar with monsters movements. I spent twenty-six hours on my first clearance, and now I just finished the eighth clearance with the most challenging mode. Therefore, I tried to make my jumping game hard to play: although it will not be as challenging as Sekiro, the players might fail if they did not pay attention to my game. The normal Doodle Jump has lots of pads for the players to jump. In this case, failing is much more complicated than jumping upwards. On the IOS version, the players control the character in the game by slanting their phones. If you tilt your phone to make the screen perpendicular to the ground, the speed of the character will reach its maximum. I tried to play Doodle Jump on my phone in this way and did not fail for five minutes. As a result, such a thing will never happen in my game.

After playtesting, the results showed that my design of difficulty was too harsh to play. The jump strength and the distance between two pads will make the player feel very tight. Therefore, I just decreased such length to make it feel better. The alpha version of my game was a rough outline only. So I believe that the beta version will be much more fun since it has more components.

There are still some bugs I cannot solve. As for the red moving pads, if there are multiple red pads on the screen, whichever reaches the left or right side of the screen will cause all of them to move to their opposite direction. Additionally, I disabled the collision of the character when it is jumping and re-enable it when the character is falling. If the character reaches its maximum height of a jump but cannot jump to another pad, it will be stuck a little bit. Those are two known bugs but not fatal to the entire game.

ark:/13030/qt28046629.title: Surviving on a Different Planet
ark:/13030/qt28046629.description:
Surviving on a Different Planet by Eric Liu
You crash land on a newly discovered planet with no knowledge about what is there. You're ultimate goal is the do your best to survive whatever comes at you. This is a game about survival in an unknown environment.

ark:/13030/qt2865t3bw.title: Punchman Vs. Wizurd Quest for the Bombastic Burrito
ark:/13030/qt2865t3bw.description: A fun wacky romp through a poorly designed dungeon to get lunch.

ark:/13030/qt28d4x00s.title: The Chinese Avenger
ark:/13030/qt28d4x00s.description: The Chinese Avenger is an eastern fiction, the tale is at once a comic adventure story, a humorous satire of Chinese bureaucracy, a spring of spiritual insight, and an extended allegory in which the group of pilgrims journeys towards enlightenment by the power and virtue of cooperation. The player experience goal is get thought the fire mountain and keep moving forward. The fire must be put out before they can get though the fire mountain. And this fire mountain is mystery and weird, only the iron fan owned by The bull king family has it. The goal for players is get the iron fan, and put out the fire. Not only help themselves moving forward, but also save the villge.

ark:/13030/qt28f7p8bc.title: Valhalla
ark:/13030/qt28f7p8bc.description:
Used theme word : deer(main characters), soulmate (Bamboo and Bambi), traffic (the turtle), Falling (falling to under the sea)

Goal : I want to show unexpected but structured stories to players like Quentin Tarantino's movie.

ark:/13030/qt292773jc.title: Graphical Fall
ark:/13030/qt292773jc.description:
The aesthetic goal of my game is to make a game that incorporates the theme word of falling by invoking an angel falling from heaven to the earth. During this fall, the forces of heaven are chasing you, creating the beams of light that you are to dodge during the game. At the end of the game, the angel player character has become a fallen angel, with black feathers and a darker coloring, further incorporating the theme word of falling. The end shows that the player character made it to the surface of the earth. The gameplay of dodging is intended to invoke a frantic escape, and the attacks ramp up as you get farther and farther away before waning again as you get beyond your enemies' reaches. The lack of an attack on your side is to emphasize that you are more escaping and running away than fighting, as you can't fight back against that kind of enemy. The mouse controls help portray the player character as fast and nimble.Â 

The gameplay goal is to have a bullet-hell type of game that focuses on dodging more than anything else. The controls are mouse rather than keyboard, like wasd or arrow keys, as it allows for faster movement with more control. This makes the game easier, as you can move to where you need to go in less time, so you have more time to react to what you see on the screen.Â  You can also better correct for movement that is too slow or when you move the mouse too far with a rapid mouse flick. You should be able to read the safe areas and move to safety on reaction, and you should not need to memorize any sequences.Â 

The game is unlike many bullet hells in that there is no enemy to shoot. It is unlike games like Phoenix 2, where you are both dodging shots and firing at enemies. It splits your attention and makes both actions harder to perform.Â 

Â

ark:/13030/qt29q1t9w4.title: Cat and Dog
ark:/13030/qt29q1t9w4.description: You're finishing the last leg of your Hitch Hiking Across the US adventure and come across some odd drivers.

ark:/13030/qt29r38614.title: Darkside Corpration
ark:/13030/qt29r38614.description: For this narrative, the Dark-side has turned into a corporate entity and they are looking for new employee's. You play as a new employee and are getting interviewed by a higher up. The player decides how they want this interview to play out.

ark:/13030/qt2b57p6cm.title: Let's Unpack
ark:/13030/qt2b57p6cm.description: Let's Unpack is coop game you play on one device. Use W, S, A, D to control Adam and use the arrow keys to control Eve, but you would have to share Space with each other to move things or nail them. However, be aware Oreo the cat whenever you press Space.

ark:/13030/qt2b83z1cj.title: A Lich Game
ark:/13030/qt2b83z1cj.description: Decide whether you are a doctor with the last name lich, or an elder undead

ark:/13030/qt2bc6q19b.title: I have not given the game a name yet.
ark:/13030/qt2bc6q19b.description: A cyberpunk city, where pure humans serve as first class citizens. While the mutants, or Eves are swept to the wayside and mistreated.

ark:/13030/qt2bm4r5mt.title: The UFO Adventure
ark:/13030/qt2bm4r5mt.description: My game is about an adventure that the protagonist witnesses a UFO in his backfield and he saves an alien in UFO. The alien tells the protagonist the truth of the earth, and universe, and leads to three different endings of the story. In this game, the alien comes from the four-dimensional universe, it can create any three-dimensional item or lives.

ark:/13030/qt2bx0h3k8.title: Re-Loop Secret
ark:/13030/qt2bx0h3k8.description: My game is an interactive fiction game that repeats itself whenever a player makes a wrong decision, the player's role is to give the audience somebody to relate to, most readers of this game would be typical students or people who live in UCSC, this character finds themselves redoing their day until they realize their mistakes and finally finds the right way to end their day.

ark:/13030/qt2c92v0h7.title: Grow!
ark:/13030/qt2c92v0h7.description:
Â Grow! is a game where player gets to enjoy in the perspective of grass, an object which is though to have passive stance in daily lives. Its' main aesthetic is to tweak norms of puzzle game just a little bit to let users enjoy a new sense of fun from it.

Â Grow! is no different from usual puzzle games, except for the fact that it has always more than 2 protagonists running at the same time. The items, such as holes and soil, and the enemies, represented as deer, are so common features of normal puzzle games. I wanted user to have a fresh experience, but not a strange experience where everything is new with never exited rules of chaos. I was astonished by the game "Yami" (from the last semester) and "Baba is You" and learned how important it is to think out of box when making games. The "multiple protagonist" concept is the answer I came up with, and I've figured out that it was pretty successful while play testing the game.

Â Grow! has another core concept. Grass merges. Grass grows in 4 steps in the overall game. They are able to do different things when they have grown to certain level. On the design stage, I wanted to make a game where players could feel the distinctive difference in available options they could make according to the different states of grass, but due to time limitations and 45 event limitations I ended up having just one effect where grass grows to state 3, the sand on the map is broken.

Â Grow! takes a lot of concepts learned from class active. The mechanics are simple, making 80 pixels of move works fairly for all objects in the game. Everything is under control and rules, you don't have to worry about objects or deer sliding down in different speeds with their own positions. It is relatively easy and intuitive to learn, easy to control yet has variety of options that we could make the game through.

Â "Cool!" was one of the most frequent comment I've heard while play testing this game. It was for sure, had independent logic and feature among the games made this semester. I've played all the Construct games from last semester posted on board. Some of them were normal, some of them were fun, and some of them were astonishing. It was not only the effort they've put into the game that surprised me, but also how much they have thought about the game itself, really surprised me. For instance, "Yami" had its unique feature of turning the light off, making the game a totally different from usual Mario games. Although the idea itself might sound simple, it is never easy to come up with a brilliant idea like that. I've spent a lot of time, focusing on what could be distinctive in our games that would be fresh and unique. I've came up with an idea of Maze Sprinter first, where acceleration matters in a maze game, protagonist could break the wall if they have enough speed, but due to logical issues (both programming logic and gaming logic) I've discarded the idea.

Â 30 seconds describable and 15 minutes playable are difficult conditions to match. This literally means that your game should be simple but fun. You really need a sparking idea to achieve those goals. Therefore I was proud, since people really enjoyed playing the last 2 stages of Grow! The average time taken for people to play Grow! was 10 mins, and the worst case (who had no previous experience in playing games) took 17 mins to complete. Even for the game lovers, it took 6 mins to clear the game. Considering the fact that the game could be physically cleared in a minute and a half if played perfectly, we could assure that there is a challenge which players had to overcome, eventually generating fun and continuous retries.

Â Developing Grow! would be an unforgettable experience. I've achieved confidence in making games or logic that people could actually enjoy and be engaged in. I've got a sense of developer's perspective, which was totally different from that of a normal player. In my future life, both as a player and as a developer, this experience would help in understanding and exploring games for more good. I would like to thank Tad and hard working TAs for introducing a wonderful chance to have the game developed, tested and published with evaluation.

Â The soul of Grow! will grow on, even after all class schedules are over.

ark:/13030/qt2c94f40z.title: An Extraordinary Day
ark:/13030/qt2c94f40z.description: A narrative game told in the second person perspective of an elementary school kid who's adventures reveal a bit of their background. Branching dialogue with a primitive combat system that contains multiple endings.

ark:/13030/qt2c98b1n0.title: Squelch
ark:/13030/qt2c98b1n0.description: You're deep inside a cave when suddenly you hear a sound. You have no idea what it is, it's too dark. You don't know if it's friend or foe. You need to act fast though or else it's going to decide what happens next.

ark:/13030/qt2cj037bx.title: THE BETTER GOOD
ark:/13030/qt2cj037bx.description: The player will face some difficult choices that inspired by the tolley problem.

ark:/13030/qt2cj647gf.title: Elvis's adventure
ark:/13030/qt2cj647gf.description:
The main players are trapped such that they are made to live in a virtual reality. Their power
capacities, story-wise, as a sort of divining pole revealing a specific part of the world. Every
one of these accounts give brilliant grub to rumination about quality and power.

ark:/13030/qt2cz984gs.title: A Red Panda Journey
ark:/13030/qt2cz984gs.description: You wake up from a dream and you reminisce the memories you had of being with your family, you miss them a lot. You get up and go meet up with your red panda buddies, you start eating some yummy berries and decide to do something today.

ark:/13030/qt2d91c8zf.title: Memory Snatcher
ark:/13030/qt2d91c8zf.description: This is a link based game where you wake up somewhere you're not familiar with and you try to retrieve your memories. You are presented with different choices and ultimately your choices will decide who you are. Will you find out who you truly are or continue to lose all your memories?

ark:/13030/qt2df4g9xw.title: Zombie Game
ark:/13030/qt2df4g9xw.description: The player is a zombie in a post-apocalyptic world. Explore the city to find food.

ark:/13030/qt2fr2h9qk.title: A shocking Student story
ark:/13030/qt2fr2h9qk.description: My theme word was Falling, as in falling from grace, but bouncing back thanks to good experiences. I wanted to flesh out the world a bit more, as a slice of life game, but I didn't have the creative will after the 1st week. I did finish all endings, however, and hopefully did it well.

ark:/13030/qt2g0677br.title: Guns N' Roses
ark:/13030/qt2g0677br.description:
Guns N' Roses by Vivian Zheng
Guns N' Roses is a game based on a girl who passed out at a concert. The girl is legally deaf and lost her earpiece. However, she was born with the power to see flowers that grow on people depending on their intentions. This humorous, fictional game is meant to simulate the whimsical feeling of random rabbit hole adventures that occur at 3 AM.

ark:/13030/qt2gk2h950.title: Antidote Acquire
ark:/13030/qt2gk2h950.description: Antidote Acquire is an adventure game where a town of rabbits falls under a curse and it is up to the player to find the antidote to save them all. The player navigates through a forest that drains the life out of anyone who touches the dry soil. Mushroom monsters lurk around each corner and prevent the player from acquiring the antidote.

ark:/13030/qt2gm9h5r1.title: Detective Teddy
ark:/13030/qt2gm9h5r1.description: You are a private investigator that has just been hired to investigate the kidnapping of a young child.  Though as you follow leads and explore various options, it seems to be that there is more to this case...

ark:/13030/qt2h26q20t.title: Viral
ark:/13030/qt2h26q20t.description: Viral is a shooting and survival game where you are a white blood cell fighting off a viral infection. Virus clumps fly in from all sides. If you are touched by a virus, you lose a life. Break up and kill viruses by shooting antibodies at them. There are 10+ waves, each one harder than the last. A clone of the classic arcade game Asteroids.

ark:/13030/qt2h87t18v.title: Rat Tale
ark:/13030/qt2h87t18v.description: Rat Tale puts you in the role of a rat, just trying to make it through the night, preferably with something to eat. A rat's life is very chaotic, so prepare for a wild night that can go anywhere.

ark:/13030/qt2h962267.title: A perilous quest for cheese and friends
ark:/13030/qt2h962267.description: You're a mouse, and you've been invited by your friend to a mouse party (which you're a bit nervous about)! Of course, every good mouse party needs cheese. Explore the house, befriend or avoid the cat, and get that cheese!

ark:/13030/qt2j49s2qx.title: Falling Hole
ark:/13030/qt2j49s2qx.description:
I choose Falling as my game theme. I did the theme by letting the player choose to fall into a different hole in order to reach the end.
The uses of links inside my games are looking for item detail and player actions.
Inspired by detective and dungeon games, I create my game base on finding the right path base on clues hide in text detail and fighting different monsters to approach the final ending.
I add HP and Coins system inside my game so that player can be careful of their health and felt achievement when they have many coins.
I create a total of 3 endings and two playable items to increase the replayability and richness of the game.

ark:/13030/qt2k41w4gd.title: Violet
ark:/13030/qt2k41w4gd.description: A detective receives a tip about disappearances in the town of Violet, and arrives to a deserted town, with only the Church standing. Can he solve the disappearances, and what secrets will he discover in the Church?

ark:/13030/qt2k46p621.title: A mages Dilema
ark:/13030/qt2k46p621.description: A young mage must contend with the voices in his head to survive the night and maybe save his city.

ark:/13030/qt2k82676x.title: Second Chance
ark:/13030/qt2k82676x.description:
Second Chance by Eric Hernandez
The player will be lead through an Afterlife experience where they must step through "dream doors" for a chance to come back to life. Stepping through a dream by making bad choices can lead the character to permanent death. Only by stepping through the dreams of past experiences does the player get revealed to them the reason that the character passed away and the reason why they must now fight for a chance to come back.

ark:/13030/qt2mb831cj.title: Innsmouth
ark:/13030/qt2mb831cj.description: A choose-your-own-adventure adaptation of H.P. Lovecraft's Shadow Over Innsmouth

ark:/13030/qt2mj6w40p.title: Something or Another
ark:/13030/qt2mj6w40p.description: You can become something, another, both, or none at all.

ark:/13030/qt2mv6k92g.title: Block Dungeon
ark:/13030/qt2mv6k92g.description: Block Dungeon is a puzzle-action game where the player is pressed between quick thinking and long-term thinking. Players navigate a set of 6 levels, pushing blocks onto red orbs and making areas safe to inhabit and roam about, for a door to the next area to open.

ark:/13030/qt2n32p6dt.title: Filling the Void
ark:/13030/qt2n32p6dt.description:
Filling the Void by Sean Rashid
You wake up in the city of Brainsville which you have found to be overrun by zombies that are coming from some sort of a void. You have to manage your resources (HP, Ammo, and Stamina) in order to kill zombies and save you town. Find all 6 endings including two extra secret endings while trying not to die.

ark:/13030/qt2n70g2ds.title: SleepParalysis
ark:/13030/qt2n70g2ds.description: SleepParalysis is an storytelling horror game where as the player there is a supernatural entity in your closet, but you are unable to move. What will you do with the limited choices you have? The setting takes place in your room after a busy day at school leaving you exhausted.

ark:/13030/qt2n90q5z8.title: Betrayal
ark:/13030/qt2n90q5z8.description: Betrayal is an interactive fiction game where you play as a mercenary seeking a job. This game aims to let players involved in the role of the protagonist and make decisions that would affect the trend of this story. Within these decisions, the player would face the challenge of betrayal in the protagonistâs journey: the betrayal to his hirer, the betrayal to his benefactor, and the betrayal to his own word.

ark:/13030/qt2nk1h7rr.title: This Island
ark:/13030/qt2nk1h7rr.description: This island is a Twine game about an alien trying to escape an area 51 style facility. The player starts out on an operating table and must make a series of choices to find the way out.

ark:/13030/qt2nk7t9mz.title: Iridescent Wings
ark:/13030/qt2nk7t9mz.description: Iridescent Wings is about a person trapped in a mysterious and eerie house, they encounter a butterfly and odd things begin to happen. The game revolves around trying to uncover the persons past and figure out the situation they're in.

ark:/13030/qt2nk91745.title: Colorful Doors
ark:/13030/qt2nk91745.description:
Colorful Doors by Adam Salter
Colorful Doors is a mysterious game where you are placed in a completely unknown setting. The game does not give much detail about surroundings and leaves you with lots of questions. Apart from this, the question factor allows for the player to focus on the game, a goal of getting back to your home.

ark:/13030/qt2p33492s.title: Journey of Sai'ka
ark:/13030/qt2p33492s.description:
Journey of Sai'ka by Oran Shadian
Journey of Sai'ka is a narrative about a young girl named Saika who falls into the void dimension and returns as Sai'ka, a girl who survived for years in the void by making critical decisions.

ark:/13030/qt2p74k85c.title: Heist Team
ark:/13030/qt2p74k85c.description: Heist Team is a game where the player is challenged to put together a successful heist team over the course of 10 days. They build their team by interacting with a variety of different people, who, depending on their interactions, they can recruit. After the 10 days pass, the player either succeeds or fails in their heist depending on how effective their team was.

ark:/13030/qt2px2m84j.title: Ship_Captain
ark:/13030/qt2px2m84j.description: Play as a pirate captain and get your crew through treacherous waters.

ark:/13030/qt2q50c3hj.title: 1 Ant 2 Ant 3 Ant 4
ark:/13030/qt2q50c3hj.description:
1 Ant 2 Ant 3 Ant 4 by Sterling Nicholson
You are the poor soul who left their sandwich ingredients out long enough for ants to start to get to them. You are given choices of how to exterminate them, befriend them, or concede to them. The game aims to hyperbolize the mundane task of ant extermination into something more interesting. Will you kill them? Will you become one of them?

ark:/13030/qt2qs289zf.title: Walk of Life
ark:/13030/qt2qs289zf.description: Walk of Life is a narrative game that captures two characters talking about their life. The game tries to give the best game play experience to the players with visual and audio effects. Players will be able to learn more about each character individually, possibly find a connection between the two characters.

ark:/13030/qt2qv7w764.title: Brightpeak Mountain
ark:/13030/qt2qv7w764.description: Brightpeak Mountain is a small-scale adventure game where the player is stranded in a cold, snowy mountain and has to survive using their own wits.The player can explore a few main places on the mountain and along the away experience the harsh realities of nature. Through the player's own mistakes comes valuable hindsight for the next playthrough.

ark:/13030/qt2qx8n8m3.title: One Third
ark:/13030/qt2qx8n8m3.description: It's a game about a man cheating on his girlfriend, thrill and guilty was the main theme

ark:/13030/qt2r42d6d3.title: Forest Survival
ark:/13030/qt2r42d6d3.description:
Forest Survival by Po-Hao Chen
In Forest Survival, you are traveling to a huge forest but lost in it. Your action will lead you to different consequences.

ark:/13030/qt2rn2k8vj.title: Puppy Coco's Day
ark:/13030/qt2rn2k8vj.description: The master is not at home today, puppy Coco will become the king of the home.

ark:/13030/qt2s1865fv.title: The Coldest Winter
ark:/13030/qt2s1865fv.description:
The Coldest Winter by Kaeden Young. 
The Coldest Winter is part 1 to a horror survival choose your own adventure set in the coldest and harshest regions of the Earth. Use your survival and investigation skills to survive and discover what has happened along your journey.

ark:/13030/qt2s51t294.title: Dr.Pumplestickle's laboratory
ark:/13030/qt2s51t294.description:
Theme: soulmate

I make a story of a mad scientist, who really wants to make a soulmate.

I wanted to make a puzzle game with a mysterious atmosphere. Therefore, I chose the main stage of the game as a gloomy mansion. 
And I prepared four puzzles, and players can feel that they are getting close to the truth. 
Finally, when players reach the truth, they can understand every consequence of mysteries.

ark:/13030/qt2sw3r408.title: Crisis Manager
ark:/13030/qt2sw3r408.description: You are a hostage negotiator. You have to save a group of hostages from a bank robber. A narrative with multiple paths and endings.

ark:/13030/qt2t49t1fh.title: Dungeon Rush
ark:/13030/qt2t49t1fh.description: A fast paced dungeon exploration game! Dodge the enemies, destroy the altars, and escape the dungeon!

ark:/13030/qt2tf0d4gp.title: Back to the Future?
ark:/13030/qt2tf0d4gp.description:
Back to the Future? by Jaedon Lee

This game tells the story of a normal student in UCSC and how their life has gone through hardships like anybody else but coming to college has become a different thing when family comes into play. The player keeps repeating their "normal day" until they discover that their day wasn't normal at all.

ark:/13030/qt2tj4w2h2.title: Father's Doc
ark:/13030/qt2tj4w2h2.description:
Father's Doc by Adrian Parrales
You are the 27 year old son of a Father who recently passed from lung cancer. You explore an island full of former memories that are associated with your childhood, from when your father was still alive. You must collect all the memories in order to get back to the past and convince your father to quit smoking. There are three endings depending on how you manage the conversation with your father.

ark:/13030/qt2tn2458w.title: Sammy the Conqueror
ark:/13030/qt2tn2458w.description: Sammy the Conqueror is a slasher like game where the player character is a slug who navigates a simple city setting to eat civilians and military units. The intended goal of the game is for the player to try and get a high score by eliminating the military and civilian units. The game was made with construct 3.

ark:/13030/qt2tr1p0wz.title: Decisive goal
ark:/13030/qt2tr1p0wz.description: The player will play as a promising soccer player that is playing the final of an important league. All the choices made will impact how the player performs in game and ultimately decide who is the champion.

ark:/13030/qt2tr6211d.title: The Island Escape
ark:/13030/qt2tr6211d.description: You are trapped on an Island. You must navigate and the survive the island by making the right decisions.

ark:/13030/qt2v29k54f.title: final
ark:/13030/qt2v29k54f.description:
** Game starts on Layout 2 **
My game is meant to play off the idea that the player is some celebrity/notable person trying to get ready for an event while dodging photographers. Aesthetically, I used a lot of light blues in the initial screens. I wanted the main layout to look like a third person, somewhat birdâs eye view of a salon or special dressing venue. I wanted there to be individual rooms and floors that could indicate to players that something of value would be in each room. I wanted gameplay to be relatively challenging with lasting tension. I would say the main theme of gameplay would be user learning. I havenât played many games, but I went for a smoother look for the spriteâs as opposed to the more pixelated objects that seem to be really common among construct 3 games.

The game engages class concepts by maintaining a certain level of suspense for the player and includes a brief instruction set. I designed the game in a way such that it would take the player a few tries to figure out how to successfully retrieve objects without colliding with a photographer. This promotes user learning as well as suspense as they get farther and farther, then set back if they fail to pick up on patterns quick enough. While my game doesnât include multiple levels, the difficulty is meant to increase as the player advances, as they have to keep track of more and more enemy movement patterns. A lot of the time, enemies were off screen, so the player needs to mentally time their movements and keep track of which ones are fast vs. slow. The player needs to do this all while finding safe zones--i.e. Places where enemies wonât reach in order to observe their surroundings and calculate their next move.Â 

As for instructions, I was inspired by Florenceâs minimal instruction set. While my game doesnât involve nearly as much story line and is more play-based, I tried to incorporate some direction, while letting the player figure out for the most part what theyâre supposed to do. I felt that for Florence it added not only an interesting stylistic element, but also allows for a heightened player learning experience. Given the design of the game, the player doesn't really have much autonomy over what they do because the game has a specific strategy. However, I feel like the beginning instruction layouts make them feel as though they somehow had some time for exploration/ understanding the character.

I tried to be somewhat innovative by basing gameplay on multiple actions: finding objects, identifying their order, and avoiding enemies. I find that most 2D games, like candy crush, are based on one action or motive like connecting similar looking candies. However, Iâve only played 2 online games outside of class in my life-- the Sims 3 and some other game similar to it-- so I donât know if I just lack exposure to other games. (Florence was the first game I ever downloaded from the app store.) Iâd like to think the game is also innovative in that itâs very simple, yet requires a lot of tries to determine patterns/ what to do.Â 

During play testing I was mainly told that the game was too hard and it was making people angry. Without realizing it, the first playable version of my game was pretty much impossible to win. The enemies moved too fast, while the player was too slow. Thus, it was really difficult for players to outrun enemies or really explore the map without running into trouble. This is obviously bad because, while I intended to game to elicit some anxiety, it mainly caused annoyance. This made other aspects of the game frustrating, because moving around the map was basically impossible. The game is largely based off the player navigating the map. Thus, whenever a player would find an object, theyâd often discover it wasnât the correct one, so theyâd have to find their way to a new one, which was apparently super frustrating, given it was hard to move anywhere. I addressed this by slowing down some of the enemies and speeding up the player. I found that a good solution was to create variety in the speeds of the enemies, as it added to the learning curve while also increasing the difficulty as the game progressed. I was also told that at first the characterâs movements were weird (they would go upside down), so I fixed that.Â

ark:/13030/qt2vr0169b.title: The Grand Heist
ark:/13030/qt2vr0169b.description: The player must choose the correct path, by selecting the correct heist for specific heist members based on the information provided

ark:/13030/qt2w68d51j.title: We Climb Because
ark:/13030/qt2w68d51j.description: A game about climbing a tree.

ark:/13030/qt2wh871zg.title: Honkthulu
ark:/13030/qt2wh871zg.description: You are the WING WRANGLER, and you're on your way to wrangle some geese. They steal your equipment and lure you into a mysterious house in the woods. Will you wrangle the geese? Or will they wrangle you?

ark:/13030/qt2x05m0zc.title: San Francisco Adventure
ark:/13030/qt2x05m0zc.description: Exploring the city of San Francisco

ark:/13030/qt2x16k79r.title: Personal Memoirs [I'm Sad, waah]
ark:/13030/qt2x16k79r.description: Personal Memoirs [I'm Sad, waah] tells a personal experience of going through one's first love and experiencing drama between high school friendships. If you think you're the best at making the decision with the optimum outcome, you'll be surprised. What makes a decision "more right", the past knowledge or the most desirable future?

ark:/13030/qt2x95x8wz.title: A Marvelous Adventure
ark:/13030/qt2x95x8wz.description: A Marvelous Adventure is a short, choose-your-own-adventure (literally) set in the fantasy city of Senea. Make choices and, through multiple playthroughs, unravel a conspiracy.

ark:/13030/qt2xk2c2nr.title: I SEE MY BODY?
ark:/13030/qt2xk2c2nr.description: An ordinary researcher who once receives a mysterious offer. Will he take it or leave it. Once he takes the offer, he generally realizes the work may not be simpleââpeople are dying. What choices he would make in order to survive this big conspiracy.

ark:/13030/qt2xr8p6mr.title: Sleepless
ark:/13030/qt2xr8p6mr.description: In my game the player is a character who is struggling to fall asleep. When they do finally fall asleep, they are met with some interesting things. There are a few endings, however the focus is to impart some surreal feelings onto the player

ark:/13030/qt2xt486b9.title: Treasure Quest
ark:/13030/qt2xt486b9.description:
You and your party are exploring a dungeon to find treasure! Can you make the right choices to get to the goal?
Different routes and different results will happen depending on what you choose.

ark:/13030/qt2xx607bw.title: Oh,Deer
ark:/13030/qt2xx607bw.description:
Judy Yu and I wanted to create a game that was happy, pretty, and fun to play. I wanted to avoid feelings of darkness, horror, and suspense and the mechanisms of shooters and platformers that I saw in other Construct 3 games. We came up with the falling words mechanism idea pretty early on to incorporate the theme of falling and we wanted to create a nice background associated with the falling words. Our gameplay goals ended up being originality, falling words that would build a background scene, simplicity of controls, a slight increase in difficulty as the game progresses, and a sense of happy calmness for the player. We tried to implement this last goal by using happy music and a calm, pretty, natural scene for the background. This ties in to our aesthetic goal which was serene beauty that promoted contentment. Originally, we had intended all of the art to be pixel art; I figured this would be easiest to make look clean and consistent. However, our attempts at consistent, pretty pixel art did not produce promising results, so we switched to just drawing simple images by hand.

We tried to keep all elements of the game simple from the playerâs perspective. We used simple controls (just arrow keys), a simple camera system (fixed third-person), simple gameplay objectives (collect all of the falling words by colliding with them but avoid the word âENDâ), simple art (2-D drawings with few colors and a flat texture), and simple sounds (just some light, happy music). This connects to the class concept of cohesion. We illustrated the class concept of progression by building the visual background as the player got closer to their goal of collecting all the words and used the class concept of variable difficulty level to a certain extent by using the progression mechanism to increase difficulty as the player progresses. Building the background visuals makes the playerâs task harder because the new visuals are solid so the player must navigate their pencil icon around barriers to catch falling words. Though there is no obvious difficulty setting that the player can change, this solid visuals mechanism makes it so collecting words in one order may be more or less difficult than collecting them in a different order because it is harder to go around the mountain, for example, than a bird.

As mentioned above, we tried to make âOh, Deer?â different from other games by making it neither a platformer nor a shooter. It is not really a maze, nor a puzzle, but somewhere in between with a bit of a time element as the player must catch words before theyâve fallen off the screen. Thus the basic mechanism of the game is fairly innovative, if I do say so myself. Also, we tried to make the game happy, which, though not unique, is fairly unusual from what Iâve seen of other games. There is a theme of creation as the player builds a world and the use of a pencil as the playerâs icon illustrates a somewhat subtle theme of drawing. The player is creating art, drawing their own world. This is in contrast to common themes of shooting or destroying objects or bad guys or evading enemies.

Playtesting alerted us to many possible improvements including having a restart mechanism, a separate start screen with instructions, a more obvious âendâ word, and some sort of game-over mechanism. In one iteration, we had a game-over text sprite that appeared when the player collided with âendâ, but we replaced this with an automatic reset of the layout. Though my dad didnât play the game, he gave me feedback on the art from looking at the game and this affected our decision to abandon the pixel art idea. After watching how people approached playing the game, how they moved around the screen and which words they went after, we realized we needed to adjust the speed of falling words and the playerâs pencil icon. I increased the maximum speed of the pencil and increased the acceleration. After player/reader feedback, I changed the spawn points of all of the words so that the words fell from different places rather than each falling in the same place. I liked the âENDâ spawn point mechanism I stumbled upon which used an orbiting behavior on the spawn sprite. This made some points more common for âENDâ to spawn from and had an interesting side effect of producing âENDâs at weird orientations. I wanted to make smaller orbits for other wordsâ spawn points so they fell at different places but within a limited section of the screen, however, I could not figure out how to lock other wordsâ orientations, so I used wrap and bullet mechanisms for non-âENDâ spawn points. This meant that the words could fall in any part of the screen, though I made some of the spawn pointsâ bullet speeds quite slow so the drop point location wouldnât change too drastically between drops. I let the bird word spawn points move faster because birds can fly all over the place.

ark:/13030/qt2zs8z9rx.title: The Heist
ark:/13030/qt2zs8z9rx.description: This is a text based adventure game designed in the style of a CYOA book. In it you are the leader of a criminal gang about to pull off a daring heist. As such you are required to make many choices that will decide whether this heist is a success or failure. There are multiple ending and several different paths to follow.

ark:/13030/qt30h0g9n4.title: Aliens
ark:/13030/qt30h0g9n4.description: Aliens is an alien explorer game that pits the player against a formidable foe that forces the player to make rash decisions that can lead to untimely deaths if not careful. The game focuses on the player to start with no knowledge of who they are or where they are to learn from different endings to understand the plot and the alien's ultimate goal.

ark:/13030/qt30p1t357.title: Wintervale
ark:/13030/qt30p1t357.description:
Wintervale' by Ethan Erh
Wintervale, a city of commerce founded within the burrows of a giant winter dragon, has recently solidified its place in the world thanks to its wide assortment of goods, and sightseeing views. Food and shelter have never been an issue for its people, and the city has always retained a friendly relationship with its neighbors. As a tavern master of Wintervale, youâve invested your share of the cityâs fortune towards the comforts of your guests. But not every good deed is returned by another, for an event is about to overturn everything this city is built upon...

ark:/13030/qt30z084gz.title: Love Beyond Screens
ark:/13030/qt30z084gz.description:
Love Beyond Screens by Hazelle Malonzo
Love Beyond Screens is a fourth wall breaking fiction game that revolves around the player and Prince Jasper. The player has the option to help Jasper realize that he is inside of a fictional Twine game. However, sometimes awareness causes harsh consequences.

ark:/13030/qt3158t8v1.title: Rescue Mission
ark:/13030/qt3158t8v1.description:
Rescue Mission by Dimitrios Karanikas
Rescue Mission is an interactive fiction game where you play as an ordinary office worker in the near future of 2022, everything is going well until you notice that all of your coworkers and your boss are gone, you are tasked with investigating what happened to them and to save them. This game aims to have a lighthearted approach by letting the player mess around and have fun, while also making the player want to look at all of the endings of the game and how to beat it.

ark:/13030/qt31r3k8wm.title: No More Overtime
ark:/13030/qt31r3k8wm.description: It's a puzzle game where you navigate a maze of work to get to the sign in machine and clock in on time. The map is built around doors, keys, and enemies. In order to move further into the work place, you will have to collect keys and choose which doors to open to get to the end. There will also be enemies, which will take away a certain amount of health every time you attack. There are health potions to accommodate, but this is part of the puzzle aspect of the whole game

ark:/13030/qt32041380.title: Peppa's Exorcism
ark:/13030/qt32041380.description: attempt to exorcise a demon from a poor young man-- and chaos ensues. (VIOLENCE, CHILD HOSTAGE TRIGGER WARNING)

ark:/13030/qt32b830nw.title: Asylum
ark:/13030/qt32b830nw.description: In Asylum you play a character shrouded in mystery. As you become more coherent you attempt to escape but you will have to do so by putting up a fight.

ark:/13030/qt3348p8pv.title: Wartime
ark:/13030/qt3348p8pv.description:
Wartime by Alexei Martsinkovskiy
Wartime is a game about a man who is trying to survive the Syrian Civil war. He tries to take various actions to try to save him and his friends children, and it chronicles the players story from the very start of the conflict.

ark:/13030/qt3380g71x.title: Spaceship Scramble
ark:/13030/qt3380g71x.description: Spaceship Scramble takes you on an adventure of someone who has just woken up in a spaceship, and attempts to join forces with the crew or look for a way to escape.

ark:/13030/qt33f1n2rn.title: DockWatch
ark:/13030/qt33f1n2rn.description:
DockWatch is an abstract RPG set in a fictional world where the nations are restricted to small islands surrounded by a vast and dangerous ocean. Forced to take on the essential role of a Watchman, the player must inspect incoming ships for contraband cargo in order to pay off their debt. 
Note: This is only chapter one of the intended experience.

ark:/13030/qt33n953zh.title: Where Is My Dinner, Traveler?
ark:/13030/qt33n953zh.description:
You are a. You are a traveler that went camping outside the forest.
Your friends all had emergency situation, cannot join you for camping, and cannot bring you food to eat.
You enters the forest, and found an old man with an abandoned house.
"Can you spare me some food, traveler?"
A narrative horror game. Twelve endings.

ark:/13030/qt33p3c0p4.title: Nature's Revenge
ark:/13030/qt33p3c0p4.description: Nature's Revenge is a simple tower defense game about nature defending itself from humanity's attempt to destroy it. The player controls the forces of nature to defend from the attacking lumberjacks and the devastating tree-cutting machine. The onslaught increases each wave and you, controlling the powers of mother earth, have to collect enough resources from the fallen enemies to continue defending yourself. The squirrels in the trees and the vines under the ground all protect a unified environment.

ark:/13030/qt33q954xh.title: Assassin of Kings
ark:/13030/qt33q954xh.description: You play as a headmaster trying to overthrow the king. Ensure the kingdom's prosperity after  the king's death by finding help from scholars, guild masters, the church, and more.

ark:/13030/qt3423v900.title: Family Reunion
ark:/13030/qt3423v900.description:
Family Reunion by Jacob Low
Family reunion is an interactive fiction game where you play as a teenage boy trying to navigate a dreaded family reunion. You are given a variety of choices that may or may not have a significant impact later on in the game. The game aims to tell a fun and relatable story regarding family and friendship. Will you be able to successfully traverse the reunion without angering your relatives or have to try again next year?

ark:/13030/qt34b3m6rk.title: The Hum
ark:/13030/qt34b3m6rk.description: In a dystopian future, you have collected enough money to move to the colony on Mars. On your way to your new beginning, you wake up from CryoSleep early. Unsure of what's happening, you must decide your reality and escape.

ark:/13030/qt34g3v9h1.title: Castle Escape
ark:/13030/qt34g3v9h1.description: You have just defeated the evil king. However, as you are about to walk away he delivers one final message to you. He intends to crush you under the remains of the castle. Then with a massive rumble the castle begins to collapse. Can you escape? Or will the king get the last laugh.

ark:/13030/qt34p7q2v6.title: The Western Tale
ark:/13030/qt34p7q2v6.description: The Western Tale is story based game that takes you on the twists and turns of life in the old western. It embodies the uncertainty that can happen when you are a lone cowboy on the road for months on end. Play the game and watch your life unfold before your eyes.

ark:/13030/qt34q7n6xb.title: Gone at the Docks
ark:/13030/qt34q7n6xb.description:
Gone at the Docks
A concert was to be held at the docks, which it did.  However, the morning after, all the people have disappeared, concert goers and staff alike.  Will the culprits be revealed?  Will the people be saved?  Or will the mystery never be solved?

ark:/13030/qt34r9d7th.title: I Left Earth Because I Have no Friends
ark:/13030/qt34r9d7th.description:
I Left Earth Because I Have no Friends by James Doherty
I Left Earth Because I Have no Friends follows an unnamed human with Asperger's Syndrome as they explore the cosmos, frustrated with humans. While making a pit stop at Mars however, the player encounters an alien who is fascinated with humanity. This is a game about that encounter. 
And yes, you can make out with the alien.

ark:/13030/qt34t6v6xv.title: hee hee
ark:/13030/qt34t6v6xv.description:
hee hee by Michelle Kim
You are Michael Jackson and you must must convince everyone that you are not infact dead, but everyone you meet think that you are atmost an above average impersonator.

ark:/13030/qt35m8v0mq.title: Adrift
ark:/13030/qt35m8v0mq.description: An interactive fiction game. Deals with laziness, fishing, and sharks!

ark:/13030/qt3626m2bq.title: Trapped in a Haunted Carnival
ark:/13030/qt3626m2bq.description:
Trapped in a Haunted Carnival by Thrisha Kopula
You wake up in a mysterious place with no memory.
As you explore and find clues, you realize the dark reality.
You're trapped.

ark:/13030/qt3660n82j.description: I want the player to feel that different people may make different things when the end of the day falls. And want the player to feel what is human nature, and not to be blinded by the appearance.

ark:/13030/qt36b526ww.title: The Dunesly Duel
ark:/13030/qt36b526ww.description:
The Dunesly Duel is a story based game, that incorporates player interactions, to make decisions. You also must fight in a "Duel" to finish the story-game! 

You are a character named Sheriff Michaels, and you are the best pan-fighter in the Southwest. 
You are currently an active duty sheriff in a small town called Dunesly, and you are quite a popular fella around town. 
You plan to have an anual Dunesly Duel, where you compete with another skilled pan fighter to keep the title of "Best pan fighter of the Southwest". 

This year however, the Dunesly Duel is a little different...

ark:/13030/qt36d5z4c3.title: Amnesiac
ark:/13030/qt36d5z4c3.description: You find yourself covered in blood and without any memory of what happened or who you are. Your decisions decide what happens to you as you go to the police and helps you find clues to what might have happened the night before.

ark:/13030/qt36p7r7nx.title: Vida
ark:/13030/qt36p7r7nx.description:
Vida by Pablo Vazquez 
Vida is a fictional game in which the player controls Zach, a regular college student. However there is something strange going on, it becomes your job to gather information from items around your room and continue the story in order to uncover the truth of what happened to Zach. You get a chance to uncover the mystery or you can ignore it all.

ark:/13030/qt36r6j05c.title: Youssef El Hout Beta
ark:/13030/qt36r6j05c.description:
For my gameplay goals of the game it was to create a game that I find challenging to make that I would gain a lot of experience from. After exploring what I was capable of doing with Construct 3 I decided I wanted to make a combat based game where you go through stages or rooms and fight of enemy AI that will lead you eventually to the boss where you fight it and rescue your wife. I had chosen to do this kind of game because I thought a platformer game was too simple, which was my original thought but after thinking for a bit the only base mechanics of that kind of genre (but not limited to) is jumping. With that in my mind I wanted a bigger area of player movement where they go around the map. For the aesthetics I explored some royalty free textures. I found a group royalty free from a website called kenny.nl and I was able to work with the textures and models that were provided. From the character models that were shown I knew I was going to go for a Dungeon styled RPG kind of feel because some of the monsters that I found were ghosts, spiders and skeletons. From there decisions I made for the game was based on the idea of what best suited the feeling of a creepy dungeon. The walls for example I thought were a good fit for the theme I was going for as a dungeon doesnât have detailed walls and are a simple brick patterns so I thought it worked out well. In addition dungeons are known for being dark and spooky. I got the spookiness from the monsters but for it being dark I got the background color to be a very dark purple which I thought suited the game rather than just a black background as that would do dull of a color. After that I felt there was a lot of empty space outside of the playing area, so to further incorporate the dungeon feeling I added some dead tees and filled up some extra space with some rivers due to the song I chose had some water dripping noise so I thought it would be a great fit. With the music I chose it enhanced the feeling of the game being a dungeon themed one as the music was very eerie.

With incorporating class concepts I learned, I made sure I had the 3 Câs done first. I had my character model picked out first which I though best suited the style of gameplay as it added to the spookiness as itâs a faceless protagonist. For controls I used the arrow keys for the movement as thatâs a straight forward self explanation and for the camera I made sure the playing window followed the character as they navigate the map. In terms of mechanics I was able to incorporate a couple for my game. Firstly I used action and control as you have to avoid the monsters as they come up to you and shoot them before they touch you. Another mechanic I was able to incorporate was progression and feedback in the sense that you are going to room to room and go through multiple waves of different monsters and then finally the boss.

The final product of this game is the result of play testing to make sure systems are working correctly and efficiently. The first issue while play testing is that the hitboxes were to big. This resulted getting stuck on âinvisible wallsâ which is just the wall with a big hitbox. This issue happened with the character and monsters as the monsters would kill you by touching you but since the hitboxes were big they would technically kill you despite the pixels actually never touching each other.
