Another issue on play testing was the bossâ turret mechanic would shoot at me as soon as I spawned which resulted in spawn kills. So I had to make the bullet it shoots cancel on hitting the walls so I donât get killed at spawn. Another issue that came up at playtesting was the respawn mechanics I was trying to employ. To do this I used set position so the player would get set back to an area. But once I would get set back to the position I set it would sling me across for a second. So I created a small barrier that would block you so that you didnât get slung.

ark:/13030/qt36t4586g.title: Game Project(Beta) (Final)
ark:/13030/qt36t4586g.description:
The overall designed goal for this game is to make it a relaxing cute game. The design of the game lets players control the bunny to jump through different levels of conveyor belts in order to âeatâ the desserts. There are five types of dessert, in total, coming out of machines. There are three specific types of desserts that the player needs to collect for a certain amount. The other two types, however, need to be avoided. The player wins the game when they reach the amount of all three kinds of desserts and still has life left. (Players have three lives at the beginning of the game, lives will be deducted each time the player eats a dessert that is supposed to be avoided) The aesthetic components that shape the player experience of this game are fantasy and challenge: By using pixel art elements and choosing the bunny as the character, I intended to make the game cute and relaxing. Moreover, in daily life, food makes people happy, especially desserts give people pleasure. The game intends to simulate eating dessert to create a satisfying feeling for the player. There are also challenges set in the game: the player needs to collect a certain amount of ârightâ dessert and manage to avoid the âwrongâ ones to keep the game going and win. Players might accidentally misread the type of the dessert or collide with the wrong dessert accidentally when pressing the key. Overall, the player experience is supposed to be relaxing and nervous at the same time.

The mechanics of the game include the navigation of the character and characterâs collision with the dessert object. Through the collision, the player either keep the game moving forward or associated with the game rules reducing the time the game left. In addition, the game uses progression mechanics, the progress bar, to give player feedback on their progress, telling them the progress of the game and what part they need to work on. I also applied one of the concepts introduced in the class, tuning the game. In order to tune the game to not too easy or not too difficult, I adjusted the numbers in the game, like frequency of the generation of dessert objects, numbers of types of dessert, numbers of dessert players need to collect to win the game, etc. The types of desserts coming out of the machines are set to be random. After all, the amount of the dessert controls the time of the game, and the three lives the character has are designed to control the difficulty of the game. 

The design of the game was inspired by games like âsky burger,â one of the matching games, in which player try to match specific types of slices of a hamburger falling from the sky. Besides, I also combined the game with platform games, which player control the character to run and jump through the platform. However, in this game, unlike platform games, it doesnât have a loop background, which enables the player to run through the world. Instead, I used conveyor belts to let the bunny run and collect objects along the way. Also, compared to other games may use âbombâ to reduce character lives, we used a different method.

When first setting the game, we didnât set any âobstacleâ for the game, the player could only collect the desserts without any behavior hurt her lives, so it became a game which players will never lose. Then we decided to set âbombâ to control the gameplay, so players will lose if they make some kinds of mistake and collide with a certain amount of bomb. In the end, I figured out another method to increase the difficulty of the game, why donât we just turn two types of the dessert(five in total) to serve as âbombsâ, which also let the player spend time to distinguish and make sure which dessert she needs to collect other than just distinguish dessert and bomb. During the design of the game, I originally intended to make the chance of the appearance of every type of dessert the same(random), but the random setting in the software Construct apparently is not random. Even though it was set to be random, one of the types of dessert players need to collect appears less than the others do. During the playtest, this bug making the game a bit harder turns out to be a good thing to tune the game. Players who played the game got a bit frustrated when they lose the game and they wanted to try another time, and by the end, they were able to win the game after about two or three times of play. The difficulty seems to be right for the game. Between playtest, I also adjust the number of dessert players needs to collect and the period of time new dessert object to be created on screen.

ark:/13030/qt37w663dh.title: Giraffe Game
ark:/13030/qt37w663dh.description:
Giraffe Game by Jesse Park
This is twine game is a fictional story about a giraffe called Jeremy Star Giraffe. It is an RPG adventure where Jeremy goes on a journey to avenge Jeremy's big bro. Along the way, Jeremy also picks up a couple of other giraffes to help him on his adventure. Progress through his story with your own decisions. There are five endings.

ark:/13030/qt3849k9qb.title: That One Night
ark:/13030/qt3849k9qb.description: The protagonist is invited to an important party but gets grounded. Help the protagonist decide whether or not they should still go.

ark:/13030/qt388770qv.title: Grown Up?
ark:/13030/qt388770qv.description:
Grown Up? by Julianna He
Parents are away. You are free now.
Can you handle everything and manage your life?
Do you know what is good and what is bad?
Can you make decisions for sudden changes?
Play and find out if you are a winner in your life!

ark:/13030/qt38j8c20c.title: Two Towns
ark:/13030/qt38j8c20c.description: Two Towns has you play in the role of a jaded wizard who is tasked against his will with deciding the fate of two warring towns. Interact with people to come to make your final decision, and explore the consequences of power and ego with 6 different endings.

ark:/13030/qt38x0q8bs.title: Map of the Soul: Fan
ark:/13030/qt38x0q8bs.description: Welcome to my BTS fan-made interactive story, "Map of the Soul: Fan"! In this story, you will be able to follow story paths related to different types of 'fans' (however realistic and/or unrealistic), based on the timeline of BTS' Map of the Soul Tour and coronavirus. Will you get a ticket to their concert? How far will you go to meet the 7 member guy group that you care about so much?

ark:/13030/qt3968r5qr.title: A Ray of Hope
ark:/13030/qt3968r5qr.description:
A Ray of Hope by Pinhan Tao
A Ray of Hope is  a linked based game. In the game, the players will play a role of criminal who escape from the jail. You come to a busy dock. What will you do? Now, you find that you can leave the city by steamer, so how can you get a steamer ticket? Make your choice!

ark:/13030/qt39f5j1fg.title: Escape the Lab
ark:/13030/qt39f5j1fg.description: You wake up without any memory of where you are or what happened to you. You realize quickly that you are in a lab, with violent noises in the distance, all you can think of is to do one thing. Escape.

ark:/13030/qt39j255z7.title: Space Escape
ark:/13030/qt39j255z7.description:
Space Escape by Cameron West
Space Escape tells the fictional story of someone abducted by aliens. The game follows their movements around an extra-terrestrial spaceship as they avoid the dangerous aliens and search for a way back to Earth. There are numerous rooms to explore that lead to unique ways to win the game.

ark:/13030/qt39q3z11p.title: Starving Arachnid
ark:/13030/qt39q3z11p.description: You are a spider, and the humans in your mansion did something to reduce the number of flies, making it harder for you to find food.

ark:/13030/qt3bf5s8tm.title: Stormy sea
ark:/13030/qt3bf5s8tm.description: You decided what to do when 7 people on a ship has lost in the sea.

ark:/13030/qt3bh7b6qx.title: Sailing Home
ark:/13030/qt3bh7b6qx.description: You're the captain of a crew of rather unremarkable pirates. But today was your big break. You finally discovered the treasure you've been hunting for so long, and now all you have to do is sail home.

ark:/13030/qt3bt9333x.title: Commando Deer Saver
ark:/13030/qt3bt9333x.description:
Imagine in the plain countryside, there is a surviving horde of deer. However, there is somebody behind this that has proven to be destructive to the environment and thus threatening the lives of all deer in this area. My game is about deer-saving. The game, Commando Deer Saver, scripted by me using Construct 3 software is about destroying enemies and saving deer.

The background story is about: in a not-so-distant future, the planet has fewer countries and more population growth rate than before. The most powerful energy tycoon controlled the economy of the worldâs fossil fuel resources. As the demand for fuels become skyrocketed along with a failure of revolution in renewable energy, the worldâs energy would âcome to the endâ. The enemy leader, also the big tycoon, is mysterious. Meanwhile, a formerly deerâs playground that is now captured by a power of the raised mysterious army and use it to protect shady businesses. They constructed a base and did not care about wildlife nearby. About a year later, the Environment Protection Agency soon constructed an investigation about deer. The agency surprisingly found the enemy they were looking for. So, (according to the twine game,) the agency raised a commander as a high official to teach the player to construct an army like the mystery army. Thus, the agency soon attacked the enemy with some losses and claimed a few victories. Now, (in the graphical game,) a commander acquired some deep intelligence about the enemy where there are more deer to be saved (according to the commander). So, the agency sent the commando Strong Deer to acquire some more information and construct an invisible psychic radar outside the base. Then the agency discovered the enemy is practicing shady businesses using pollutive materials to build nuclear reactors (prohibited in the world years ago) and some hazardous factories. After the strong deer is compromised his identity in his way, he was told that there is no way but fight. In the end, he destroyed the main power of the enemy, the base and saved all deer nearby. His mission was completed.

The plot twist is that after the mission, the player is told some dark truths about the saved deer from the commander (somebody sold those deer to another polluted area instead of really helping them, and the true goal is to build an empire funded by mystery instead of creating public goods and restart a revolution). So, the player would most likely choose to âassassinate the commanderâ but I did not tell the result. So, this part is what all the plot is about in the game. The last part can be fulfilled by imaginations. Players would experience different feelings about the topic of deer.

The art style, in my opinion, is in between realistic and cartoonish. All assets I used are not supposed to represent a certain organization or the country in this game. So, sometimes I used pixelization in some assets. Players might feel like the game is aesthetically a battlefield with sci-fi-like plots. Also, it is important for players to have fun since there is no wrong way to enjoy a game.

In the game âcommando deer saverâ, there are concepts like ânounsâ and âverbsâ, which means items and moving, respectively. There are also mechanisms of 2-D walking. For example, precise walking could prevent the character from receiving damages. There is a âState spaceâ which records all possible ways of playing a game. So, players can think about the best way of finishing this game (mostly by not dying). The character can be classified as âinteracting the worldâ so that players would combat like a âkillerâ.

The game can let the character to destroy enemy units and save animals after that. This game could make players feel better when thinking about saving the world. It also includes a âniceâ starting point which the shield can protect you from losing health. Lastly, the plot twist shows that the ending story is still unpredictable which is surprising. The last plot lets players think about what is right or wrong. So, this can be more innovative than some games I played before.

In two playtests, I gathered some suggestions from classmates. Iâd say there are lots of improvement space in the older version of my game. The first suggestion is to make whether destroying the enemy base can be reflected in their behavior. In other words, the enemy can build units if the player did not destroy the buildings. So, I made the tank factory to build (spawn) a tank every ten seconds and directly point at the character. The second one is to make other moveable units move and attack the character. So, almost all tanks are moving and able to shoot toward the characterâs direction every 2.5 seconds. The third one is to make a clear description of the controlling method. So, I describe how to play before players can start so that they would have a chance to be familiar with this game. The fourth one is to clarify the ânext stepâ because the game is easy to confuse players. So, all errors about coherent in the game are eliminated. The last one is to add a score that appears in the playerâs display (HUD layer). This is simple; I also made a target score to tell players how many points to gather at the end of the game.

 After all, this is an amazing and inspiring experience. I learned how to make a minigame without programming skills. This is a good exercise in my career.

ark:/13030/qt3c97w01v.title: The Light in the Redwood Forest
ark:/13030/qt3c97w01v.description: Your family has dropped off their dog for you to take care of, and it is now late at night and you realize you haven't taken him for a walk yet. You end up hiking in the Redwood Forest in Santa Cruz and realize a strange light emitting between the trees. As you approach this light strange events begin to occur.

ark:/13030/qt3cn3173t.title: Julius
ark:/13030/qt3cn3173t.description: I wanted to make the player make the hard choices, and to experience what a fun/funny game should feel like. I tried to really separate the two choice paths to make it sort of feel like you were playing a different game. In one segment, you are forced to follow the linearity or die and start over, while the other, you're allowed to freely roam around the castle you're trapped in.

ark:/13030/qt3d31785c.title: Journey Through Yourself
ark:/13030/qt3d31785c.description: The player will travel through someone's mind and will experience their memories.

ark:/13030/qt3d35z2hq.title: Sittin' on a Dock of the Lake
ark:/13030/qt3d35z2hq.description: Sittin' on a Dock of the Lake is about a farmer who goes fishing at a lake near their home village. While fishing, the farmer is visited by mythical creatures, more information of which is revealed throughout the story depending on the player's choices.

ark:/13030/qt3d82b2vn.title: Love Connection
ark:/13030/qt3d82b2vn.description:
Love Connection by Charita Mangina
Love Connection tells a story of a hopeless romantic who hopes to confess her feeling 
to her longtime crush, Ash Winters. Every choice has a consequence and will determine Stella's relationship. Will she successfully capture her crush's attention or end in heartbreak? The choice is in your hands.

ark:/13030/qt3dn6n863.title: My Journey in College
ark:/13030/qt3dn6n863.description:
My Journey in College by Bhargavi Kumar Sundaresan
My Journey in College is an interactive story that is based on an Indian girl's life in college. The player is given a chance to choose between two options that will lead him/her to different consequences/endings. The consequences result in the girl being happy or sad about her college life. Most of the paths teach the player important life lessons to lead a good college life. The ones that lead to bad endings will caution the player to be prepared.

ark:/13030/qt3f12f6rs.title: Flight 319
ark:/13030/qt3f12f6rs.description: You are travelling on a red eye flight on New Year's Eve. You crash and find yourself on an island in deadly situations. You are not expected to survive.

ark:/13030/qt3fs4m7jw.title: Treasure Quest
ark:/13030/qt3fs4m7jw.description: Treasure Quest is a top down adventure game where the player navigates their way through a tile based maze like dungeon filled with dangerous traps and obstacles in order to open all of the treasure chests in the dungeon. The player will have to be quick and have good timing to make it through the dungeon alive and collect all the treasure.

ark:/13030/qt3fx853kq.title: Closed Doors
ark:/13030/qt3fx853kq.description:
Closed Doors by Josue A. Uriarte Reyes
Closed Doors is an atmospheric game about a mysterious office. Will you end up discovering the mystery of the office or will you end up escaping?

ark:/13030/qt3g51p5tk.title: beta: falling
ark:/13030/qt3g51p5tk.description:
Theme: Falling 
To incorporate the theme falling, my story revolved around a flight. The plane quite literally falls out of the sky due to an engine malfunction. 

I wanted to portray how in some ways,  fate is inevitable. The players were either set to be in the plane, like Sapphire and Ruby, while players like Emerald and Diamond were set to have different paths that provide a chance to avoid being on the plane.

ark:/13030/qt3h08j11f.title: Covid_Final.html
ark:/13030/qt3h08j11f.description: The game is set on a college campus and starts with the player having an exposure to someone infected with COVID-19. The player then has to make decisions about what to after  their exposure.

ark:/13030/qt3h94g220.title: Before the Fall
ark:/13030/qt3h94g220.description:
Falling: Rainfall, rubble falling, you falling, ruined city falling apart, player resources falling
The design goal was to create a stressful seemingly no-win situation with dire consequences to early actions.

ark:/13030/qt3hg2409z.title: Soulmate
ark:/13030/qt3hg2409z.description: I want to make players pay for their bad choices. But actually, I cannot make the bad endings come too quickly. I will inform the players that one option may lead them to a bad end. Instead of playing a game, my purpose is to evoke the players' willing to help a person who you never know before.

ark:/13030/qt3ht4x320.title: A Tale of Two Nights
ark:/13030/qt3ht4x320.description: The player has to choose between going out with friends, or playing video games at home. These create two vastly different endings. In the video game one, there is an expansive character customization that is loopable to make edits.

ark:/13030/qt3jr0n7pt.title: Hunting Tigers
ark:/13030/qt3jr0n7pt.description:
HUNTING TIGERS

"Hunting Tigers" is a game type shooting. The players for this game are children. My goals for this game are entertainment and education. Children who play this game will have a good time in playing the game. I make the game easy to win because I want the players happy when they play this game. Through this game, I want to tell the players a story about motherhood. This is the aesthetic goal of the game. The baby deer kills the enemies to save his mom. The baby deer needs to kill 30 tigers to save his mom. Because of the education goal, I try to make the story part equals to the gameplay part. In the class, we discussed about this concept. In my game, these two parts are equal.Â  At the beginning of the game, the baby deer needs to fight against eight initial tigers. I put two tigers in the display window, and six tigers out of the display window. Basically, the deer fights against eight tigers. Whenever one of the tigers died, another one will appear to replace the dead one. In order to win the game, players need to kill 30 tigers in total. The speed of the deer is faster than the speed of the tiger. The deer uses a gun to shoot the tigers. When the bullets hit the tigers, they explore and disappear. The tiger also disappears. When the deer hit one of the tigers, he is dead and disappears. I make this game has the simplest way to play. Players can only use the mouse to move, aim, and shoot. They can use arrow keys to move if they want. In this game, It seems easy to win, but It still has its difficulties. My classmates tested this game, when the loose, they restart the game immediatelyÂ  to try to win the game. When I let my 8-year-old nephew played this game, he lost the game multiple times and he kept restarting the game multiple times until he won the game. That means my game still has the challenging.Â Â 

The nouns in my game are the deer and the tigers.Â  The verbs in my game are going left, going right, going up, and going down, shooting. I sign up on the website www.zapsplat.com to use their sound library. I chose the sound and music similar to the sound and music of the Nintendo console game. This was very interesting to me when I heard this sound.Â  On the image of the title page of the game, there are the deer, the tiger, and the deer's mom which is blurred. The deer and the tiger are very clearly because they are the main character. The deer's mom is blurred because she was trapped by the tiger. The mission of the deer is killing the tigers to release his mom. At the end of the game, when the players win the game, the baby deer meets his mom. Beneath them is the failure tiger. The deer and his mom are standing on the tiger. This image tells the players that "you are the winners".Â 

In this game, I try to decrease the violence factor by using the animation "boom" when the bullets hit the tigers. Because my players are children, I do not want them to see too much violence in this game. I want the players to think of this game as a cartoon. This is another aesthetic of the game.Â  My game was better because I changed some features from the feedback of the testers. In the beginning, I make the speed of the tigers were very fast. This made the tigers can kill the deer easy. My classmate test my game and said that I need to make the tigers slower and the bullets need to go faster. These changes make the game easier to play and win. Jordan recommended using the mouse to move the player. I thought that was a good idea and I used it. This recommendation makes my game very easy to play. My game seems simple when I compared it to the other games. It is simple, but it still meets its goals. At some points, my game has a innovative idea. The animation of the explosion when the bullets hit the tigers is one. The story of the game is a good concept to educate the children about the motherhood of the baby deer. It also helps the children in loving the animal, treat them as people.

ark:/13030/qt3m5849st.title: Soulmate
ark:/13030/qt3m5849st.description:
There is a various way to make a game engages class concepts. For example, we can just substitute characters on an already existing game to a dear. However, I and Donghyun (project mate) thought that it is too boring, and we wanted to create a novel and original game. To find inspiration for the game, we watched Ludum Dare, which is an indie game development competition that participants make their own game from scratch within 72 hours. We could find various indie games with brilliant ideas. When we find a game that is adding poker with Pac man (https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jMmS8l3pGes#t=3s), we realized that adding a small feature on already existing games makes it much more brilliant and enjoyable. Therefore, we came up with an idea that âWhat about playing two platform game simultaneously?â, and make our game. The name of our game is âYouâve got a friend in meâ. The reason why we chose this name is that itâs about soul mate kiwi birds. To implement the concept of âplaying two platform games simultaneouslyâ, we came up with a couple of kiwi birds who behave the same way. Because they are soul mate, they always act the same. If the player presses the right arrow key, both of them will move to the right. If the player presses up arrow key, both of them will jump. However, the map that each kiwi bird needs to get through is different, the player needs to think about both Kiwi birds at the same time. Therefore, we succeed in making a game that the user plays two normal platform games simultaneously while engaging one of the class concepts(soul mate).However, we wanted more functionality that shows two kiwi birds are a soul mate. Therefore, we came up with another apparatus, which is a string between them.Initially, the string between them is green. It means they are in a stable situation. However, the color changes to red as their distance gets further. And finally, the string is snapped, game overs. By adding this string apparatus, the player needs to keep them close. This function not only gives another enjoyable rule but also emphasizes that they are a soul mate. The two apparatus, which are âtwo kiwi birds act sameâ and âthey need to get close to each other â is the most innovative part of our game. By controlling two characters that moving simultaneously, it already has its uniqueness from the existing game. In the normal platform game, what users do is just controlling one character, dodge obstacles, and collect coins. However, by adding just one more character gives fresh player experience compare to the normal game. 

After we implemented all the basic functions, we wanted to add a variation to the game. We wanted to add different types of obstacles, and a different atmosphere. Therefore, we made a total of three stages. Whenever users enter the next stage, new kind of obstacles is added. For example, in stage 2, users need to dodge flying shuriken which does not exist in stage 1 and needs to be careful when walking on a fragile block on stage 3, which does not exist in stage 2.Also, we wanted to make our game more aesthetic. Therefore, we changed the background image and block color so that users do not get bored with the same atmosphere of the game. And we discussed how to end the game. We decided to end the game if the two soul mate finally meets with each other. Therefore, we make the last part of the platform opened so that two characters can meet. If they meet each other, the player can see the ending scene.

This is the ending part of our game. We wanted to draw two soul mates who were happy to meet.Therefore, we depicted two soul mate playing, walking, and seeing together. When we conducted playtesting, we got several feedbacks, which are (1) The difficulty of each stage was too high(2) There is no music, so the game is bland.(3) It will be better if you add checkpoints. We strongly agreed with the first feedback. Because even Donghyun was not able to clear the first stage. When we make a map for each stage, we did not care about the difficulty. We just added obstacles as many as we wanted. Therefore, lots of users complained about they even cannot complete the first stage. After we got this feedback, we reduced the number of obstacles on every stage.We also added different background music for each stage. We also noticed that the game needs appropriate background music for each stage. Therefore, we chose some background music that goes with each stage and added it.And in the case of the last feedback, we thought that adding a checkpoint does not match with our game concept. The concept of the game is âGetting through lots of obstacles with the soul mate, and finally, meet each other again.â Therefore, we wanted the player to overcome every obstacle at one go. Therefore, we did not add a checkpoint on this game. Rather than adding checkpoints, we decreased the difficulty of the game so that the player does not feel annoyed by hundred times of retry.

Â

ark:/13030/qt3mg1d8b5.title: Last Minute
ark:/13030/qt3mg1d8b5.description: On Sunday 9:00pm, You forgot to do the assignment that is due today at 11:59pm. You will explore different ways you complete the assignment at the last minute.

ark:/13030/qt3mp830sd.title: SodaSoda
ark:/13030/qt3mp830sd.description: SodaSoda is a platform-runner in which players must creatively platform their way through a soda bottle! Players will take control of an anthropomorphic soda bubble and use an extensive array of jumps, dives, and boosts to platform in creative ways-- all while trying to clear levels in as little time as possible. Those who play this aesthetically lax, yet mechanically challenging, runner will find themselves going back to experiment and discover inventive ways to get new record times!

ark:/13030/qt3mq784mh.title: Room Break
ark:/13030/qt3mq784mh.description: Just like the game's name, Room Break, this game is about to break out of an apartment. The game starts with a short introduction, telling the player that the protagonist has been locked in a strange apartment, and he wants to break out of this apartment because he senses danger. The player has to control the protagonist to search every place possible to find the keys to open the locked door.

ark:/13030/qt3n0008kd.title: Cave Adventure
ark:/13030/qt3n0008kd.description: The game is about a cave adventure. Use the arrow keys to maneuver the player character. Press mouse left click to throw rocks at slimes and bats. Monsters have a given amount of health and will be destroyed after a few hits. If a monster comes too close(collision with player) health is deduced from the health bar. The character dies when health hits 0. Surviving and killing monsters adds value to the scoreboard. The main goals are staying alive and hitting high scores.

ark:/13030/qt3n2465s7.title: Ghost Carnival
ark:/13030/qt3n2465s7.description:
Ghost Carnival by Tatum Going
There have been rumors of a supernatural carnival near your small town. People claim to hear music, but those who go try to find the carnival don't come home. Your brother went missing, it's up to you to go after him. Can you save all the trapped souls from the haunted carnival before time runs out?

ark:/13030/qt3n81m9rj.title: SpaceTimeBeta
ark:/13030/qt3n81m9rj.description:
Within my game, SpaceTime, youâre a singular purple cuboid in outer-space. Itâs not entirely clear why youâre a purple cuboid, or in outer-space. The objective of the game is to traverse your way through an isometric layout of platforms until you reach the âWinBlockâ sprite, at which it will either advance you to the next level after three seconds, or state âYou Win.â The catch? Thereâs a randomly generated asteroid field as well as space junk that floats across your path. Colliding with either results in restarting. The other catch? Time is frozen when you donât move, and resumes when you do move. Being a purple cuboid floating in space, I wanted to aesthetically convey a feeling of certainty to the player. Everything (besides controls and the time mechanic) is immediately clear--âOh, Iâm in space. I must be the purple cuboid, and I suppose I have to travel across the platforms.â While being aesthetically pleasing (and somewhat ominous), I figured space would guide the player without much needed explanation.

SpaceTime engages with multiple class concepts. We discussed uncertainty and randomness, which comes into play with the spawning of the asteroids and space junk. The difference between suspense and surprise is evident in SpaceTime, too. The game is heavily suspenseful--the player sees where they must go and what they must avoid, but they donât know how theyâll get there yet. We also covered gender in games, which SpaceTime engages with by being entirely neutral. I donât believe there is a single aspect of the game which suggests any one particular gender created it, or that there is a target audience. We also discussed game genres, and our personal experience with games. This is a challenging, platformer bullet-hell, which is much of what I have played in the past. Also, to tease out underlying symbolism in the game (which we did a lot throughout the course, i.e. Passage), SpaceTime can represent any person living their own life with constant obstacles being thrown in their path. Itâs a reminder that taking the time to stop and think about your decisions can benefit your future greatly, and rushing things often results in setbacks, or even restarting completely. It demonstrates that taking a step backwards can be necessary for achieving your goal.

The major time-related mechanic in SpaceTime takes inspiration from SUPERHOT, a first-person-shooter action mystery game where time moves extraordinarily slowly when the player doesnât move. In terms of innovation, SpaceTime is an isometric platformer that engages SUPERHOTâs time mechanic (although time stops completely when the player doesnât move in SpaceTime), which I have yet to encounter elsewhere. Also, one could argue that the decision to make an isometric view-point game is innovative, since the industry very rarely produces any games of the type (Tyranny is one I can name). The setting, abstraction, and aesthetic of the game combine to also be innovative, avoiding any type of character representation and lean towards gendered themes or political viewpoints.

SpaceTime has undergone several changes from play-testing feedback. In the original alpha, it was difficult to see where/when an asteroid would collide with the players hitbox. This has been improved by implementing drop shadows to the asteroids. If the base of the player touches the drop shadow, the player will restart the level. On top of this, I added a couple new sprites. The original grey isometric cubes have now been replaced by a more stylized, dark cyan platform. Now, alongside the asteroids, space junk (in the form of a metal bar) will float as an additional object to be avoided. I also implemented drop shadows on the space junk, and a slight shadow on the base of the purple cuboid character, making it look less like theyâre moving through the platform and rather above it. SpaceTime also only had a single level, so I created a second one that is larger, with varying sizes of tiles, as suggested. With this, I had to implement a level switch, teleporting the player to the new level two upon completion of level one. One major challenge (as well as conflicting point of feedback) was the movement style of the character. I received six different comments on the movement, two of which wished for it to be changed to better fit the angle/style of the isometric cubes. Four suggested I keep the same 8-directional movement, as it added the ability to fully navigate each individual tile. I myself wouldâve liked to change it, but I found it difficult to implement without uprooting most of the logic I already had in place. Ultimately, the movement is 8-directional, as the majority of play testers suggested.Â

ark:/13030/qt3np9h3cg.title: Stolen Valor
ark:/13030/qt3np9h3cg.description: Stolen valor is a fictional game where you play as a contestant on a game show. The objective of the game show is to figure out the person who is impersonating being a veteran and stealing military valor for their own gain. Through a series of interactions it is the job of the player to figure this person out and win the game show prize.

ark:/13030/qt3pn082f2.title: Beta Plat former
ark:/13030/qt3pn082f2.description:
The aesthetic inspiration that I took to create my platformer game, were from old arcade game and Minecraft. My game is inspired by these games because I made the design for the object and the character of my platformer to be created looking pixelated. It might not seem that Minecraft was part of the inspiration beside of the pixelated and block design. However, I have recently gone back to Minecraft and has been the only videogame that has been playing this entire summer session. Some of the Aesthetic I took from Minecraft that looking back at my game I came to realize was the cave adventure aspect in whole. In Minecraft, the way to level up and advance in the game is to take an adventure in the cave to discover rare treasure. Were in Minecraft are diamond and iron, however, the treasure is an actual treasure chest. Another game mechanic that I have taken from Minecraft is the digging/block destruction of blocks. However, I game my game a restriction and the only block you are able to destroy the dirt block and is only able to be accessible when the player explorers a stage and discover the shovel and unlocks the ability to dig/destroy dirt block.

A concept that I took and applied to my game is creating a game that keeps the player a sense of progressively advancing difficulty. In the first few stages, I made the layout of the game restricted to only the visible screen of the game. And in the layout, I tried to keep the level of advancing the game to a straight forward idea that there is a door and the key, therefore, the player needs to make the connection in order to advance I must grab the key to unlock the door to the next stage. As the level progress, I introduced a new element to the game as the different orientation of the moving enemy and moving platform. Even at one point, I introduced a new mechanic digging to the game as the only way to advance to the next stage of the level. However, how I mainly make the level incrementally more difficult is the appearance of the enemy and the speed at how the enemy and deadly object come towards the enemy and enable his easy walkthrough of the game.

As I was creating the game, I first started making the game I did not think of a return route for the game, however, as I further created the game, I taught it would be a little twist for the adventure to try to escape with the treasure. As I asked people to playtest my game, they pointed out that I took some Indiana Jones Adventure factor to my game. I asked them âOn how they came to that conclusion?â, and they responded, âthe find the treasure and escape was a classic trope found in the movies. However, something unique or twist that I believed that my platformer game is that it has a Mario control vibe, however, it is set up like an Indiana Jones Adventure. I do not believe that I have developed any new aspects in-game, however, I have incorporated existing mechanics in games into a different platformer game. The incorporation I had in my games where Mario Platformer, Minecraft theme that leads to creating an Indiana Jones Adventure Game.

On playtesting on the alpha game, feedback that greatly helps in fixing a major flaw in the game was to emphasize the importance of collecting the key for the game. In the Alpha, I just had the key with no information or hint that states to collect them. Therefore, I added a door to each level of the game, in which the player can infer that there is both a key and door, hence, they will need to collect them to advance to the next stage. Â Some other feedback that I have received from playtesting is that the game was impossible to land on some of the moving platformers. To Fix this issue of the landing of the platform I either made the platform either increase the period time of interval, make the platform larger for higher chances of landing or both. Something that came up while playtesting that was embarrassing was that at some point, I have made the game impossible to pass if the player has not collected enough livesâ that he was able to lose to further advance with the game. After, that playtest I moved many obstacles to an appropriate distance from one another to allow the player to advance through this stage without any life if he was careful, however, will require a life or two if the player decided just to rush through the stage. After, incorporating all their feedback in the game I made a game that looks like Indiana Jones, plays like Mario and is not Impossible to pass. .

Homepage Screen-  Vecteezy name "Forest Scene with Cave"Level 1,2 -  iStock Getty Image By VectorUp, Level 3,4,5,6 - Pinterest by Dylan Faust, Fountreaser Screen- Pinterest Ultionus Background 02 By Rosemary Reynolds

ark:/13030/qt3pv2w6kx.title: Side Quest
ark:/13030/qt3pv2w6kx.description: As simply put by the title, Side Quest is a short adventure that gives players an experience they will not forget as they encounter and accomplish multiple tasks throughout their journey.

ark:/13030/qt3pv5c77v.title: DEER
ark:/13030/qt3pv5c77v.description: The word I choose to base my game off of was deer. In the story, a magical deer leads you to fantasy area where you have to navigate and hopefully escape back to the real world.  When I was revising my game some of the suggestions I kept in mind were  about the linearity of the game (lack of diverse endings/paths), uninteresting dead ends and some unclear links.  By dropping most of the action links to the bottom of the page  I was able to make options a bit more clear to the players.  In order to address the linearity and dead end problems, I added a lot more content  while trying to cut unnecessary  paths in my game.  The feeling I was trying to achieve with this game was a feeling of fantastical exploration.  By making a somewhat "open world" that you could explore, players could try and complete the game as fast as they can or they could take your time and  find some more rewarding and interesting endings (such as exploring the stream, finding a key, and using the key for an ending). Although making a "open world" in a text based format  is difficult I added a lot of description to the text to help the immersion.

ark:/13030/qt3q06b3m3.title: The Sorcerer's Kitchen
ark:/13030/qt3q06b3m3.description:
The theme which I incorporated into my branching narrative was "falling" and is interpreted as a slippery slope. My story is a somewhat dark and occasionally comedic experience where you are a knight on a quest accompanied by your page. You happen across a sorcerer's cave filled with enticing things to find and play with, but you have to be careful or you may find that you have bitten off more than you can chew....
There are many paths of the branched narrative which allow the player to get engrossed in some magical item and start playing with it until they can no longer choose not to; thus, falling in this game is being so enticed by benign-seeming objects or magical things. However, this branched narrative truly  is most fun when the player simply embraces whatever they finds most enticing and allows themself to fall into the dream, irrelevant what consequences might result.
In my revision of this game for the Twine Beta assignment, I tried to make it look visually darker and more menacing--which may reduce the comedic effect observed in playtesting, but I did think that it would match the theme well.  Additionally, I went through and edited almost all of the passages so that the writing was more thematically cohesive and I tried to increase the character interaction throughout the game without doing serious structural reform. At it's essence, the game is not as much about interacting with the sorcerer or even with your page as it is about seeing what happens when you interact with the environment.

ark:/13030/qt3q14x9h7.title: Voyage
ark:/13030/qt3q14x9h7.description: Voyage is a game that takes place in space; the player is tasked with controlling the first manned mission into another solar system, making critical decisions to determine the outcome of the mission.

ark:/13030/qt3q89s7zj.title: Morning Vegging
ark:/13030/qt3q89s7zj.description:
Morning Vegging by Ryan Hueckel
Morning Vegging is a game about scrolling through social media as you wake up in the morning. As you look through the different social media apps you will encounter things that effect your mood. This game is meant to be a relatable experience for those who frequently use social media.

ark:/13030/qt3qv6q7jn.title: Collective Player Experience
ark:/13030/qt3qv6q7jn.description: Collective Player Experience has you investigating a mysterious town, and the supernatural arcade that lies at the heart of. Explore the Ultra Arcade and learn what truly happened to the strange town of Pine Falls.

ark:/13030/qt3r46q5dd.title: Smart Man
ark:/13030/qt3r46q5dd.description: you are the smartest man in the world, all technology is at your fingertips. But do you have your head on straight?

ark:/13030/qt3r69t7m1.title: Amnesiac
ark:/13030/qt3r69t7m1.description: You find yourself covered in blood and without any memory of what happened or who you are. Your decisions decide what happens to you as you go to the police and helps you find clues to what might have happened the night before.

ark:/13030/qt3r71b437.title: Mind Control
ark:/13030/qt3r71b437.description:
Mind Control by Joe Carter
Mind Control takes place in the near future(2025), where corporate technology development is the more important to them than freedom of choice. As the player you explore the options you have to make in this world and relive the inevitable end.
The game is meant to instill anxiety as players navigate decisions with unclear outcomes.

ark:/13030/qt3rb2v759.title: Dream Man
ark:/13030/qt3rb2v759.description: Experience lucid dreaming, where you get to fight bruce lee and the avengers! (If you choose well)

ark:/13030/qt3rn069mg.title: Life Sim
ark:/13030/qt3rn069mg.description: Life Sim is a reskin of Snake with several added mechanics. The game is heavily inspired by "Passage" and is designed to have the player experience a full life through various events and collection of friends within the confines of the original mechanics of Snake.

ark:/13030/qt3rq7q81d.title: Bird of Prey
ark:/13030/qt3rq7q81d.description: Bird of Prey is a fictional Twine game that where you play as an eagle. You experience family, tragedy, and revenge through a bird's eye. You will play to become the apex predator of your home.

ark:/13030/qt3rt4n0x6.title: Le Correspondant Perdu
ark:/13030/qt3rt4n0x6.description: In "Le Correspondant Perdu," you play as an American office-worker John with a penpal in France who mysteriously stops sending messages to you. You decide not to do anything until all of a sudden one day you begin receiving cryptic messages that seem sinister, prompting you to take action. In this story-based puzzle game, the player uses information from pieces of mail that they had previously received from their penpal's connections to solve puzzles embedded in the mysterious messages sent to them. The players job is to try and figure out what happened to their penpal by interacting with their penpals contacts and by solving mini-quests provided to them through the mail.

ark:/13030/qt3rw856w9.title: Traces
ark:/13030/qt3rw856w9.description: You wake up to spirits surrounding you. You are told that you must be sorted into 4 colonies based on your main driving personality trait and then sorted into what type of morality you have. You go through a series of memories from your past ancestors and you are given a list of choices. Through those lists of choices, you will find out who you really are.

ark:/13030/qt3s1539v7.title: Human Instincts
ark:/13030/qt3s1539v7.description: Human Instincts describes a journey where one must endure grueling moral dilemmas, testing their instincts and compulsions, in order to reach an antidote to save people from a deadly disease.

ark:/13030/qt3sk1878v.title: In For The Ride
ark:/13030/qt3sk1878v.description:
In For The Ride by Vincent Liu
In For The Ride is an interactive fiction game where you play as a person who wakes up late for work. While you try to get to work on time, you make decisions based around the story and how you choose to react to them tangents off into a different story. Based on the players choices, they are able to achieve multiple possible endings.

ark:/13030/qt3sp063dt.title: Anterograde
ark:/13030/qt3sp063dt.description: Anterograde is an interactive fiction game where you play as someone with a form of amnesia that resets your memory each week. You are given a choice in which experiences you partake in that will ultimately influence your decision on who you will love as the end of the week approaches.

ark:/13030/qt3sr1f348.title: Good Citizen
ark:/13030/qt3sr1f348.description:
Good Citizen by Manny Nguyen
It is a interactive narrative game where the player is an average person living in the far future where there is no freedom of speech or privacy. Their job is to either censor unapproved books or monitor movements, and the choices the player made will affect the outcome of the story.

ark:/13030/qt3st0v481.title: Lost Dog
ark:/13030/qt3st0v481.description: âLost Dogâ is a straightforward, down-to-earth link-based game set in a suburban neighborhood. The player is tasked to find their lost dog through a variety of choices presented to them. There are a total of 12 endings to achieve in the game.

ark:/13030/qt3t092617.title: Falling
ark:/13030/qt3t092617.description:
The title of the story is "Falling", where the user is the main character who is trying to get to the hospital to aid their soulmate, but they are stuck in traffic... 

I wanted to invoke the feeling of anxiety and stress that we all have experienced in the modern world. When we are in fight or flight mode, we see tons of potential pathways to a solution and it can be overwhelming because we can only focus on one option at a time and we can't predict the future. Therefore the first passage has a lot of links that feel like they can take you down different paths. I wanted the user to feel like every decision mattered, and that at first there were lots of options, but options become more narrow as you go down a certain path.

I added CSS styling to give it clean look and palatable feel, yet only be in shades of black and white -- it may be hard to find the links until your mouse hovers over them and they change colors. When I am stressed and hurried, I always look for the quick and easy option. Therefore, I tried to make the user read the passage instead of just clicking on the first hyperlink. Also, some links take you to the same passage as other links, giving the illusion that there is more options to choose from. I added a tangential "phone call" with an automated system which again has too many options and would be frustrating if you were in a hurry.  

I made the writing style lighthearted and humorous because the story revolves around anxiety and being stressed in traffic. Hopefully it is fun to read and stressful (but not too stressful) to play.

ark:/13030/qt3tc7j68m.title: Cheating Story
ark:/13030/qt3tc7j68m.description: Cheating Story puts the player in a scenario where they have to take an important test. They will receive a grade based on the certain actions they take before and during the test. The player's role is a student who is stressed about a test. The student feels some social pressure to spend time with their friends but the test is also important. If the student fails, they would have to retake the whole class so there's a lot at stake.

ark:/13030/qt3td3462z.title: Dungeon Escapades
ark:/13030/qt3td3462z.description: Dungeon Escapades is a comical interactive game where you play as some sad sack that randomly got stuck in a random dungeon.  You have to figure out how to get out of there with whatever bizarre or wacky options given to you.  See what ways you can escape and question the reality of the game or what the creator was on while making it.

ark:/13030/qt3tw2116d.title: Love Story 1
ark:/13030/qt3tw2116d.description: You're a working adult, who has successfully recovered from identity theft from your previous ex.  One night, a girl at the bar catches your eye.  The question is: Are you ready for another relationship?

ark:/13030/qt3vx8367n.title: Survive
ark:/13030/qt3vx8367n.description: Players wake up in the morning, but the city is empty now. The player needs to think carefully in order to make the right decision for surviving.

ark:/13030/qt3w12s44w.title: Mystery Murder
ark:/13030/qt3w12s44w.description: You are a detective attempting to find the murderer of one household.

ark:/13030/qt3wq5d4hn.title: Step-Suns on a Roadtrip
ark:/13030/qt3wq5d4hn.description: You ever wanted to go through space with your step-bro and fight evil enemies? Well here is your chance. (Single Player though).

ark:/13030/qt3x67t1dp.title: Memories
ark:/13030/qt3x67t1dp.description:
Memories by Lane Albrecht
Memories is a fictional remake of the protagonists life. They may choose to live it out however they wish, from start to finish they get to pursue any "what-ifs" of life.

ark:/13030/qt3x95j7ch.title: Empty Space
ark:/13030/qt3x95j7ch.description: Empty Space is an linked-based game where you play as someone who randomly awakens on a spaceship. You have no recollection of how you got here or who you are. As you explore the ship, you soon realize that there is something more sinister going on and only you can stop it.

ark:/13030/qt3xc837fw.title: Procrastinate.
ark:/13030/qt3xc837fw.description: Procrastinate is an interactive fiction game that involves the player doing things around the house to distract them from the fact they have homework. You can make food, watch TV, and many other activities that are more fun than homework. The game is just a slice of life that is made to feel relatable, and hopefully many players can identify with it.

ark:/13030/qt3xd0t9fj.title: Predestination
ark:/13030/qt3xd0t9fj.description: The game Predestination is about someone inevitably falling in love & depression with a girl from a Christian church as if it's his destiny & fate.

ark:/13030/qt3xt0x0cm.title: A Time and Place
ark:/13030/qt3xt0x0cm.description:
A Time and Place by Madeleine Graboske
You are a paranormal investigator, and this case could be the biggest in your career. People have been disappearing, and your intel suggests something supernatural. Navigate your way through the night to investigate these instances, just make sure you get there by the witching hour. Who knows what will happen if you don't.

ark:/13030/qt3z61c4xx.description: The heb should be herb. In this game I'd like to create a game which players feel easy to pass but actually very difficult. So I set lots of death scene without any warning. I think it will be very happy when players pass the game after lots of death.

ark:/13030/qt4012q9w4.title: Together
ark:/13030/qt4012q9w4.description: A game revolving around a personal experience of dealing with depression through highschool

ark:/13030/qt4099s63c.title: Apply Yourself
ark:/13030/qt4099s63c.description: Apply yourself chronicles the  one shot you have to get ace a job interview

ark:/13030/qt40d2j3cb.title: Abscond
ark:/13030/qt40d2j3cb.description:
Abscond by Kevin Lewis
The main character wakes up in a futuristic room shortly after having a near-death experience. After reading a note from an unknown doctor telling them about the impending extinction of humanity, the main character sets out to exit the facility that they are in and meet with the doctor at a specified location.

ark:/13030/qt40m1w1pd.title: Traceur Chase
ark:/13030/qt40m1w1pd.description: Traceur Chase is a narrative-based action, survival game about Parkour. You are new to the world of parkour and freerunning and while walking home at night from one of your gym classes, you are followed by a mysterious group that want to capture you at any cost. You must think quickly on your feet to evade and out maneuver the group, but be warned, parkour is a dangerous activity, one wrong move and you can get hurt, or worse. With multiple routes and endings, along with a timer and injury system, this game delivers a fast-paced, tension heavy experience with lots of room for creativity.

ark:/13030/qt40x683h7.title: Flowers for Elderoth
ark:/13030/qt40x683h7.description:
Flowers for Elderoth by Dillon Ney
The glorious Tullian empire has just conquered the final independent nation on the southern continent, uniting the land. Now, Elderoth's fate is in your hands. As a peasant, a soldier, the emperor, you decide how Eldoroth and the Eldorians will be treated. Your actions represent the actions of the whole empire. Will Elderoth become the shining star of the empire, or will its riches be plundered,  people slaughtered, and it fade into obscurity. The glory of the empire awaits. Non ducor, duco!

ark:/13030/qt41s7c2hb.title: The Call
ark:/13030/qt41s7c2hb.description:
The Call by Abhi Raghuraman

You wake up one night to a call, being given the choice to answer it or not. If answered, you are struck with an otherworldly threat and given the choice to save yourself or attempt to communicate the issue with others. Depending on your choices, you will end up quarantining and emerging into a world plagued by damage or situated in a military hideout and safely survive. If the call is not answered, you won't really have a clue about the alien attack, but will find yourself subject to the authorities - who have traced the call to your house. You will be given the chance to use your expertise to help a lead team of engineers and save the world.

The Call is a science fiction, Choose Your Own Adventure type game that allows the player to make risk-based choices. The challenge in the game involves making the right choices and avoiding being abducted by aliens. With a wide variety of endings, players are given a great opportunity to explore and succeed.

ark:/13030/qt41z1z5n2.title: Sociopathic empath
ark:/13030/qt41z1z5n2.description: The player discovers they have the power to live through the life situations of others and the ability to change reality. These powers are triggered when the player feels a certain amount of empathy for a person. The player must choose between owning the powers or avoiding people altogether to prevent dealing with the responsibility.

ark:/13030/qt42s268c7.title: CavernCrisis
ark:/13030/qt42s268c7.description: CavernCrisis is a game that reskinned from the original Donkey Kong arcade game. The player will be challenged to dodge incoming boulders and climb the ladders to reach to top.

ark:/13030/qt4410938d.title: The Mall
ark:/13030/qt4410938d.description:
The Mall by Maya Brown
The Mall centers around a person who decides to explore their local mall. Upon going inside, they find that the place appears as though it has been closed down. The chance to walk around a mall after it has shut down for the night? It seems too good to be true...and maybe it is.

ark:/13030/qt444661zc.title: Lamb Line
ark:/13030/qt444661zc.description:
You are a sheepdog gathering sheep in the field, can you round them all up safely? 
Or will you mess up the upbeat sheep conga you've created?

ark:/13030/qt44b7k2xf.title: Detention
ark:/13030/qt44b7k2xf.description:
Detention by KidÃ¼s Michael
You have too many tardies and as a result you are facing a day in Saturday Detention.
There is not much to do so you must make the best of it.
There are three ways to make it out, but be carefult, you might get caught.
The game aims to test the players limits on how long they can stand before making an escape (and being smart about it).

ark:/13030/qt44z0q599.title: Parasite
ark:/13030/qt44z0q599.description: A simple game about a parasite latching onto and launchingfrom hosts to kill them and gain points, while avoiding enemies reveling in the satisfaction of filling the level with the remains of their victims. There's no story or baggage attached, just a fun game with a fun effect that makes it satisfying to get farther.

ark:/13030/qt45d6j7w8.title: Spider Game
ark:/13030/qt45d6j7w8.description:
Spider Game by Nailea Llamas, Sammy Siu, and Alexander Barclay is a top down arcade style high score based game with a time limit where the player tries to collect as many flies, grubs, and eggs as they can with a dynamically reproducing population of flies with a life cycle.
The player can the spider by dragging their cursor and lay web by clicking.  Flies lay eggs shortly after they bump into each other, eggs hatch into grubs, and grubs grow into flies.  Eggs give a short speed boost and 3 points, grubs give 3 points, and flies give 1 point.  Capture flies by getting them to run into your webs, and eat grubs and eggs by running into them.

ark:/13030/qt45q5z6pv.title: Deteriorate
ark:/13030/qt45q5z6pv.description: It follows the journey of Phoenix, whose limbs are slowly melting off. With the help of a witch, they must collect materials to create a remedy and unveil their past.

ark:/13030/qt46h123dp.title: House on the Hill
ark:/13030/qt46h123dp.description: House on Hill is a game that explores what happens when you and your friends end up taking a vacation to a mansion on a House on the Hill. You find out one of your friends has been murdered and while trying to escape, you are trapped in at the mansions due to a sudden thunderstorm. The game aims to show what happens when players are presented with choices in a grim situation.

ark:/13030/qt46k0s7qv.title: Hero
ark:/13030/qt46k0s7qv.description: This game tells the story of a super-powered individual who struggles between the fight for public approval and what is morally right, often finding that these contradict each other.

ark:/13030/qt46p2x8z2.title: Room Escape
ark:/13030/qt46p2x8z2.description: Room Escape by Yanli Wang, protagonist need to find the memory back through discovering different branch and rooms.

ark:/13030/qt46v9876b.title: Fallen Down
ark:/13030/qt46v9876b.description:
Our original intention for Fallen Down, was a cherub statues looking for pieces of his friend throughout an art museum, although the limitations of the project prevented us from expanding too much on that Idea, so we settled for a little cherub trying to make his way through literal hell to get back home. The art style was originally going to be more renaissance to make the ideas of heaven and hell fit in more, but we eventually adapted a pixel art style after a lapse in communication. There were a few unused enemy sprites and modifications we had to do, but in the end, the art style seemed to fit well with the theme of biblical stuff. The gameplay turned out a lot better for my first 2D platformer, and I was satisfied with the amount of work I got to do on the actual commands for the enemies, player movements and stage hazards. I found work arounds to seemingly complex problems, which I feel bodes well for my future in programming, like the restart issue i was spending near hours on. The core mechanics I found to be a bit floaty, but still controllable, helping to add the player immersion to the cherub's flying abilities. We made sure this time to properly include the theme for our project this time, as our little cherub buddy has fallen down to hell and is trying to make his way through progressively less demonic areas to reach his home and friends in heaven. The theme incorporated would be falling, and on a less literal note, the cherub seems to be """"""""" falling"""""""""" into tougher and tougher situations as he climbs to the top, almost as if the difficulty of his mission is trying to keep him down. The Cherub, whenever he dies, also falls back to the bottom of his journey, having to start all over again, no matter how close he may be to freedom. A lot of what this game originally struggled with was the jumping and movement mechanics, and after a while, I found different commands to be viable and more effecient then the previous ones. That in itself being at the basis of all programming, I felt more confident dealing with the other technical issues presented to me. One of the technical issues was the ability to glide and shoot, which before, was originally impossible,but after a quick shift of conditions and events, I had to while gliding or not, the cherub would fire at the same rate. There was a point in between all of that where you could just glide and spam arrows, which obviously wouldn't fly on my watch. A lot of the other issues came with the level layouts, which I think we addressed well enough. The first issue surrounded the turrets, and how players may find it less challenging to have them constantly firing at you, so I added vulnerability to ground and arrows for bullets and turrets respectively. Another issue was the build up of difficulty throughout the levels and how we'd introduce new mechanics and/or enemies. I tried making it so everything the cherub would encounter in the game, the player would encounter within the first few seconds of gameplay (aside from the upgraded enemies of course). From there, it was up to us to properly pace the other areas to utilize these mechanics in new ways that challenged the player to think on their toes a bit more. Naturally, with all progression, the final area is the toughest, using these familiar concepts and launching you into the proverbial laundry machine. There is fire everywhere, making the need for precise platforming vital,Â  as well as having quicker turrets fire at you relentlessly.Â  I did feel however that the ending was a little anti-climactic, but I think the end card makes do for this project. We also would have liked to include music and sounds effects, but it appears they just didn't make it in in time for the due date,(or the sound effects are there and I didn't know, I couldn't play the game with the sound on). However I do know the fundamental flaw in this game; it doesn't really try anything new, even with the story. "Little angel falls from heaven and climbs back up, he can glide and shoot arrows" feels sadly cliche to me. That doesn't mean I like my game any less, it just means that it can't really stand out amongst the crowd .Â  I had an Idea to make the arrows have a bit of delay before firing, (like Simon Belmont and his whip attacks in the original Castlevanias), but it never came through. The artwork I was proud of, and I had a lot of fun bouncing ideas back and forth with Sam. I'd much like to use this project and expand it more in the future in my own time, just to see what I can accomplish on my own.

-- Sophia Muren, Lead Programmer of Fallen Down

Fallen Down is an action platformer in which the player, a cherub, must escape Hell to return home to Heaven. We drew inspiration from traditional platformers such as Kirby, Mario, and Megaman, but wanted to put our own spin on the genre. We wanted to make a game that was cute and fun, but challenging as well. The design of the player character and demons are cartoonish and lighthearted, and rendered in an 8-bit style that harkens back to older games. Fallen Down is innovative compared to other games because it features gliding and shooting as core mechanics. Many games, like Mario or Kirby have these features as power-ups, but we decided that including them would fit the theme of the game (the player being a cherub) and allow for more challenging levels, given that the player has these tools from the beginning. Challenges include fast-firing turrets, wide jumps the player must cross by gliding, and large enemies with high health. Player feedback helped us tweak our game and make it as good as it could be. During the first round of playtesting, players found bugs and hidden shortcuts we hadnât intended. This helped us fortify our levels to keep them interesting and challenging. They also helped us figure out spacing and difficulty --Â  initially, the blank background and empty space made it hard for some players to navigate the levels. We added more features, enemies, and walls to make use of this space instead of letting it go to waste, making for a more interesting game that has a natural flow of progression. Initially, we werenât using the glide feature to its full potential. Our playtesters helped us see that adding obstacles such as fire and ground enemies could get players to use gliding and have fun with it. Philip, our student TA, also helped us think about how to use enemies to their fullest potential instead of letting them be fodder for the playerâs arrows. His feedback helped us place our enemies more strategically. Philip and another student also made good suggestions about spawn points. We decided to only let players respawn at the start of the game instead of having checkpoints; it fits better with the size of the game and encourages players to learn carefully from their actions.

Â My teammate, Sophia, also had the idea to create title and end cards as an introduction and reward for the player. The end card is an image of the cherub flying to meet one of his friends. In our alpha, we did not have any reward for the player when they reached the end of the stage, which made it disappointing for our playtesters. But we got some nice reactions to Sophiaâs heartwarming art when we playtested our beta in section. This satisfying end not only helps the game feel complete, but gives the playerâs journey meaning. We also learned important lessons about design from class. We made it a point to link our fantasy to our gameplay. As mentioned beforehand, gliding and shooting arrows are things that cherubs typically do. As the player moves through the levels of hell, they also progress upwards through the stage toward the surface. Demons, mortal enemies of angels, seek to attack the player and slow them down. When the player reaches the outside, the platforms become clouds instead of jagged rocks. Aside from these design choices, we also chose not to have a point system, so as not to incentivize killing. In this game, sneaking past enemies to get home is just as viable as shooting them. For the cherub, the goal isnât to hack and slash -- the goal is to return home, and the player can decide how they want to go about it. The gameplay is focused more on action than story, but the game itself is the story of how the cherub gets home to his friends. The player has a choice whether to be violent or not (although it does not have a bearing on the outcome of the game). Also learning from the pitfalls of crunch at major game studios, we tried to balance work between ourselves as well as balance work over the duration of our project so that it did not pile up. We made executive decisions on what to keep and what to cut, as well. Initially the game was going to have five levels and a completely different theme, but we scaled it down to be more manageable for the both of us. Although we grew attached to many of our early ideas, we learned to be aware of how they would affect the gameplay and let go of concepts that didnât fit our vision. Most importantly, we made a game that we would want to play ourselves. We both wanted a challenging game with cute art, a unique protagonist, and a sweet story. We learned a lot about working as a team to build this game, and weâre happy with the result.

--Samantha Prado, Lead Art Director of Fallen Down

ark:/13030/qt46x941jv.title: TechSafe4U
ark:/13030/qt46x941jv.description: You're called into your job as a the floor manager of a cyber-security company at 3 AM, as your company faces the worst attack in its history. Unfortunately, you lied on your resume, and you don't know a thing about computers. Will you be able to avoid coming into work, or be found out?

ark:/13030/qt4740t417.title: Blood Mafia
ark:/13030/qt4740t417.description: Blood Mafia is a Noir themed platformer. You take on the role of the "Janitor" as he is being called in to "clean up" some mafia members that have been causing a disturbance in the area. You've been given some new technology to deal with the disturbance that allows the use of super human abilities at the cost of your blood. Dash, double jump and punch your enemies at the cost of your health on your way to take out the man at the top. Collect the blood of your enemies to re-heal and help the clean up process go faster.

ark:/13030/qt47f436sf.title: Infiltrating Frat Fridays
ark:/13030/qt47f436sf.description:
Infiltrating Frat Fridays by Lauren Do
A college fraternity is notorious for having multiple sexual predators that manage to escape punishment. You're a female journalism student trying to find enough evidence of sexual assault in hopes of getting the frat suspended. However, getting that evidence brings a lot more trouble than you expected.
TW: assault, implied rape

ark:/13030/qt47h6s20r.title: Deep Sea Rescue
ark:/13030/qt47h6s20r.description: Deep Sea Rescue is a move-based game that talks about rescuing a diver under the sea. The background setting is that divers are from an expedition, and they find treasures in an ancient underwater relic. One of the divers gets hurt inside the relic and surrounded by poisonous jellyfishes, player should perform as another diver, walking through the maze and save his friend.

ark:/13030/qt47z112c1.title: Everest
ark:/13030/qt47z112c1.description: My game is about 2 friends who have decided to climb Everest. On their decent they encounter some problems and now they must fight to survive and get down the mountain.

ark:/13030/qt4815z8qv.title: Concrete
ark:/13030/qt4815z8qv.description:
Concrete by Nishant Suria
Concrete is a game that is an interactive fiction game about a lucid dream, where you explore a lifeless New York City. You explore several locations, and meet a few minor characters, but for the most part, you are alone in your own mind.
Several endings.

ark:/13030/qt4855t3cx.title: I Will Park My Spaceship Here.
ark:/13030/qt4855t3cx.description:
I Will Park My Spaceship Here. by Jerome Ang
"I Will Park My Spaceship Here." tells the story of a young farmer man named Dan who discovers that a spaceship has parked near his land. With the help of a friend of choice, how will he handle the situation and what possible consequences come from his actions? It may require sophisticated planning to get himself out of this situation.

12 possible endings.

ark:/13030/qt48m495gh.title: Pity the Dragon
ark:/13030/qt48m495gh.description: The queen has tasked you and your adventuring party with slaying a dragon. Can you do it? More importantly, do you want to?

ark:/13030/qt48n821db.title: Saving Jane Doe
ark:/13030/qt48n821db.description: The players goal is to keep the stranger and themselves alive.

ark:/13030/qt48q9x78p.title: Where are you from?
ark:/13030/qt48q9x78p.description: A conversation with an ignorant series of microaggressions based on lived experiences.

ark:/13030/qt4954g4nv.title: Laser Soldier
ark:/13030/qt4954g4nv.description: Our game is called "Laser Soldier", the instruction for this game was simple. Players can use the key "W" as going up, "A" as going left, "S" as going down, and "D" as going right. The players can left click to shoot the bullets, and use the mouse to aim to kill enemies. The laser bullets can be reflected by the mirror wall. But be aware that all enemies can attack you through the wall. Players also need to close the laser door by shooting the button to reach the portal. The players' goal is to kill the enemies to go to the portal to reach the next level.

ark:/13030/qt49p0x8g7.title: Space Murder Mystery
ark:/13030/qt49p0x8g7.description: The captain of a transport space-vessel has been murdered by one of his crew-mates. Stranded in deep-space with no way to call for help, you must find out who the killer is to save yourself and the rest of the crew. The killer's identity is random on each play-through, and must be discovered by gathering clues and paying attention to details.

ark:/13030/qt4bf0t31q.title: Germaphobe
ark:/13030/qt4bf0t31q.description: Germaphobe is a action based game where a parasite has taken over someone's body causing them to fall ill. You've shrunken into a ship called the "Pill" going through the body exterminating the infected cells with a miniature laser. Only once the infected are all destroyed will the parasite will reveal itself.

ark:/13030/qt4c20b141.title: Gatsby's College Life
ark:/13030/qt4c20b141.description: This game is about college and love. Players are intended to be trapped by college routines. However, they can play Gatsby, make new friends, do activities, and find girlfriend(s). To win this game or escape from boring routines, players can keep loving Helen, be with other girls, and there are more game-over-triggers to discover! The menu should come handy to players :) . Just play and have fun.

ark:/13030/qt4c47m7qg.title: The Merry Mystery of the Mansion of Murder (Maximally) (Name is a work in progress)
ark:/13030/qt4c47m7qg.description: A survival horror game where a mysterious creature stalks the player.

ark:/13030/qt4cq078hn.title: Dangerous Journey
ark:/13030/qt4cq078hn.description:
Dangerous Journey by Peyton Jones
Dangerous Journey is a fantasy rpg adventure game where you have to explore, kill monsters, buy equipment, and get stronger in order to find and save your kidnapped sister.

ark:/13030/qt4d87n4zb.title: Concert SHRUNK MODE
ark:/13030/qt4d87n4zb.description:
Concert SHRUNK MODE by Ethan West
In this game, you are a teenager attending a music festival with a group of friends - all is normal until the whole group takes a drug that makes them shrink till they are 2 inches tall. Whether or not you and your friends make it out of the festival alive depends on your decisions.

ark:/13030/qt4dw4w0w9.title: Not Sure If Dysentery Or Just Space
ark:/13030/qt4dw4w0w9.description:
Not Sure If Dysentery Or Just Space by Alex Rugama
Not Sure if Dysentery or Just Space or (NSDJS) is an interactive fictional game where you take on the role of captain of a spaceship. Your goal is to reach the planet Demos and deliver humanitarian aid to the human colony on the planet. The idea behind this game was to make the player think of their actions, while simultaneously offering comedic relief based on their decisions.

ark:/13030/qt4fh4v279.title: Fallen
ark:/13030/qt4fh4v279.description:
The theme word I used was "Soulmate".  I incorporated it by having "Soulmate" as the nickname of the duo you follow in the story.  Unfortunately I wasn't able to incorporate it further as I intended to do after a play tester suggested I do so. 

I wanted the player to feel like the game was simple and not that complex. It's meant to be a quick fantasy adventure game with the potential to grow into a larger, more creative game or world

ark:/13030/qt4fq7j28f.title: The Revenge of the Fallen Queen
ark:/13030/qt4fq7j28f.description: Its a CYOA game falling the story of a Fallen queen as she exacts revenge to those who hurt her.

ark:/13030/qt4fs861wb.title: Leyline
ark:/13030/qt4fs861wb.description: Leyline is a story about the memories of an android trying to make their way through a world of magic, where they feel insufficient and almost not alive at all. But a friend they meet along the way provides some insight, and teaches them how to believe in themself.

ark:/13030/qt4g0973vn.title: Red Ride
ark:/13030/qt4g0973vn.description:
Red Ride by Madelyn Sutherland
Red Ride is a word based game, where you can choose your own path and journey. It takes inspiration from the kid story "Little Red Riding Hood," but adds a choose your own adventure element to it. You will play as "Red" the protagonist of the story, where there is a possibility of 5 different endings,  the goal is to get to grandma's house. For those wanting to see childhood stories come to life.
