ark:/13030/qt7nd5q7pt.description: The player takes the role of Eleanor, an innocent 7 year-old girl trapped in the house with a mythical monster that is pursuing her. Help Eleanor find a way out of the house before she becomes yet another victim of the creature.

ark:/13030/qt7nm5p291.title: Adventure Cat's Quest
ark:/13030/qt7nm5p291.description: Adventure Cat's Quest is a game about a small orange cat who explores the desert in search of treasure. Throughout the game Adventure Cat solves three puzzles using his trusty shovel. The game is entirely made up of the player figuring out these three riddles and using the shovel to dig up treasure after solving them. After finding all three treasures, the player opens the mysterious gate to find more gold than they could possibly imagine!

ark:/13030/qt7nn745bs.title: Two Tanks
ark:/13030/qt7nn745bs.description:
In creating my game I had a few gameplay goals that I wanted to achieve. The first one was making the game difficult but not making is so difficult that the player would want to quit. I achieved this by playtesting it with multiple people and seeing if they could beat it or not. When it was difficult for them I would increase the number of lives they had and see if they did better until I found an average amoung players that I could use. The way I would determine if it was too difficult or not was based on how many times the player would die in the game. I wanted the player to experience a death a few times in the game and also wanted them to progress at a reasonable pace. Another goal we had was to make this game multiplayer. To achieve this goal we had to map the different player keys to one keyboard. Going into this project I didn't have much of an aesthetic design goal but by the end, I made it clear. I started out by wanting everything to be just plain pixel art, something that I could easily draw and possibly fit a goal. When I made the first sketch of my drawings they had almost this rustic feel to them so I adopted that style for the rest of them, making them both simplistic pixel art and rustic at the same time. I also chose to make the walls in my game solid black because I felt that they fit with the theme and they stood out among the chaos. Another element that I chose to add was to make the players and enemies more detailed compared to other elements in the game. It helps the player Identify who they are and who the enemy is.

Â 

One in-class concept that I used was the gameplay story balance. Our game is heavily focused on the gameplay rather than a story. The story is mainly what the players can interpret from each level. Another in-class concept that we used hyperlinks. Whenever the two players reach there destination the game switches to the next level. It continues to do this until the game has been beaten. Another thing that we did that was discussed in class was buff and nerf different aspects of our game until we found the right balance. These things included how many times the enemy tank could fire per second, how many times the player tank could fire per second, how many times the turret could fire per second, how many lives the player had, how many turrets were there, how many tanks were there, and the number of power-up in each map. We would assess most of this stuff based on how the player would respond to it in the game and how well the player would overcome or use these different aspects of our game

Â 

One innovative thing that we put in our game was the multiplayer feature. I did this by mapping two sets of controls to one keyboard. We wanted the player to have to communicate with his partner in making most of the in-game decisions. We didn't want the game to feel like most other multiplayer games where the players are pitted against each other, not required to communicate or long distances away from each other. Another innovative thing that we did in our game was to create an instructions section. This helped the players understand the controls in our game and what the power-ups do before they even start playing the game.

Â 

We responded to the playtesting feedback in a number of different ways. Most people when starting out the game did not know the controls or what any of the power-ups did in the game, so we started out by adding an instructions page to our game. We also adjusted the number of lives each player got at the end of our feedback to make it more balanced. We also made the bullets different colors to distinguish the player bullets from the enemy bullets because when we first started out you couldn't tell if the oncoming bullets would damage you or not. We also adjusted the tank's speed in the game to make them slower. This was a result of some players rushing to the end of the levels while dodging all of the bullets. By slowing it down just a little bit the players were no longer able to dodge the bullets.

ark:/13030/qt7nq564qg.title: A World's End
ark:/13030/qt7nq564qg.description: How do you deal with being the last person in the world?

ark:/13030/qt7nq781cb.title: Undead Dungeon
ark:/13030/qt7nq781cb.description: A Roguelike dungeon-crawler in which you play as a knight trekking through a zombie-filled dungeon, searching for the way out and grabbing what loot you can.

ark:/13030/qt7nx6p4wm.title: A Classic Knight Tale
ark:/13030/qt7nx6p4wm.description: Playing as a knight going on an adventure to save the princess. There are power up to collect and dragon to kill.

ark:/13030/qt7p56v9z2.title: Space Pirates
ark:/13030/qt7p56v9z2.description: A choice based interactive story where the player need to navigate through a pirate infested ship to save their friends.

ark:/13030/qt7pk4r2gw.title: Castle Escape
ark:/13030/qt7pk4r2gw.description: Castle Escape is a puzzle game that players play as a cloud witch who accidently fell from her home in sky. She needs to find a way to back to her home with her wonderful cloud magic.

ark:/13030/qt7pn480q2.title: Skeleton Game
ark:/13030/qt7pn480q2.description: Skeleton game is a short story where you play as a skeleton who has risen from the grave to resolve their lingering regrets. The game is intended to show a depressing subject in a more whimsical light.

ark:/13030/qt7pp7m6s4.title: They Are Among Us
ark:/13030/qt7pp7m6s4.description:
You are a conspiracy theorist that has came upon a discovery about a certain alien presence in your town. Due to the disappearances of dock workers, you believe for this alien species to be a threat. With that in mind, you set off to thwart the threat. 

A narrative RPG game. About 19 endings.
tags: Aliens. Anxiety. Adventure. Fantasy. Mental Health. Role-playing. Weird. Science Fiction.

ark:/13030/qt7qt526d0.description: The theme I chose was traffic as you had to navigate through different routes to avoid traffic or get stuck in it. My idea for the game was to make a realistic approach to an everyday kind of situation

ark:/13030/qt7rg1q2nb.title: Rapunzel
ark:/13030/qt7rg1q2nb.description:
Our game is called Rapunzel. Rapunzel is a game created with the motif of the fairy tale Rapunzel. In the Rapunzel fairy tale, I got an idea from the situation where Rapunzel was trapped by a witch and Rapunzel was running away from the tower. Our game is a game depicting the process of Rapunzel being trapped at the top of the tower and escaping the tower. The game consists of three stages, and each time you move on to the next stage, the difficulty will rise. Gameplay will proceed using the left, right, and up arrow keys. The left and right arrow keys create an action that moves the Rapunzel to the left and right respectively. Up arrow key is used to jump Rapunzel. The game starts at the top. The character then has to descend to the bottom while avoiding obstacles and stepping on the right path. When the character passes through the door at the bottom, the game is cleared.

The aesthetic goal of our game was a challenge. Our game has two difficulty levels. Easy mode and difficult mode can be selected. Game players can improve their understanding and skills in games through easy mode. In difficult mode, players challenge the game and master the game. Also, the stage of the game was divided into three stages. Each time you move to the next stage, new obstacles are added that interfere with the player, and the difficulty level of the game is increased by adjusting the position of the obstacle and the position of the footstep.

Our game includes the concept of abstraction, game-story, and difficulty. When I first built the game, I planned to make a dot game. I did not have the tools and the time to make a real Rapunzel. However, even if it was produced as a dot game, I made some details to make the characters and obstacles in the game have symbolic meaning. I made Rapunzel's character by expressing Rapunzel's long hair and beautiful blonde. I made a character symbolizing bee by expressing the bee's spit and bee's pattern. In the case of the spider, I made it a spider by describing the movement of the spider up and down.

Â  Because the aesthetic goal of our game is a challenge, we have designed the game so that the game's weight becomes larger than the story, because the control of the player has to be the mainstay of the game. The concept of the game is Rapunzel, I added a description of the game concept to the game-opening, which made the player more immersed in the game. And the part that is not fully explained in the opening was recognized as Rapunzel through game character and background image.

Â  And the playtest feedback I received when I first made the game was that the game was too difficult. Since the aesthetic goal of the game is a challenge, I did not try to control the difficulty. However, the game is so difficult that the player may lose interest, allowing the player to control the difficulty of the game. Easy difficulty games have eliminated the ability of the crystal, which is the main obstacle in the game, to make the game easier for the player.

Â  There are two main differences between our game and other platform games. One is that the progress of the game progresses from top to bottom and the speed of the drop is limited. Platform games often go from left to right. However, we decided to go from top to bottom to match the concept of escaping from the top. And other platform games did not limit the speed of the drop. Our game was going from top to bottom, so we needed a new limit. Otherwise, the game was cleared too easily. It was to limit the speed of the drop. By limiting the dropping speed, we were able to increase the level of difficulty of the game, and we were able to construct the originality of our game only.

Â  I tried to make the game difficult as I can when I first built the game. However, I received feedback that the game was too difficult in the gameplay test, and the game was so difficult that I had to quit the game because players cannot proceed to next the stage. So, I decided to choose the game difficulty level. So I made the first game in hard mode, and I created the Easy mode by removing the influence of crystal in the first game.

Â

ark:/13030/qt7rk4v82g.title: Fish
ark:/13030/qt7rk4v82g.description: A fish living in a familiar place suddenly has their stability shaken, and the familiar home is no longer as familiar.

ark:/13030/qt7rx1g93t.title: Eutology Foundation
ark:/13030/qt7rx1g93t.description:
Eutology Foundation by Nova Wallwork
It's another beautiful day to work in the Human Adjacent Resources Department! As you continue your important, exciting work of summarizing field reports from the world of Safe Space, you stumble across somthing suspicious. To what lengths will you go to in order to uncover the truth? And even if you can, how will you escape the Foundation?

ark:/13030/qt7s36w33z.title: The Ultimate Dating Application Simulator
ark:/13030/qt7s36w33z.description: I wanted to make a simulator-type of the game using the mechanism of a dating application. As the player goes through different choices and options, he/she will not only start enjoying the game but also understand a complex process of searching for his/her love.

ark:/13030/qt7sv5993j.title: Daily
ark:/13030/qt7sv5993j.description: Daily is a interactive game where you go through a series of multiple decisions. Depending on the decision the outcome of the game is different. The game is trying to distract you from completing your original objective.

ark:/13030/qt7tm700kt.title: Island
ark:/13030/qt7tm700kt.description: It is a link-based game about surviving on a deserted island.

ark:/13030/qt7tr7w81m.title: The Doomsday Survival Guide
ark:/13030/qt7tr7w81m.description: The game will let the player choose how they will survive in a ending world.

ark:/13030/qt7vd2n3sc.title: The Villainous Bar
ark:/13030/qt7vd2n3sc.description: This is a detective game, where player would enter a bar, meet different people who are in the bar, encounter a murder case, and tries his/her best to figure out who the murder(s) is/are by carefully observing and examining the clues that are given.

ark:/13030/qt7vd5f7p1.title: Dreamworld
ark:/13030/qt7vd5f7p1.description: You wake up in a strange place. Or did you really? Find your way out of the dreams and back to reality.

ark:/13030/qt7wr238r3.title: Ice Bath
ark:/13030/qt7wr238r3.description: The protagonist awakes in a bathtub full of ice and they have no idea of what has happened to them. Will they be able to find out the truth of what has happened to them? Every choice matters...

ark:/13030/qt7x84k0sb.description:
I chose the element of deer from the available choices.  I tried to incorporate it by having the deer be the main antagonists of the story. 
My main design goal was to use a familiar sight being turned dark to challenge and subvert player expectations and provide a truly bizarre experience.

ark:/13030/qt7z45g79q.title: Biochemical Weapon Hazard
ark:/13030/qt7z45g79q.description: Biochemical Weapon Hazard presents the life of a secret service agent, whose life is not just about a cool experience but filled with dangers and choices. The agent in the game must make cautious decisions to accomplish the mission and put emotions away when necessary.

ark:/13030/qt7zz789zd.title: Awakening the Princess
ark:/13030/qt7zz789zd.description: Awakening the Princess is an low-spec rpg game with a twist. The player moves around, exploring a colorful and bright world, only to begin to see some weird fragments of 'glitching'. The player begins to realize that things are not working as intended and that the usual 'save the princess' goal will soon change.

ark:/13030/qt80r400tp.title: Chef's Special
ark:/13030/qt80r400tp.description: You are the head chef in a disaster of a situation, can you save the restaurant?

ark:/13030/qt8176v62g.title: Monochrome Memories
ark:/13030/qt8176v62g.description:
Monochrome Memories by Danielle Kraljevski
Monochrome Memories is an interactive game dealing with topics of loss and love with a space like navigation through links. A game that delves into finding lost memories and finding the color in life when things seem dull in order to understand that we can not change the past, but we can remember and cherish it.

ark:/13030/qt81k9d1cg.title: House of Monster
ark:/13030/qt81k9d1cg.description:
House of Monster by Tsoi Chun Yin
House of Monster is a word dungeon game where player have to make series of choices in order to escape the abandoned house. This game has multiple endings and included a puzzle and an inventory system.

ark:/13030/qt81s7k0hd.title: The Deer on a Snowland
ark:/13030/qt81s7k0hd.description:
I wanted the user to engage into the game, exploring each story, piece by piece, to see the whole story like a puzzle. The story not only continues on the chamber(imaginary) side but impacts how things are going to happen in real world too in the endings. All endings have meanings, but true ending is meant to be hard and go through repetitive steps, for users who like the game can have longer experience and in each loop different flashbacks could be visited so covers the entire story.
After all these steps, I wanted user to feel katharsis  from how the deer actually played a role and what deer actually was to me.

ark:/13030/qt81w489n7.title: The Dive
ark:/13030/qt81w489n7.description: this is an updated version of my previous submission

ark:/13030/qt81z6295p.title: On Romance and Seagulls
ark:/13030/qt81z6295p.description: In the game, you play as a high schooler named CJ. You have a prophetic nightmare about what will happen to you at school, and you try to make choices to avoid this fate. You navigate your school life including trying to look cool in front of your crush, while avoiding your romantic rival: Chad McChad.

ark:/13030/qt8228643r.title: Lonk
ark:/13030/qt8228643r.description: Lonk is a Binding Of Issac-esque game where the player plays as a savage demon who wishes to sow havoc and lay waste to all who stand in their way. The player is dropped into levels with small obstacles and heroes they must slay as quickly as possible, if the player takes too long reinforcements will trickle in and eventually overwhelm the player, incentivizing more aggressive play. Player moves around with good ol' WASD, aims with the mouse, attacks with m1 and has a short blink to move short distances quickly

ark:/13030/qt826491n0.title: Self Defense of Bunny
ark:/13030/qt826491n0.description: Our game is about a bunny who has to defend himself from evil cats and foxes. You can defend yourself by throwing bacon, make sure to replenish your health with carrots along the way! The game is in the style of a birds-eye zombie shooter.

ark:/13030/qt8295v7z3.title: On the Brink
ark:/13030/qt8295v7z3.description: My game presents an experience of surviving a catastrophic explosion and granting the player the ability to perish, save others, and save themselves.

ark:/13030/qt82f850gk.title: Wyman's Diner
ark:/13030/qt82f850gk.description:
Wyman's Diner by Devin Akahoshi
In a mysterious town, 7 people have gone missing. The events happened on a weekly basis. For this week, the eighth victim was your sister. The last you remember of her, she was working her part-time job at diner. In an attempt to find clues on her whereabouts, you decide to become a bus boy for that very same diner.
A narrative mystery game.

ark:/13030/qt83b4x4rx.title: Gender Shooter
ark:/13030/qt83b4x4rx.description: "Gender Shooter" is a shooting based re-skin of the classic 1970s game "Space Invaders." In this game players are tasked without shooting down and destroying gender and sexuality stereotypes represented by different colored text bubbles of common stereotypical phrases and ideas.

ark:/13030/qt83h0r3h5.title: In an Orderly Fashion
ark:/13030/qt83h0r3h5.description: In an Orderly Fashion' is Mexican-American's immigration simulation game. You, the player, are a law-abiding citizen trying to cross the border between Tijuana and San Diego. Gameplay is random, and much of it's out of your control: it changes depending on the guards' racism, the border's security level, your anxiety, your ethnicity, your appearance, and so forth. You have a variety of possible responses, based on constitutional rights, your self-respect, your personal background, and more. All of these responses may or may not help you cross. As you talk to immigration authorities, check your privilege: it will open and close certain doors.

ark:/13030/qt83q4v0q9.title: Rush Hours
ark:/13030/qt83q4v0q9.description:
Game Mechanics: Direction Keys to control player car left move right, right move right, and up is a jump. "R" key is restart. Clicking left mouse button to navigate on the menu.
Items: Red Heart for HP up, Star for invisible. 
Resource: Survive Time and Score. You as the player car need to avoid the traffic blue car to collect Star. Touching blue cars will damage you 1 heart. After you get the start, you will have 5 second invisible time to kill blue car for scores. 
Gameplay Genre: 2-D platform Game. 
Theme: Make the traffic. You hate traffic and want to destroy all the cars.
Literary Genre: Destruction makes people happy! 
Goal: Let people gain excitement when they can destroy cars and gain as many points as possible.  

When we start to create this graphical game, I started with the theme in mind. How traffic in the real world can relate with gameplay and let the player enjoy? I start to think about why people hate traffic. People hate traffic because they canât move and must be stuck inside the line. To provide people solution to release their pressure in the real world, I create my gameplay mechanism which player as an angry driver can destroy cars in front of their car. However, an invincible car wonât provide the gamer any challenge when playing the game. I need to make the game harder which player car canât destroy other enemy cars until they collect the invincible star item. I also add more enemy types, like enemy car and enemy bus, to the world, and the linear world map which player car need some time to drive to the end. The enemies and items will randomly spawn through the world which player will discover different each time they play the game. In the end, I made the game world into an infinite loop which player can continue playing the game until they die. All these add up to the gameplay, which makes gameplay more diverse and longer. The aesthetic goal of this game is to provide people fun about the concept without thinking about the real world. We adapt 2d art which makes this game more accessible to people of all age because we donât want people to start playing our game and felt bad about those cars they destroyed. At the same time, the art needs to be recognized as car, road, sky or building.

I learned a lot from this class about the concept and theories of game design, and I also tried to utilize some of them inside this game. For example, we tunning the control of the player car a lot to make it feel good to play. I learned that like the star war game inside the lecture, the player control needs to be good enough so that people wouldnât frustrate about the game control and lose connection with the in-game character. Besides, to add up the player connected to the player car, I add three lines of back story at the start of the game. These three lines of text send the message to the player that the player car is the angry driver to control. This class also teach us to be a great playtester. When we think we have finished the game, we will playtest the game again and again. We always found some bugs here and there which hard to find if you donât play the game. Last but not least, this class teach me about the resource and loop player can get. We create Heart and Invicinble star as in-game items for the player car to live longer and destroy more car. When you destroy the enemy car, you also will get scores to add on to the center of the screen. All these looping systems from HP and Stars into scores and survive time give players a goal to achieve in this game.Â 

Different than other platformer game, like Mario, our game only has one platform. In this platform, the player needs shifts between surviving and attacking stages constantly. Player need to survive in the rush of cars until they find the invincible star to attack back. Other than games like Mario, our game didnât have a goal to reach in the end. The game provides and constant changing loop which player needs to survive as long as possible. This combination of gameplay mechanism is novel which I donât see in other games.

According to many playtesting from different people, we correct our game a lot. From the alpha playtest, our peer played the game and think the control is lacking, which the player car canât jump high enough and the car shift too much when turning. To fix the first problem, we tunning control by changing the jump strength and gravity. This makes the control felt more smooth and responsive. For the second one, we change the center of the turning to the player car sprit. Now, when the player turns left or right, the player car will shift at the same place. Form TAâs grading comments which the background is too bright to distinguish the items from it. We change the whole background into lighter and darker than before. Then we bring up the items sprits contrast and brightness to the max. This makes the items pop out from the background which let player more easy to see. From our own playtest, we discover lots of problems when we playing the game instead of looking at the code itself. For example, survive time wonât stop when you game over. After we correct the mistake and play the game again, survive time will stop forever when you die once. We finally solve this problem through many playtest. The playtest and tunning is helpful and need before you ship your game.

To conclude, the process of making this graphical game make use of them in class knowledge and bring my game making skill into the next level. I appreciate the time I spend in making this game and tunning it into the final version.

ark:/13030/qt8431d7bb.title: Small Forest
ark:/13030/qt8431d7bb.description: You wake up in a forest, unsure of where you got there and who you are. Your goal is to try to figure out what happened and how to get out

ark:/13030/qt84f2x5mv.title: Forbidden Love
ark:/13030/qt84f2x5mv.description: Sneak to your girlfriend's house without getting caught.

ark:/13030/qt85b6f3f8.title: Life after Death
ark:/13030/qt85b6f3f8.description: A small story set in the world of my RPG Wanderlust! It follows a character that quits their exciting job of an assassin and try to construct a more domestic life.

ark:/13030/qt85m581w6.title: Imposter Syndrome
ark:/13030/qt85m581w6.description:
Tend to the yearning every youth feels, descend into the heart of the unknown, and claim what is not yours. In "Imposter Syndrome", you, the player, reach into the darkness and see what grabs your hand. Navigate a dark dungeon more crowded than your typical abandoned lair, and shine the way to solve puzzles, part seas, and unpeel the world around you. You won't know what you're after until you're there, and then you'll know that your greatest shield is your courage.

"Imposter Syndrome" is a top-down puzzle game that invites the player to manipulate light to  open the path forth in a dark dungeon. It's a game that invites the player to make their own distinctions about the environment, player skills, and the namesake of the game.

ark:/13030/qt85p712g0.title: Street Dog
ark:/13030/qt85p712g0.description: You follow the day of a street dog who, based on your decisions, can either find a new home with a new loving family or be led to a shelter.

ark:/13030/qt87r6g14w.title: the door
ark:/13030/qt87r6g14w.description: the door is a thrilling fiction game in a world where the Earth has connected with the void through portals in the basements of anyone's homes. You play as a young man discovers one of these portals in his house in the form of an ordinary doorway. In this game you explore your relationship with you deceased mother as the world goes into a war to preserve humanity.

ark:/13030/qt8879j5q2.title: Jungle Book
ark:/13030/qt8879j5q2.description: Our game is aimed at 3-8 years old. The game can explore 10 key animals and their unique things. We made a simple game since it is for children. To play this game, the player will need to control the sprite in any direction. As you move the sprite, you need to collide with animals to earn scores and to read the description of the animal. The goal is to explore all 10 animals and earn 10 points in total! The order of animals does not matter in this game.

ark:/13030/qt88g4t7qv.title: Zalaga
ark:/13030/qt88g4t7qv.description: Zalaga is a reskin of the game Galaga, recreating the game with the theme of a zombie apocalypse. Players battle an endless horde of zombies, blasting them to try and get the highest score.

ark:/13030/qt88k1z61c.title: Smudged Charcoal and Hazy Outlines
ark:/13030/qt88k1z61c.description: Smudged Charcoal and Hazy Outlines is a short narrative-based game in which the player looks back on the memory of the narrator's slowly corroding friendship, and then explores two potential outcomes for dealing with the conflict.

ark:/13030/qt88n794r3.title: Soulmate
ark:/13030/qt88n794r3.description: There is a 'looping ending' at the end, try to find it!

ark:/13030/qt89b23554.title: Hunter
ark:/13030/qt89b23554.description: Hunter is a story based twine game that allows you to choose your path of becoming a fully-fledge treasure hunter, or greed and join the darker path. There are many options in the storyline, so you have control over your experiences and the decisions you make. You are in charge of your own destiny.

ark:/13030/qt89m36745.title: GachaQuest
ark:/13030/qt89m36745.description: GachaQuest is a Pac-Man-like that explores the struggles of gacha game addiction. Navigate a treasure-filled maze as slightly creepy versions of your favorite F/GO units hunt you down and tempt you to whale. How long can your bank account survive?

ark:/13030/qt89s0k8wk.title: Grocery Dash
ark:/13030/qt89s0k8wk.description: The goal of the game is to collect all the items and return to the check out before times runs out. Player must navigate using the arrow keys and avoid obstacles  such as running into children and other customers.

ark:/13030/qt89x490bq.title: an odd convention
ark:/13030/qt89x490bq.description:
an odd convention by Hunter Hechtl
You are at a seemingly normal anime convention in some nondescript nearby city. However you soon find that you can't leave the convention center for some reason. 
Finding that you are caught in a time loop, you need to figure out the right path of events that will lead you to the true end of the convention and also your escape.

ark:/13030/qt8b2474qs.title: Greyhound
ark:/13030/qt8b2474qs.description: Greyhound is an interactive fiction game where you play as someone who lives with his personal demons. You have to manage by living through the day and remember the ones close to you. This game is supposed to be informative on how people deal with their trauma on a daily basis.

ark:/13030/qt8bb6x400.title: Distance
ark:/13030/qt8bb6x400.description:
Distance by Nathann Latimore
You've stumbled across a dirty photograph of you and your dad. As you try to scratch the markings away, you realize that you're having trouble remembering his face. This should be easy, right? The funeral was a while ago, but, if anything, this should be something simple to remember. In "Distance", a text-based hyper-link game, you traverse the interconnected pathways of your memory by uncovering moments that shine a light on special times with your family, all in an attempt to rediscover your father's smile.

ark:/13030/qt8bh919vg.title: Spirited Chase
ark:/13030/qt8bh919vg.description: A rendition of Pac-Man with some new twists along with a Spirited Away theme.

ark:/13030/qt8bj1518t.title: My Isekai
ark:/13030/qt8bj1518t.description: It's time to get reborn into another world! Experience strange whacky adventures as you embark on your own interesting journey. Explore a fantasy world brimming with secrets or experience something unexpected. The choice is yours.

ark:/13030/qt8bk4c41s.title: Murderer
ark:/13030/qt8bk4c41s.description:
Murderer by Noah Heath
Murderer is a short interactive experience where you wake up, not knowing how you got to where you are or what has happened. You must make a few decisions along the way which will ultimately decide your fate.
Similar run throughs. Three endings.

ark:/13030/qt8bx6f4cs.title: League
ark:/13030/qt8bx6f4cs.description: you play an exciting game of league of legends

ark:/13030/qt8c39k8vh.title: Vehicle Accident
ark:/13030/qt8c39k8vh.description: You are traveling down the street when you observe an accident about to happen. Your choices can affect the outcome but in the end will not directly determine what happens.

ark:/13030/qt8c82k3st.title: "Happy"
ark:/13030/qt8c82k3st.description: My game is talked about a human who switch body with his dog and he must find a way to figure out what's going on and what he should do.

ark:/13030/qt8cn2x0m7.title: Traffic // Soulmate
ark:/13030/qt8cn2x0m7.description: The themes I picked were Traffic and Soulmate. When I saw the theme options, I immediately knew I wanted to make a traffic love story. To incorporate the theme of traffic, the initial situation of the game in the player stuck in bumper to bumper misery. And to incorporate the theme of soulmates, I tried to weave the theme  into almost all of the conclusions of my twine game. Something I really wanted the player to feel was the vast difference in outcomes small decisions had. A simple music choice would determine whether or not the player could get arrested or end up in the hospital. Hopefully I succeeded in this. To sum up the game in three words: Traffic, Love, and Butterflies. Butterflies because of the butterfly effect, or how minuscule choices have earth shattering differences in outcomes.

ark:/13030/qt8dw3g41m.title: An Orphan's Uncertainty
ark:/13030/qt8dw3g41m.description: An interactive fiction set in the 19th century that explores the freedom and loneliness of being orphaned at a young age spanning from childhood to adulthood.

ark:/13030/qt8fg908r7.title: Ferrets On the Run
ark:/13030/qt8fg908r7.description:
Ferrets On the Run by Esmeralda Rangel
You come home from work to find things are behaving slightly odd.
Could it be intruders?
With three different endings, find out how you would react to a business of critters roaming around in your home.

ark:/13030/qt8g76r1cs.title: Among Us but Hypertext
ark:/13030/qt8g76r1cs.description: It's actually a lot like what the title sounds like.  You play as a crewmate among the Skeld and try to eject imposters and not die to them as they roam around.

ark:/13030/qt8g8308dr.description: The theme I chose is "falling." My whole game is about a person trying to suicide by jumping off a building. Well, you don't necessarily need to fall based on your choices, but falling is like a concept and a kind of endings in my game. In this game, I want players to feel that they are not just making choices for a person, but they are the person standing on the roof. I use the words "you/your" a lot because of that. Also, I don't want the players to be too upset while playing this game. So, I intentionally wrote a lot of words in a cold, emotionless tone. "Everything happens, but you only want to die." I forced players to accept all the information so that they feel less awkward and more natural to think in the way I provide. Moreover, I don't think my character should be emotional. I think it works pretty well with some funny joking words or choices I put in there.

ark:/13030/qt8gq1v656.title: Ion
ark:/13030/qt8gq1v656.description:
Ion by Fiona Hsu
Growing up in the Metro, the only way for average people like you to survive is to take up whatever dirty work someone is willing to hire you for. After a job goes wrong, it's up to you to decide the best course of action to rescue your team. However, you have a gut feeling that there seems to be more going on in the shadows than what you can see...

ark:/13030/qt8h93x9rr.title: Apple's Picking
ark:/13030/qt8h93x9rr.description: A small game with apples and monsters. Players control a character to fight off monsters and collect apples in a small map.

ark:/13030/qt8j35014n.title: Lost in Space
ark:/13030/qt8j35014n.description: The player is captive on a spaceship and they're tasked with escaping.

ark:/13030/qt8j90g74x.title: Killed in Cold Blood
ark:/13030/qt8j90g74x.description: Your car breaks down in a snowstorm and you have to take shelter in a hotel where a murder was recently committed.

ark:/13030/qt8jb0211q.title: Deer Game Beta
ark:/13030/qt8jb0211q.description: My theme word was deer and I incorporated it by having the player be a deer.  The goal was to invoke the feeling of a young deer just exploring and having fun.

ark:/13030/qt8jg598t2.title: Amorphous
ark:/13030/qt8jg598t2.description: Amorphous is the story of a formless blob looking for meaning. The blob escapes into its fantasies where it imagines what life could be like without depression, anxiety, and hollowness. This game is a platformer where each level represents an emotion. In each level, an entirely unique character with unique strengths, weaknesses, and abilities provides different gameplay styles every level. Explore what these characters represent to the blob, and how it chooses to cope with its suffering.

ark:/13030/qt8k06z2x7.title: The Link Between Us - Den of the First
ark:/13030/qt8k06z2x7.description: You take on the role of the first wolf to ever encounter human beings, and choose whether to ignore them or get closer to them in small ways until they accept you as one of their own.

ark:/13030/qt8k11847d.title: Dark Matter
ark:/13030/qt8k11847d.description:
Dark Matter by Nathan Tejeda
Dark Matter is a link based text game that takes place inside of the protagonists family beach house. For some reason the sky seemingly went black and it's up to you to find your way out of the beach house that you now seem to be stuck in and find your family who went missing. The game allows you to explore the house and interact with your environment by picking up and examining objects.

ark:/13030/qt8kq349fj.title: Down the Rabbit Hole BETA
ark:/13030/qt8kq349fj.description: The main gameplay goal is a game with high replayability and simple controls, somewhat similar to the classic arcade games. This game has similar classic air combat games. That is, the player has to evade every bullet (for this case, every teacup) and survive as much as you can. With several innovative difference, which will be described in a later paragraph, this is a typical arcade game, so high replay-ability of replay is quite achieved in considerable degree. And there are only two kinds of keys, which are using items and moving horizontally. And there can be only 3 positions that players can place. So simple control is also achieved.The main aesthetic goal is to achieve strong cohesion between theme and gameplay. Our theme is âAlice in the Wonderlandâ, more specifically the falling scene when Alice enters the rabbit hole. This falling theme is not only closely related to the gameplay mechanics but also the theme word we provided from the lecture. Artworks are carefully chosen to represent the âAlice in the wonderlandâ theme. Rabbitâs clock, the âDrinkmeâ potion, Ace of Heart and the teacups are all directly related to the important imageries of the story. Even the game music, which is not composed by ourselves, is sharing the same theme of us. Except for Aliceâs explosion at the end, all of the details are closely linked to the theme. So we think our aesthetic goal is achieved.As we learned from the lecture, the decision is what makes a game interesting. If there are too many decisions to make at one time, it makes players confused. But if there are too few options for the decision, it will make a game boring. At first sight, it seems that our game is a simple no-brainer dexterity game. That is not true. The Ace of Heart cards, which can eliminate upcoming teacups, are the most common items in the game. You can use this item right away, or keep it till the stage becomes much harder. This makes the players make a choice and strategy. Also, there is another kind of decision there. If players collide to the rabbitâs clock, it will grant 50 points, which is five times of normal teacup breaking points. However, the rabbitâs clock reverses the direction of teacup for 2 seconds and reverse again. During this time, the movement pattern of teacups is confusing. So it is likely to kill player because of it. A player can choose between to raise a score by going through a risky way or to choose a safe way by giving extra points away. This choice happens periodically. This is why this game is really addictive. I guess this is also related to the operant conditioning, which was covered in the lecture.We tried to design a fresh game with some innovative features. Actually, we are not deep into the air combat game, which is perhaps the most similar kind of game to ours. Our ignorance liberated us from the genreâs cliche and encouraged us to make peculiar features. For example, there is no enemy to fight against here. Instead of making an enemy to conquer, we just throw players in infinite teacup rain. Furthermore, we give users a limited power for active shooting. This decision is mainly due to the theme we implemented and the limitation of a number of total events. And we donât think that kind of enemy is really necessary here. Big differences to relatives but a satisfying one. The time-traveling rabbitâs clock and 'Drinkme' potion, which temporarily reduces the size of Alice, is also unique items in this game. One of the most important innovations in our game is a strongly convincing theme of items. In combat games, items look like military supplies which are quite general and boring. In our game, we used game items from the original story so that we can understand what will happen if we use those items even before we really play it. We reflected several feedbacks from playtesters in our final beta version. One of the most important change is the UI. Before the beta version, we try to explain every important rule using plain texts. But after we got the feedback, we realize an image base description will improve UI and the playerâs understanding of the game. Some feedbacks are really critical to the gameplay. Every velocity in the game, including falling of Alice, speed of cups and items, and even speed of background is half as slow when we first built the alpha version. This version can easily lose tension and even harder for it has non-intuitive timing. This problem was also discussed feedback so we fixed it.'

ark:/13030/qt8m02725s.description:
Theme : Traffic
Traffic is changed by time. When time is close to evening , traffic becomes heavy.
And road situation is change due to several reasons, for example Parade, time.
I wanted player to feel that they are in the Pride.
I wanted player to have an indirect experience for traveling from Santa Cruz to San Francisco.
I wanted to evoke the feeling of traveling.

ark:/13030/qt8m75901c.title: The trip of love
ark:/13030/qt8m75901c.description: This is the story of Aliza, a girl who got engaged happily but in an arranged way and is going to marry him in a few months. She decided to go on a long trip with her friends and enjoy her bachelor life. When she was going back home she missed the plane and left alone at the airport. When she was at the airport she met a guy who missed the plane too. She eventually starts to like him and fall in love with him. It takes a long time for her to realize that. Now she has to decide between her fiance and her love. If she chooses her fiance, there might be chances she will not be happy. On the other hand, if she chooses her love, her parents will not accept it. There could be chances that her parents will kill her love.

ark:/13030/qt8n289569.title: Kingdom of Jadesi
ark:/13030/qt8n289569.description: Kingdom of Jadesi is a kingdom simulator semi-realistic test idea to condition future kings and leaders. You must carry your kingdom to become a global power but each decision you make has great benefits and consequences to you and your kingdom. Will you succeed in becoming a beloved leader and global super power?

ark:/13030/qt8p51n81x.title: Nightmare (work in progress)
ark:/13030/qt8p51n81x.description: A nightmare I had a couple years ago that I wrote down, which made it easy to return to. It's about a monster in my house.

ark:/13030/qt8pd6263d.title: Dating Simulator
ark:/13030/qt8pd6263d.description: It's a dating simulator, choose the right decision to get a girlfriend!

ark:/13030/qt8pp9f7vp.title: Bomb in a Room
ark:/13030/qt8pp9f7vp.description: Protagonist wakes up in a room with a bomb and only a book to defuse it.

ark:/13030/qt8pr3r5hw.title: COVID-19 Snake Game
ark:/13030/qt8pr3r5hw.description: Pandemic inspired snake game where the snake grabs as many vaccines as possible, while avoiding the covid viruses that are moving throughout the screen

ark:/13030/qt8pr596qx.title: Wake Up
ark:/13030/qt8pr596qx.description:
Wake Up by Lucy Purvis
You wake up with no recollection of the previous day.
You find your way home to a horrific scene.
You have to act quickly.
Remember, try to keep a hold on your sanity.

ark:/13030/qt8pv5z269.title: Onto the breach
ark:/13030/qt8pv5z269.description: A game involving intense emotions, retrospection, hope and overcoming.

ark:/13030/qt8q24z715.title: life
ark:/13030/qt8q24z715.description:
Life by Paul Shand
A typical morning in the life of a high schooler making choices based on being good or bad.
depending on the amount of good or bad choices different endings await.

ark:/13030/qt8qb5s6hg.title: The Company
ark:/13030/qt8qb5s6hg.description: Office space meets rampage. Navigate office politics and don't end up in jail.

ark:/13030/qt8r25628s.title: Overseer
ark:/13030/qt8r25628s.description:
Overseer by Waylon Peng
You are a space station AI. There's been a catastrophe. Wake up, there's work to do.

ark:/13030/qt8r96w478.title: Island Survival
ark:/13030/qt8r96w478.description: The game is about survival on a deserted island. The protagonist crash landed on a mysterious island and has make use of all the possible resources to better his/her chance of survival.

ark:/13030/qt8rp492mv.title: UCSC Traffic Center
ark:/13030/qt8rp492mv.description:
What I made for the Twine game is an educational game that helps to learn UCSC Traffic. Since I am visiting student from South Korea for this summer session, I didn't know how to take public transportations. When I first came to UC Santa Cruz, the global leaders help us to talk buses, for example, students can take bus free except 17, there is a jump bike or the direction to go to downtown. This motivates me to make this "UCSC Traffic Center for Visitors" game.
The game contains seven stages and three hidden stages. There is one big game story penetrating all the stages, which is, "you are a visiting student from South Korea who doesn't know the traffic very well, and you want to learn how to take transportation" just like me! Also, there is a score on the control board, which is increased if you correct the answer. The stages are categorized into three sections, "inside", "downtown", and "san Jose" sections. At the last stage in each section, you will enter the hidden stage if your score is too low to pass. These hidden stages provide additional problems for each section.
You can find "Hall of Fame" and "Hall of Shame" at the end of the game. It is revealed if you got 7 and 0, respectively. Unfortunately, I couldn't make a ranking board, but I think it will be great if it is in the Hall of Fame.
I hope this game may help other visiting students who are the first to the UC Santa Cruz. Every summer, there will be many Korean students just like me! I really hope they can easily learn the traffic, and freely use them to travel to this beautiful city and university.

ark:/13030/qt8rq2j9xm.title: False Robber
ark:/13030/qt8rq2j9xm.description: False Robber is a game where you play as an innocent person in the wrong place at the wrong time. You were framed for a robbery, and the culprits are on the run. Make quick decisions, find evidence, and find the real culprits before you are arrested.

ark:/13030/qt8s50p90c.title: Deer Hunter
ark:/13030/qt8s50p90c.description:
I used Deer in this story.
I wanted the player to feel that he/she is the deer in the story. In this story, the deer is in many dangerous situations. Whenever the deer gets in danger, I wanted the player to choose sincerely to save the deer. It must be a hard choice, but will be fun!

ark:/13030/qt8s51f29c.title: Flora And Fawna
ark:/13030/qt8s51f29c.description: Flora And Fawna is a lighthearted puzzle-platformer where you take the role of a woodland creature named Fawna saving her forest from pollution and deforestation machines. Throughout her adventure, Fawna must avoid obstacles and enemies as she navigates through 4 different levels. By solving puzzles using button patterns and interactions with the environment, Fawna can save the forest and have fun along the way!

ark:/13030/qt8s86437q.title: Deerly Beloved
ark:/13030/qt8s86437q.description:
When initially coming up for the concept of the game, it was clear there were some severe limitations on the amount of mechanical complexity we could fit into the game as well as some slight graphical limitations. Navigating through the constraints of theme, minimal mechanical complexity, and a deadline really encouraged a great amount of creativity in the design process. Hereâs a window into the development of the gameplay and aesthetic goals of âDeerly Belovedâ:Â 

Theme: Right off the bat, âDeerâ as the theme word intrigued me as I had already explored both âTrafficâ and âSoulmateâ in my Twine Game. It seemed as though it would be less explored by other students, so it might be an opportunity to be innovative or at least different. Once the theme word was chosen, the rest of the theme and concept came naturally. The player would control a deer. What do deer do in the wild? Survive. So survival would be our theme.Â 

Gameplay: With survival as the theme, two core mechanics came to mind; needs management and danger aversion. Maybe thereâs a better term for it, but by needs management I mean managing thirst, hunger, sickness... etc. Danger aversion is pretty self explanatory. My favorite survival game, Minecraft, employs both of these very well. Hunger and Health serve as the needs that need to be managed, and enemies must be avoided, at least initially. In our game, we decided that Hunger would be a good need to manage and danger in the form of hunters wielding guns would be a good threat to avoid. Because both of these mechanics need to be executed simultaneously, the player has to perform a sort of juggling act, transferring between the states of collecting food and avoiding projectiles. If the player focuses only on one, they risk falling victim to the other responsibility. I think it is a simple yet compelling gameplay loop. We chose to quantify the success of the player through a score. This was to give the player an external motivation to continue surviving. In addition we added a 1 up system in which a player can earn an extra life in the form of a fawn, who is willing to take a bullet for the player. This was an attempt to add a little more emotional potency to the game, but by the time the playerâs score hits triple digits the stage is most likely already littered in baby deer and doe corpses. Maybe now it serves more as a criticism of the exploitation of wildlife.Â By choosing to utilize some conventions of classic survival games, as well as implementing several other features, hopefully we succeeded in creating a compelling and innovative gameplay experience.

Aesthetic: Given the somewhat limited graphical capabilities of Construct 3 and it's good presentation of pixelated art styles, a retro pixel art seemed only natural. It also helped that I was a bit obsessed with making pixelated versions of my favorite TV show characters in early high school, so I had a bit of experience going in. Since I made both the textures and sounds for the game, I wanted them to be stylistically consistent. This meant the hard edges of the textures would have to be translated to audio, aka chiptune. I used a really great in-browser music making software called beepbox.co to compose the music and create several other sound assets for the game. Through the use of pixelated textures and bit reduced audio, I think we succeeded in creating a retro pixel art aesthetic.

Goals: To sum it up more concisely, our goal was to create a lofi and nostalgia evoking aesthetic experience, while creating an intriguing gameplay loop to encourage players to rack up high scores.

Problems & Solutions: Through several playtesting sessions with classmates, we got some valuable feedback and insights into the reception of âDeerly Belovedâ. Luckily there was no evil data to speak of, just very awesome, supportive, and informative (awesuppormative) classmates. One instance of this feedback was the initial placement and lack of movement of the hunter enemies. They would sit stationary in the four corners of the stage, endlessly firing at you. This was a bit difficult for some, especially considering the near invisible bullets. In turn, we changed the hunter placement, added movement and increased visibility of the bullets. Many times however, I did stick with Looneyâs advice that you are your greatest critic.Â 

Fin: In the end, creating âDeerly Belovedâ with Sheng was a great opportunity to learn more about game design, art, and people.

ark:/13030/qt8s98c9n1.title: Pacifisht
ark:/13030/qt8s98c9n1.description: Pacifisht is a casual game about the ocean food chain. Swim through the ocean as a fish with your school while trying to avoid becoming a snack for bigger fish.

ark:/13030/qt8sv9v001.title: Desperate
ark:/13030/qt8sv9v001.description:
Desperate by Franz Eugenio
Desperate tells a story about a man trying to save his wife from a unknown disease. With no one helping him, he comes across a Reddit user that is offering him a cure. In order to be given this cure, the protagonist is given several tasks to which he can choose from to complete.

ark:/13030/qt8t0841fv.title: The Forest We Deserve
ark:/13030/qt8t0841fv.description: The Forest We Deserve is a short, explorative, twine game in which you play a tired university student wandering aimlessly into the woods by their dorm. Given the circumstances surrounding COVID-19, I wanted to create a game that simulated a return to UCSC's upper campus forest.

ark:/13030/qt8tf2m956.title: Void
ark:/13030/qt8tf2m956.description: A simulation of a being trying to create a universe in the void. Yet there is some mystery that makes you feel a bit uneasy. Play through the game multiple times to try and uncover the one true ending.

ark:/13030/qt8tf6z68c.title: Dream
ark:/13030/qt8tf6z68c.description:
Dream by Yunzhou(Richard) Ma
A game that tells a story how an employee is trapped in his dream in a sci-fi world and struggles to escape through various hints and actions. The game aims to reflect a similar world as in the film "inception"

ark:/13030/qt8tp0n28x.title: The Rocky Road to Rocky
ark:/13030/qt8tp0n28x.description: Satirical Interactive Adventure About a Rock

ark:/13030/qt8tw0k70q.title: Apocalypse Story
ark:/13030/qt8tw0k70q.description: You play as a middle aged man trying to reunite with his daughter as a zombie apocalypse begins. Run through hordes of zombies and other perils to achieve your goal.

ark:/13030/qt8vb116b1.title: Space
ark:/13030/qt8vb116b1.description: Space' is a shooting game. The game takes place in space, and players have to control a spaceship while defeating hostile aliens who are constantly trying to bring down the spaceship, and in order to fight back, players are able to shoot bullets to defend their spaceships, while gaining points and proceeding to the boss level. The game will be cleared after they defeat the boss.

ark:/13030/qt8x47w49z.title: Macabre Manor
ark:/13030/qt8x47w49z.description: Macabre Manor is a horror based game similar to a graphic novel. Its content is also rather graphic and should not be played by younger audiences. It follows an unlucky person who gets stuck in a manor in the woods and must escape. Unfortunately, there are many hardships ahead of them, and they must find a way to survive their time in the manor.

ark:/13030/qt8xb1n1fd.title: Falling Out
ark:/13030/qt8xb1n1fd.description: The theme word I selected was Falling and incorporated Falling in my Twine Game by writing a story based on a falling out I had with an old friend of mine in real life. I wanted the player to know what it feels like to be betrayed by someone who you knew for a long time and I did this by deliberately writing this story from a 1st person view. People can relate to this story a lot if I didn't give the main character a name and by writing "I" a lot.

ark:/13030/qt8zk5j2hw.title: Homeless
ark:/13030/qt8zk5j2hw.description: Homeless is a link-based choose your own adventure based on homelessness in Santa Cruz. Imagine you wake up on the streets with no money and no shelter? Navigate through Santa Cruz and try to survive a day homeless.

ark:/13030/qt8zn3v9qc.title: Prison
ark:/13030/qt8zn3v9qc.description:
Prison by Victor Gallegos
Prison is a game where the player controls the protagonist's experiences of a somewhat stereotypical day in prison. This game pushes the limitation of freedom and reflections of past life that may occur while in a prison confinement.

ark:/13030/qt8zv1r5ck.title: COVID-19 Simulator
ark:/13030/qt8zv1r5ck.description:
COVID-19 Simulator by Brandon Tanega
COVID-19 Simulator is a game that simulates our current pandemic and how different age groups have to go through their day to live their lives as normal as possible amidst the pandemic. This game can be used as a lesson to teach the player how to be cautious in their decision making as the desired end result of the game is to survive healthily.

ark:/13030/qt8zw2n67w.title: Invaded Space
ark:/13030/qt8zw2n67w.description:
The player will be the youngest siblings in a family,
and there are many hardness that he has to go through.
Silbings are teasing him, bullying him,
he needs to find a way out.

ark:/13030/qt90w2c0hn.title: Cult Ritual
ark:/13030/qt90w2c0hn.description:
Cult Ritual by Aidan Cannon
Cult Ritual is an interactive fiction game about a reporter who receives an anonymous tip one night and ends up discovering a secret cult attempting to wake an ancient evil.

ark:/13030/qt90x5z7m3.title: A Slug's Journey
ark:/13030/qt90x5z7m3.description: A slug wakes up in the forest and is disoriented, they come to realize they have amnesia. The player must follow the clues of the game to figure out what is going on.

ark:/13030/qt9104j618.title: I. L. Y.
ark:/13030/qt9104j618.description:
I. L. Y. by Jackson Tran
 Mark and Stacy, a loving couple, are dealing with a psycho killer who is Stacy's ex-boyfriend. Overtaken by love and obsession, the killer aims to separate Mark and Stacy. The couple will face difficult and consequential choices that will either lead to their death or survival.

ark:/13030/qt91q9f5z6.title: George's dungeon crawler
ark:/13030/qt91q9f5z6.description: You wake up in a maze-like dungeon and have to fight/find your way out

ark:/13030/qt92j963d8.title: Press Play
ark:/13030/qt92j963d8.description:
Press Play by Justin Hu
Press Play is a fourth-wall breaking experience, where the game itself is talking back to you. It wants to sleep, but you are feeling bored and need something to play.

ark:/13030/qt92k3c39f.title: Time in A Tree
ark:/13030/qt92k3c39f.description: A small child exploring their dreamscape. Encounter strange scenarios and beings that help the child move forwards.

ark:/13030/qt92m1z5vj.title: New in UCSC (Can also be called UCSC simulator)
ark:/13030/qt92m1z5vj.description: My game describes the experiences of a student without attending the orientation at the first day he arrived at the UCSC. He need to get the student ID before getting the key for his room in residential hall. Then he need to find all the classrooms for the courses he choose at the beginning of the game.

ark:/13030/qt92w1141h.title: After Sun Extinguished
ark:/13030/qt92w1141h.description: It is a linked base game talking about one's action to survive after the sun extinguished.

ark:/13030/qt931533gb.title: The Conversation
ark:/13030/qt931533gb.description: You are a hiker who unwittingly wanders into a dragon's lair, and must have a conversation with it in the hopes of convincing it to let you go. But should you do or say things that further upset the dragon, it will kill you instead. There are 8 total endings, some of them hidden.

ark:/13030/qt9360z112.title: Broadborough: Paper City
ark:/13030/qt9360z112.description: In Broadborough: Paper City, you play as a mayor trying to manage a city on the verge of ruin. Spend your weeks passing legislation, setting the budget, and listening to your advisors. If you can keep people happy and avoid all the imminent crises for 35 weeks, you win. Good luck!

ark:/13030/qt9379f3x1.title: Making friends
ark:/13030/qt9379f3x1.description: Making Friends is a comedic fiction story set at a special boat exhibit around a dock. You are on a field trip to this exhibit and visit the different boats with the goal of making friends.

ark:/13030/qt94x9j060.title: The True Adventure
ark:/13030/qt94x9j060.description: You are a knight on a quest to find the Sword of Dreams, but is that the adventure you want to be in?

ark:/13030/qt9555x1vd.title: Escape Asphodel
ark:/13030/qt9555x1vd.description: Escape Asphodel is an adventure style puzzle game where you play as a lost soul, trapped in the Underworld. You must collect artifacts of power to escape, each locked behind dangerous puzzles.

ark:/13030/qt9567c729.title: Cave Creator
ark:/13030/qt9567c729.description:
Cave Creator by Evan Pompa
Cave Creator is a text-based game where you design a dungeon for a group of adventurers. The game aims to make the user laugh. It's replay value stems from the ridiculous choices and endings the player can choose. The game has a plethora of endings with 1 true ending.

ark:/13030/qt957539hs.title: Space Castle
ark:/13030/qt957539hs.description: The player explores a castle in space.

ark:/13030/qt95b430bx.title: Bus Story
ark:/13030/qt95b430bx.description: Play as an unnamed character as they find themselves on a peculiar bus and uncover the secrets of the character and the bus driver.

ark:/13030/qt95k5s94g.title: Sir Iward's Castle Escape
ark:/13030/qt95k5s94g.description: In Sir Iward's Castle escape, the player plays as Sir Iward's who must navigate through his castle to escape a siege.

ark:/13030/qt96b4x0ds.title: The Halloween Story of Freshman Year
ark:/13030/qt96b4x0ds.description:
The Halloween Story of Freshman Year by Juan Gaito
The Halloween Story of Freshman Year is a link based game that tells the story of a freshman man in college who's girlfriend of 4+ years broke up with him 2 weeks ago over text. The story revolves around how the heartbroken male deals with his emotions on the night of Halloween. With ~46 passages and 8 possible endings The Halloween Story of Freshman Year attempts to show people that love is hard but emotions and understanding of oneself is even harder.

ark:/13030/qt96r2k2fx.title: High Thoughts
ark:/13030/qt96r2k2fx.description:
High Thoughts by Alejandro Silva.
It is a Friday afternoon and you play as a young man named Lenno. Come along in this fun adventurous journey inside Lenno's mind as you get to experience the many thoughts and actions while you're up in the clouds.

ark:/13030/qt98v379bh.title: The Lost Banana Slug
ark:/13030/qt98v379bh.description:
The Lost Banana Slug by Chelsea Lindsey
This game is about a UCSC student who wakes up in the Buddha Shrine above campus with no recollection of how they got there. They must navigate through the upper campus trails and find their way back, but all the while something just doesn't feel right...

ark:/13030/qt98v6f80h.title: Dryadalis
ark:/13030/qt98v6f80h.description: Dryadalis is a game about adventure and survival. It is a  three level based playable game. Each level contains an evil creature who will try to kill the Elf, however there will also be a good creature who will try and defend it. The mission for this game was to create a Movement-Based Game with an alternative/expansive use of logic through a fantasy-based set of ideas. We created a game that uses a fictional character, Elf, to represent the ideals of goals and responsibilities everyone has in life. However, everyone also is surrounded by good influencers and bad influencers. Therefore, Dryadalis represents why it is important to keep accepting help from good influencers and fight bad ones away. The player will have the control to move the Elf away/towards danger while also fighting back.

ark:/13030/qt98w673ph.title: March 29th, 2:37 AM
ark:/13030/qt98w673ph.description:
March 29th, 2:37 AM by Molly Thompson
You are a grad student working your first internship
Strange photos of UFOs start popping up on social media.

An exploration of the apocalypse.

ark:/13030/qt99b387xq.title: The Dark Passenger
ark:/13030/qt99b387xq.description: The Dark Passenger is a  comedic link based story about a man driven by initially unknown forces to escape solitude and experience freedom. The player's decision making impacts the events experienced, with clues about the history of the prisoner given throughout the story.

ark:/13030/qt99c303jv.title: Untitled Hero Story
ark:/13030/qt99c303jv.description: In a world full of incredible superheroes, and dastardly villains you play as an up and coming hero. The problem is, the power you got is super dumb and nobody really takes you seriously. That's why you have to show them what you can do! Play through a variety of missions with one of three different superpowers. Can you become a respected hero?

ark:/13030/qt9b41q224.title: A new game
ark:/13030/qt9b41q224.description: A player entered a new game and try to figure out how to be good in this game.

ark:/13030/qt9bg9t619.title: Animals vs. Supernaturals
ark:/13030/qt9bg9t619.description: Animals vs. Supernaturals is reimplementation of Plants vs. Zombies, where the game does not end. You attempt to get a new high score by defeating waves of super naturals using the animals on the field. You collect eggs and use those eggs to buy animals to place on the field.

ark:/13030/qt9bs6s7qf.title: Kevin's Day Out
ark:/13030/qt9bs6s7qf.description:
Kevin's Day Out by Aarushi Bajaj
You are a young golden retriever with a loving 24 year old owner in New York City. On a bright sunny day at the dog park, you loose your way around the city. Will you make the right decisions to make your way back to your owner? You will be given a series of options and get to explore the chaotic beauty of the city. A narrative adventure game with a range of interesting endings.

ark:/13030/qt9c31f3hj.title: Be Wary of the Fire
ark:/13030/qt9c31f3hj.description: In Be Wary of the Fire, you play as someone trying to escape their apartment complex when it suddenly catches on fire. Make choices wisely because all of them will count in one way or another. Can you make it out alive?

ark:/13030/qt9d37c38k.title: Where Are The Victims?
ark:/13030/qt9d37c38k.description: You are going into a serial killer's inner mind as a police officer, you need to find out the answers through exploring the serial killer's inner mind.

ark:/13030/qt9dd4s6fr.title: Don't Get Caught
ark:/13030/qt9dd4s6fr.description:
Don't Get Caught by Daniel Chang
Don't Get Caught is a fictional narrative in the perspective of a high school student. The character is coming home drunk and late on a school night. He/she must make the right
choices in order to not be caught by the mom.

ark:/13030/qt9dg1k5m8.title: Tron: Health Systems
ark:/13030/qt9dg1k5m8.description: Tron: Health Systems is a reskin of the original Tron arcade game. However, it takes place inside the mind of someone with mental health issues. The payer must navigate through their though process and decide how to collect as many eyes as possible.

ark:/13030/qt9dz9k52f.title: Road
ark:/13030/qt9dz9k52f.description: Its a game about a chicken crossing the road

ark:/13030/qt9f61k21m.title: Two Beings
ark:/13030/qt9f61k21m.description: A psychological horror game involving an amnesiac's desire to escape a hospital and the realization of who he is.

ark:/13030/qt9fn7760m.title: Wonko's Cave
ark:/13030/qt9fn7760m.description: Wonko's cave is an adventure in which you take the role of a worker at Wonko's Mining Industries in which you explore a cave to bring back magical crystals, with many different paths from goofing off with your friends to finding hidden passages.

ark:/13030/qt9gw3q80z.title: GlassCannon
ark:/13030/qt9gw3q80z.description: GlassCannon is a 2D movement-based platformer where you help Glassy reach the top of Mine Mountain using explosive cannon jumps. Maneuver through 18 different levels using Glassy's bombs and explosions to reach the mines' flags at the end of them but be careful each Glassy is made of glass so spikes, mines, and explosions will break them if you are not too careful or precise!

ark:/13030/qt9h95v6g1.title: You
ark:/13030/qt9h95v6g1.description: The game is intended to remind you to take time for yourself and take care of yourself. Life can feel hectic and unbearable, espically now, but it is important to hit pause and reset.

ark:/13030/qt9hm800dn.title: Am I Hallucinating?
ark:/13030/qt9hm800dn.description:
Am I Hallucinating? by Mrinmoyee Mishra
In this game you play as the narrator's conscience. The narrator begins hearing scratching and footsteps in the walls of their house and initially assumes they are hallucinations from insomnia. However, the narrator realizes that the suspicions of someone was living in the walls is true. As the story progresses, the player may or may not begin to doubt the innocence of the narrator. The different choices that the player makes will determine the amount of mistrust that the player develops towards the narrator. The narrator isn't given a name or a description to allow the player to project their own idea of a game protagonist.There are two different endings to this game.

ark:/13030/qt9j73p3h7.title: Big Break Shoreline
ark:/13030/qt9j73p3h7.description:
Big Break Shoreline by Tamara Muradyan
Big Break Shoreline is a simple branching narrative about an abuse victim debating on whether or not they should leave their girlfriend after she started getting physical with you. It's up to the player to either go back to their abusive household and hope they can sort things out, or make a change and finally move out. Three possible endings, one of which leading to a cat.
Content Warning: Abuse, blood, panic attacks, mentions of violence, degradation

ark:/13030/qt9jn1f41p.title: Slugzilla
ark:/13030/qt9jn1f41p.description: Play as an enormous slug rampaging the city of Santa Cruz. Cause as much chaos as possible to progress and avoid enemies trying to stop you all while visiting your favorite parts of Santa Cruz such as the UCSC campus and The Boardwalk.

ark:/13030/qt9jq0d6fp.title: Brave Fireman
ark:/13030/qt9jq0d6fp.description: The player is a fireman in the city, and his job is to put out the fire and keep the city safe. When the player enters the game, he will land on a ladder. In the game screen, there will be several houses that are on fire. As a fireman, the player needs to put out the fire for the houses in limited time. The little fireman sprite can be moved by pressing the up, left, and right buttons. Up is jump, left and right is to go left or right. The player can move and jump down or back up to the ladder. To put out the fire, the player can press space to shoot water from the squirt gun.

ark:/13030/qt9jz2q4wz.title: Warehouse Madness
ark:/13030/qt9jz2q4wz.description: Warehouse Madness is  a pinball machine style game where the player is trying to hit the ball and collect money on their way to shipping their package out of the warehouse.

ark:/13030/qt9k0298d7.title: Parallel Inception
ark:/13030/qt9k0298d7.description: A game in which you have to find the way back to your reality.

ark:/13030/qt9k99x1vg.title: I Went Walking...
ark:/13030/qt9k99x1vg.description: I Went Walking is a game about going for a walk and discovering the strange world around them.

ark:/13030/qt9mc6382j.title: Mayhem at the Mansion
ark:/13030/qt9mc6382j.description:
You have been searching for an unknown object for a long time.
The rumor is that it may be located in the Moredus Mansion.
It is time for you to venture on this heist mission where failure may bring unparalleled doom.
A story-driven infiltration or heist game.

ark:/13030/qt9md2w1sr.title: The Dive
ark:/13030/qt9md2w1sr.description: The Dive is a dungeon-exploration game in which the player takes control of a seasoned Diver, a pilot of a mighty colossus. Slay your way through layers of hell as you explore, discover secrets, and defeat bosses.

ark:/13030/qt9mg9p6d1.title: Nighttime Curiosity
ark:/13030/qt9mg9p6d1.description:
Nighttime Curiosity by Nathan Chase
You get out of bed at night because you are unable to sleep. You decide to go outside and go for a walk. The choice you make as to where you go determines what you will discover about nighttime in your city.

ark:/13030/qt9n10h8pc.title: Under the Eyes of the Gods
ark:/13030/qt9n10h8pc.description: Play as an archaeologist exploring a newly discovered Egyptian pyramid, but make sure to keep good conduct. The gods are watching.

ark:/13030/qt9pw10486.title: Boxed In
ark:/13030/qt9pw10486.description: The protagonist wakes up in a room with a cardboard box wrapped with tape. Where will constant distractions take the protagonist? How will they discover the secret of the box?

ark:/13030/qt9q42r0mt.title: Closure
ark:/13030/qt9q42r0mt.description:
Closure tells the story of an man whose wife has recently passed away.  It is a horror game with elements of deep psychological aspects such as avoidance, unhealthy coping mechanisms,  and the a positive message through out the game that shows us the brighter side of loss of life by keeping the memories living. 

It is link based game and the correct actions must be selected to make most of the game has to offer

ark:/13030/qt9q47w9n5.title: Super Waifu Simulator DX!
ark:/13030/qt9q47w9n5.description:
Basically a Twine visual novel, complete with graphics! 
First do a small questionaire to determine which girl suits you best, then attempt to woo them with your skills! Be careful, though, lest you tick her off.
Nine endings, so play through it a bundle of times!

ark:/13030/qt9r24z535.title: Chase Your Dreams
ark:/13030/qt9r24z535.description: A game about chasing your dreams, float up further into the sky as you do, but avoid running into nightmares. You'll have to choose if the pain gets too high to continue if you hit one.

ark:/13030/qt9rd7w2c6.title: Back and Forth and Back Again
ark:/13030/qt9rd7w2c6.description: Back and Forth and Back Again is a short game about one's experience with their past self in the form of a repeating dream. It's hard to accept your past self for what they were, and it's easy to get stuck in a loop of hiding from the past. This game serves as an illustration of that loop, and the difficulty of escaping it.

ark:/13030/qt9s02v256.title: S.U.R.V.I.V.E
ark:/13030/qt9s02v256.description:
S.U.R.V.I.V.E by Ariel Arriaga
S.U.R.V.I.V.E (The actual official game title was never finalized) is a Twine based game set in a post-apocalyptic world struck by a deadly spore disease. The mission, or player objective, is to survive the disease and the difficult choices it presents while making their way to a port where hope of a ship that can take them to a place untouched by the disease exists. It's a very rough and unpolished game. Although, maybe someone can take the idea and make it better.

ark:/13030/qt9th0h8c4.title: Relic
ark:/13030/qt9th0h8c4.description: You wake up alone in an empty house with a relic which your parent gave you. You need to choose whether the relic is part of a sword or a lucky coin that will lead to different stories and endings. You need to make various decisions and try to stop the conflicts between two powers called Clan and Kingdom.

ark:/13030/qt9tr317zq.title: Survival of the Fittest
ark:/13030/qt9tr317zq.description:
Survival of the Fittest by Zain Kazi
Survival of the Fittest is a game where you are dropped into the Hunger Games and need to make choices in order to survive and get out alive. You might be forced to make some hard choices or you might just end up dead.

ark:/13030/qt9tx7822g.title: The game
ark:/13030/qt9tx7822g.description:
The game by Hananiel Suradji
The game tells the story of a man who sets out to save his son from an incident that ends his life. As God has given the man a chance to enter different worlds in order to find one where his son could be found, the player must decide which worlds and who to interact with in order to get closer to their goal. Be careful where you go and what you do: It could be the last thing you do!

ark:/13030/qt9tz2v4fn.title: Void Spa
ark:/13030/qt9tz2v4fn.description:
Void Spa by Zachary Bell
Void Spa explores a science fiction cybernetic therapy service. You play as Malcolm Revers, and will go thought a session. This game aims to explore a plausible technology and one of it's applications.

ark:/13030/qt9tz5532r.title: Escape
ark:/13030/qt9tz5532r.description: Escape is a game about adventure, exploring from dangerous and get out from the trap. The player can find the keys and loot the crates to find mystery items, and support to escape from the situation. There will also be enemies that the player need to clear in order to success.

ark:/13030/qt9vn31767.title: Blind Date
ark:/13030/qt9vn31767.description:
Blind Date by Derek Ramos 
The game revolves around the player being on a blind date> in game the player will have to go through the date and choose what best dialogue to use in certain  situations and conversations. The end goal of the game is to try and whoo the girl. There are a total of 3 ending and one of those endings has 3 different versions

ark:/13030/qt9w49k62d.title: The Bachelor
ark:/13030/qt9w49k62d.description: You have been selected to be a contestant of The Bachelor and are ready to take on the first night to meet Max, the dreamy bachelor. The options presented before you will show how you would take in the experience and if the bachelor will choose to give you a rose at the end of the night. Choose wisely though, the competition could get wild...

ark:/13030/qt9wh8z827.title: Hero's Journey
ark:/13030/qt9wh8z827.description:
Hero's Journey
Hero's Journey is an interactive decision-making game where you attempt to become a hero. 
The choices you make impact the path you take and determines whether or not you end up becoming a hero.

ark:/13030/qt9wk0n6rf.title: Race Against the Clock
ark:/13030/qt9wk0n6rf.description:
Race Against the Clock by Danny Chung
The game is about a worker who recently got hired. All he has to do is make it to work on time, but he must take a different path to work everyday or he will be fired.

ark:/13030/qt9wm257dx.title: Void of the Nameless
ark:/13030/qt9wm257dx.description:
Void of the Nameless by David Diaz
Void of the Nameless tells the story of a person who is looking for their missing friend. The last time their friend was seen they were going to an island that is rumored to hold a gate to another world called the "Void of the Nameless". Inside the void, names are dangerous and if someone speaks their name out loud they could lose their identity and memories.

ark:/13030/qt9wm3k9g2.title: What Lurks in the Woods
ark:/13030/qt9wm3k9g2.description: What Lurks in the Woods is an interactive story about a Scooby-Doo-esque gang of monster hunters and their search for the Mothman. The story branches and loops in many places to present a confusing puzzle of cryptid tracking intrigue.  Decide which member of the Cryptozoology club to listen to and alter the path the gang takes to look for the mysterious creature.

ark:/13030/qt9wn9s05x.title: The Edge of Infinity
ark:/13030/qt9wn9s05x.description:
The Edge of Infinity by Matthew Hamm
You are a prisoner in a galactic prison. A strange event allows you escape on a small space ship after encountering a guard. On the ship, you experience moments where you appear to not be on the ship at all. Are they visions or are you being transported somewhere else? Can you escape from the loop you're caught in and figure out the secrets to what is happening?

ark:/13030/qt9wp7f75t.title: Lost in Sky
ark:/13030/qt9wp7f75t.description: Something went wrong for your last space travel during the WWIII and you need to find a way home.

ark:/13030/qt9xd1b1s5.title: ultimate waifu
ark:/13030/qt9xd1b1s5.description: A visual novel that explores lies and their influence on artificial relationships

ark:/13030/qt9zr3z45j.title: The Maze
ark:/13030/qt9zr3z45j.description: You are trapped in a constantly changing maze and need to find a way out.

ark:/13030/qt9zv1k66f.title: Sinner
ark:/13030/qt9zv1k66f.description: A short game that lets the player explore a dark labyrinth that is a materialization of their most inner sins. Currently, this game explores both Gluttony and Lust as sins.
